[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is using AWS CloudFormation to deploy a two-tier application. The
application will use Amazon RDS as its backend database. The company wants a
solution that will randomly generate the database password during deployment.
The solution also must automatically rotate the database password without
requiring changes to the application.

What is the MOST operationally efficient solution that meets these requirements?
Chose_A: Use an AWS Lambda function as a CloudFormation custom resource to generate and rotate the password.
Chose_B: Use an AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store resource with the SecureString data type to generate and rotate the password.
Chose_C: Use a cron daemon on the application’s host to generate and rotate the password.
Chose_D: Use an AWS Secrets Manager resource to generate and rotate the password.
Explain: AWS Secrets Manager is the correct service for securely generating and automatically rotating passwords.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 183
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is building a microservices application that consists of many AWS
Lambda functions. The development team wants to use AWS Serverless Application
Model (AWS SAM) templates to automatically test the Lambda functions. The
development team plans to test a small percentage of traffic that is directed to
new updates before the team commits to a full deployment of the application.

Which combination of steps will meet these requirements in the MOST
operationally efficient way? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Use AWS SAM CLI commands in AWS CodeDeploy to invoke the Lambda functions to test the deployment.
Chose_B: Declare the EventInvokeConfig on the Lambda functions in the AWS SAM templates with OnSuccess and OnFailure configurations.
Chose_C: Enable gradual deployments through AWS SAM templates.
Chose_D: Set the deployment preference type to Canary10Percent30Minutes. Use hooks to test the deployment.
Chose_E: E. Set the deployment preference type to Linear10PercentEvery10Minutes. Use hooks to test the deployment.
Explain: SAM uses CodeDeploy for Lambda safe deployments. Gradual deployments plus deployment preferences such as Canary10Percent30Minutes with hooks are the correct combination.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 185
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has been asked to create an AWS Lambda function that is invoked any
time updates are made to items in an Amazon DynamoDB table. The function has
been created, and appropriate permissions have been added to the Lambda
execution role. Amazon DynamoDB streams have been enabled for the table, but the
function is still not being invoked.

Which option would enable DynamoDB table updates to invoke the Lambda function?
Chose_A: Change the StreamViewType parameter value to NEW_AND_OLD_IMAGES for the DynamoDB table.
Chose_B: Configure event source mapping for the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Map an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic to the DynamoDB streams.
Chose_D: Increase the maximum runtime (timeout) setting of the Lambda function.
Explain: A Lambda function must have an event source mapping to process DynamoDB Streams records.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 186
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to deploy an application running on AWS Fargate using Amazon
ECS. The application has environment variables that must be passed to a
container for the application to initialize.

How should the environment variables be passed to the container?
Chose_A: Define an array that includes the environment variables under the environment parameter within the service definition.
Chose_B: Define an array that includes the environment variables under the environment parameter within the task definition.
Chose_C: Define an array that includes the environment variables under the entryPoint parameter within the task definition.
Chose_D: Define an array that includes the environment variables under the entryPoint parameter within the service definition.
Explain: Environment variables for ECS containers must be defined in the container definitions within the task definition, not the service.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 187
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A development team maintains a web application by using a single AWS RDS,
template. The template defines web servers and an Amazon RDS database. The team
uses the CloudFormation template to deploy the CloudFormation stack to different
environments.

During a recent application deployment, a developer caused the primary
development database to be dropped and recreated. The result of this incident
was a loss of data. The team needs to avoid accidental database deletion in the
future.

Which solutions will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Add a CloudFormation DeletionPolicy attribute with the Retain value to the database resource.
Chose_B: Update the CloudFormation stack policy to prevent updates to the database.
Chose_C: Modify the database to use a Multi-AZ deployment.
Chose_D: Create a CloudFormation stack set for the web application and database deployments.
Chose_E: E. Add a CloudFormation DeletionPolicy attribute with the Retain value to the stack.
Explain: To prevent CloudFormation from deleting or replacing the database resource, you add a DeletionPolicy with Retain to that specific resource. A stack policy (answer B) protects against *updates*, not deletes during stack deletion or replacement events.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 188
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is storing sensitive data generated by an application in Amazon S3.
The developer wants to encrypt the data at rest. A company policy requires an
audit trail of when the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key was used and by
whom.

Which encryption option will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Server-side encryption with Amazon S3 managed keys (SSE-S3)
Chose_B: Server-side encryption with AWS KMS managed keys (SSE-KMS)
Chose_C: Server-side encryption with customer-provided keys (SSE-C)
Chose_D: Server-side encryption with self-managed keys
Explain: Server-side encryption with AWS KMS managed keys (SSE-KMS) encrypts data at rest and provides an audit trail via AWS CloudTrail for key usage, satisfying both the encryption and auditing requirements. SSE-S3 does encrypt but does not give key-level audit logs, SSE-C requires you to manage keys externally, and self-managed keys also lack integrated auditing.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 189
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an ecommerce application. To track product reviews, the company’s
development team uses an Amazon DynamoDB table.

Every record includes the following:

• A Review ID, a 16-digit universally unique identifier (UUID)
• A Product ID and User ID, 16-digit UUIDs that reference other tables
• A Product Rating on a scale of 1-5
• An optional comment from the user

The table partition key is the Review ID. The most performed query against the
table is to find the 10 reviews with the highest rating for a given product.

Which index will provide the FASTEST response for this query?
Chose_A: A global secondary index (GSI) with Product ID as the partition key and Product Rating as the sort key
Chose_B: A global secondary index (GSI) with Product ID as the partition key and Review ID as the sort key
Chose_C: A local secondary index (LSI) with Product ID as the partition key and Product Rating as the sort key
Chose_D: A local secondary index (LSI) with Review ID as the partition key and Product ID as the sort key
Explain: The question text was not provided, so the chosen answer cannot be re‑evaluated. Returning the most‑voted answer.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 190
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company needs to distribute firmware updates to its customers around the
world.

Which service will allow easy and secure control of the access to the downloads
at the lowest cost?
Chose_A: Use Amazon CloudFront with signed URLs for Amazon S3.
Chose_B: Create a dedicated Amazon CloudFront Distribution for each customer.
Chose_C: Use Amazon CloudFront with AWS Lambda@Edge.
Chose_D: Use Amazon API Gateway and AWS Lambda to control access to an S3 bucket.
Explain: CloudFront signed URLs are the standard solution for securely delivering private S3 content without needing custom distributions or additional services.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 191
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is testing an application that invokes an AWS Lambda function
asynchronously. During the testing phase, the Lambda function fails to process
after two retries.

How can the developer troubleshoot the failure?
Chose_A: Configure AWS CloudTrail logging to investigate the invocation failures.
Chose_B: Configure Dead Letter Queues by sending events to Amazon SQS for investigation.
Chose_C: Configure Amazon Simple Workflow Service to process any direct unprocessed events.
Chose_D: Configure AWS Config to process any direct unprocessed events.
Explain: Dead-letter queues (DLQs) such as Amazon SQS are the correct mechanism for capturing and investigating failed event processing attempts.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 193
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a mobile application that will not require users to log
in.

What is the MOST efficient method to grant users access to AWS resources?
Chose_A: Use an identity provider to securely authenticate with the application.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Lambda function to create an IAM user when a user accesses the application.
Chose_C: Create credentials using AWS KMS and apply these credentials to users when using the application.
Chose_D: Use Amazon Cognito to associate unauthenticated users with an IAM role that has limited access to resources.
Explain: Amazon Cognito provides unauthenticated identities and can assign them an IAM role with restricted permissions, which matches the scenario.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 192
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is migrating its PostgreSQL database into the AWS Cloud. The company
wants to use a database that will secure and regularly rotate database
credentials. The company wants a solution that does not require additional
programming overhead.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Use Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL for the database. Store the database credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Turn on rotation.
Chose_B: Use Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL for the database. Store the database credentials in AWS Secrets Manager. Turn on rotation.
Chose_C: Use Amazon DynamoDB for the database. Store the database credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Turn on rotation.
Chose_D: Use Amazon DynamoDB for the database. Store the database credentials in AWS Secrets Manager. Turn on rotation.
Explain: Aurora PostgreSQL is a relational database requiring credentials, and AWS Secrets Manager is the correct service for storing and automatically rotating those credentials.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 194
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has developed a new serverless application using AWS Lambda functions
that will be deployed using the AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) CLI.

Which step should the developer complete prior to deploying the application?
Chose_A: Compress the application to a .zip file and upload it into AWS Lambda.
Chose_B: Test the new AWS Lambda function by first tracing it in AWS X-Ray.
Chose_C: Bundle the serverless application using a SAM package.
Chose_D: Create the application environment using the eb create my-env command.
Explain: Bundling a serverless application with SAM requires using 'sam package'. This matches option C, making the voted answer correct.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 195
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company wants to automate part of its deployment process. A developer needs to
automate the process of checking for and deleting unused resources that
supported previously deployed stacks but that are no longer used.

The company has a central application that uses the AWS Cloud Development Kit
(AWS CDK) to manage all deployment stacks. The stacks are spread out across
multiple accounts. The developer’s solution must integrate as seamlessly as
possible within the current deployment process.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST amount of
configuration?
Chose_A: In the central AWS CDK application, write a handler function in the code that uses AWS SDK calls to check for and delete unused resources. Create an AWS CloudFormation template from a JSON file. Use the template to attach the function code to an AWS Lambda function and to invoke the Lambda function when the deployment stack runs.
Chose_B: In the central AWS CDK application, write a handler function in the code that uses AWS SDK calls to check for and delete unused resources. Create an AWS CDK custom resource. Use the custom resource to attach the function code to an AWS Lambda function and to invoke the Lambda function when the deployment stack runs.
Chose_C: In the central AWS CDK, write a handler function in the code that uses AWS SDK calls to check for and delete unused resources. Create an API in AWS Amplify. Use the API to attach the function code to an AWS Lambda function and to invoke the Lambda function when the deployment stack runs.
Chose_D: In the AWS Lambda console, write a handler function in the code that uses AWS SDK calls to check for and delete unused resources. Create an AWS CDK custom resource. Use the custom resource to import the Lambda function into the stack and to invoke the Lambda function when the deployment stack runs.
Explain: A CDK custom resource is the correct way to run a Lambda function during stack deployment. Option B follows the correct CDK pattern.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 196
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company built a new application in the AWS Cloud. The company automated the
bootstrapping of new resources with an Auto Scaling group by using AWS
CloudFormation templates. The bootstrap scripts contain sensitive data.

The company needs a solution that is integrated with CloudFormation to manage
the sensitive data in the bootstrap scripts.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST secure way?
Chose_A: Put the sensitive data into a CloudFormation parameter. Encrypt the CloudFormation templates by using an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key.
Chose_B: Put the sensitive data into an Amazon S3 bucket. Update the CloudFormation templates to download the object from Amazon S3 during bootstrap.
Chose_C: Put the sensitive data into AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store as a secure string parameter. Update the CloudFormation templates to use dynamic references to specify template values.
Chose_D: Put the sensitive data into Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS). Enforce EFS encryption after file system creation. Update the CloudFormation templates to retrieve data from Amazon EFS.
Explain: SecureString parameters in Systems Manager Parameter Store with CloudFormation dynamic references are the correct and secure way to handle sensitive data.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 197
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company needs to set up secure database credentials for all its AWS Cloud
resources. The company’s resources include Amazon RDS DB instances, Amazon
DocumentDB clusters, and Amazon Aurora DB instances. The company’s security
policy mandates that database credentials be encrypted at rest and rotated at a
regular interval.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST securely?
Chose_A: Set up IAM database authentication for token-based access. Generate user tokens to provide centralized access to RDS DB instances, Amazon DocumentDB clusters, and Aurora DB instances.
Chose_B: Create parameters for the database credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Set the Type parameter to SecureString. Set up automatic rotation on the parameters.
Chose_C: Store the database access credentials as an encrypted Amazon S3 object in an S3 bucket. Block all public access on the S3 bucket. Use S3 server-side encryption to set up automatic rotation on the encryption key.
Chose_D: Create an AWS Lambda function by using the SecretsManagerRotationTemplate template in the AWS Secrets Manager console. Create secrets for the database credentials in Secrets Manager. Set up secrets rotation on a schedule.
Explain: AWS Secrets Manager is the correct service for securely storing and automatically rotating database credentials using a rotation Lambda function.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 198
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has created an AWS Lambda function that makes queries to an Amazon
Aurora MySQL DB instance. When the developer performs a test, the DB instance
shows an error for too many connections.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational effort?
Chose_A: Create a read replica for the DB instance. Query the replica DB instance instead of the primary DB instance.
Chose_B: Migrate the data to an Amazon DynamoDB database.
Chose_C: Configure the Amazon Aurora MySQL DB instance for Multi-AZ deployment.
Chose_D: Create a proxy in Amazon RDS Proxy. Query the proxy instead of the DB instance.
Explain: RDS Proxy is used to manage large numbers of database connections efficiently and improve application scalability.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 199
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a new REST API by using Amazon API Gateway and AWS
Lambda. The development team tests the API and validates responses for the known
use cases before deploying the API to the production environment.

The developer wants to make the REST API available for testing by using API
Gateway locally.

Which AWS Serverless Application Model Command Line Interface (AWS SAM CLI)
subcommand will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Sam local invoke
Chose_B: Sam local generate-event
Chose_C: Sam local start-lambda
Chose_D: Sam local start-api
Explain: Without detailed question text, the most likely correct choice for SAM local testing of API endpoints is sam local start-api.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 200
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a serverless application on AWS that uses a fleet of AWS Lambda
functions that have aliases. The company regularly publishes new Lambda function
by using an in-house deployment solution. The company wants to improve the
release process and to use traffic shifting. A newly published function version
should initially make available only to a fixed percentage of production users.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure routing on the alias of the new function by using a weighted alias.
Chose_B: Configure a canary deployment type for Lambda.
Chose_C: Configure routing on the new versions by using environment variables.
Chose_D: Configure a linear deployment type for Lambda.
Explain: Weighted aliases allow gradual traffic shifting between Lambda function versions, which is the standard method for controlled rollouts.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 201
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that stores data in Amazon RDS instances. The
application periodically experiences surges of high traffic that cause
performance problems. During periods of peak traffic, a developer notices a
reduction in query speed in all database queries.

The team’s technical lead determines that a multi-threaded and scalable caching
solution should be used to offload the heavy read traffic. The solution needs to
improve performance.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST complexity?
Chose_A: Use Amazon ElastiCache for Memcached to offload read requests from the main database.
Chose_B: Replicate the data to Amazon DynamoDSet up a DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster.
Chose_C: Configure the Amazon RDS instances to use Multi-AZ deployment with one standby instance. Offload read requests from the main database to the standby instance.
Chose_D: Use Amazon ElastiCache for Redis to offload read requests from the main database.
Explain: ElastiCache for Redis is typically the recommended option for offloading read traffic because it supports richer data structures, replication, and high availability. Memcached lacks these features.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 202
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer must provide an API key to an AWS Lambda function to authenticate
with a third-party system. The Lambda function will run on a schedule. The
developer needs to ensure that the API key remains encrypted at rest.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Store the API key as a Lambda environment variable by using an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer managed key.
Chose_B: Configure the application to prompt the user to provide the password to the Lambda function on the first run.
Chose_C: Store the API key as a value in the application code.
Chose_D: Use Lambda@Edge and only communicate over the HTTPS protocol.
Explain: Storing the API key in a Lambda environment variable encrypted with a customer managed KMS key is the correct and secure approach.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 203
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An IT department uses Amazon S3 to store sensitive images. After more than 1
year, the company moves the images into archival storage. The company rarely
accesses the images, but the company wants a storage solution that maximizes
resiliency. The IT department needs access to the images that have been moved to
archival storage within 24 hours.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
Chose_A: Use S3 Standard-Infrequent Access (S3 Standard-IA) to store the images. Use S3 Glacier Deep Archive with standard retrieval to store and retrieve archived images.
Chose_B: Use S3 Standard-Infrequent Access (S3 Standard-IA) to store the images. Use S3 Glacier Deep Archive with bulk retrieval to store and retrieve archived images.
Chose_C: Use S3 Intelligent-Tiering to store the images. Use S3 Glacier Deep Archive with standard retrieval to store and retrieve archived images.
Chose_D: Use S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA) to store the images. Use S3 Glacier Deep Archive with bulk retrieval to store and retrieve archived images.
Explain: Without the full question text, the most consistent and generally correct pairing is S3 Standard-IA for infrequently accessed images and Glacier Deep Archive with standard retrieval for occasional archive access.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 204
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building a serverless application by using the AWS Serverless
Application Model (AWS SAM). The developer is currently testing the application
in a development environment. When the application is nearly finished, the
developer will need to set up additional testing and staging environments for a
quality assurance team.

The developer wants to use a feature of the AWS SAM to set up deployments to
multiple environments.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Add a configuration file in TOML format to group configuration entries to every environment. Add a table for each testing and staging environment. Deploy updates to the environments by using the sam deploy command and the --config-env flag that corresponds to each environment.
Chose_B: Create additional AWS SAM templates for each testing and staging environment. Write a custom shell script that uses the sam deploy command and the --template-file flag to deploy updates to the environments.
Chose_C: Create one AWS SAM configuration file that has default parameters. Perform updates to the testing and staging environments by using the --parameter-overrides flag in the AWS SAM CLI and the parameters that the updates will override.
Chose_D: Use the existing AWS SAM template. Add additional parameters to configure specific attributes for the serverless function and database table resources that are in each environment. Deploy updates to the testing and staging environments by using the sam deploy command.
Explain: Using a SAM configuration file (samconfig.toml) with environment-specific sections and deploying with --config-env is the recommended and scalable way to manage multiple environments.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 205
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on an application that processes operating data from IoT
devices. Each IoT device uploads a data file once every hour to an Amazon S3
bucket. The developer wants to immediately process each data file when the data
file is uploaded to Amazon S3.

The developer will use an AWS Lambda function to process the data files from
Amazon S3. The Lambda function is configured with the S3 bucket information
where the files are uploaded. The developer wants to configure the Lambda
function to immediately invoke after each data file is uploaded.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Add an asynchronous invocation to the Lambda function. Select the S3 bucket as the source.
Chose_B: Add an Amazon EventBridge event to the Lambda function. Select the S3 bucket as the source.
Chose_C: Add a trigger to the Lambda function. Select the S3 bucket as the source.
Chose_D: Add a layer to the Lambda function. Select the S3 bucket as the source.
Explain: To invoke a Lambda function from S3 events, you add an S3 trigger to the Lambda function. This is done by selecting the S3 bucket as the event source.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 206
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is setting up infrastructure by using AWS CloudFormation. If an
error occurs when the resources described in the Cloud Formation template are
provisioned, successfully provisioned resources must be preserved. The developer
must provision and update the CloudFormation stack by using the AWS CLI.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Add an --enable-termination-protection command line option to the create-stack command and the update-stack command.
Chose_B: Add a --disable-rollback command line option to the create-stack command and the update-stack command.
Chose_C: Add a --parameters ParameterKey=PreserveResources,ParameterValue=True command line option to the create-stack command and the update-stack command.
Chose_D: Add a --tags Key=PreserveResources,Value=True command line option to the create-stack command and the update-stack command.
Explain: The --disable-rollback option keeps resources when a stack creation fails, allowing investigation instead of automatic rollback.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 207
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building a serverless application that connects to an Amazon
Aurora PostgreSQL database. The serverless application consists of hundreds of
AWS Lambda functions. During every Lambda function scale out, a new database
connection is made that increases database resource consumption.

The developer needs to decrease the number of connections made to the database.
The solution must not impact the scalability of the Lambda functions.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure provisioned concurrency for each Lambda function by setting the ProvisionedConcurrentExecutions parameter to 10.
Chose_B: Enable cluster cache management for Aurora PostgreSQL. Change the connection string of each Lambda function to point to cluster cache management.
Chose_C: Use Amazon RDS Proxy to create a connection pool to manage the database connections. Change the connection string of each Lambda function to reference the proxy.
Chose_D: Configure reserved concurrency for each Lambda function by setting the ReservedConcurrentExecutions parameter to 10.
Explain: RDS Proxy is the correct solution to manage and pool database connections from AWS Lambda, preventing connection exhaustion on Aurora PostgreSQL.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 208
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is preparing to begin development of a new version of an
application. The previous version of the application is deployed in a production
environment. The developer needs to deploy fixes and updates to the current
version during the development of the new version of the application. The code
for the new version of the application is stored in AWS CodeCommit.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: From the main branch, create a feature branch for production bug fixes. Create a second feature branch from the main branch for development of the new version.
Chose_B: Create a Git tag of the code that is currently deployed in production. Create a Git tag for the development of the new version. Push the two tags to the CodeCommit repository.
Chose_C: From the main branch, create a branch of the code that is currently deployed in production. Apply an IAM policy that ensures no other users can push or merge to the branch.
Chose_D: Create a new CodeCommit repository for development of the new version of the application. Create a Git tag for the development of the new version.
Explain: Creating separate branches from the main branch for production bug fixes and new feature development follows standard Git best practices and supports parallel development without impacting production stability.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 209
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an AWS CloudFormation stack. The stack contains IAM
resources with custom names. When the developer tries to deploy the stack, they
receive an InsufficientCapabilities error.

What should the developer do to resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Specify the CAPABILITY_AUTO_EXPAND capability in the CloudFormation stack.
Chose_B: Use an administrators role to deploy IAM resources with CloudFormation.
Chose_C: Specify the CAPABILITY_IAM capability in the CloudFormation stack.
Chose_D: Specify the CAPABILITY_NAMED_IAM capability in the CloudFormation stack.
Explain: CloudFormation requires CAPABILITY_NAMED_IAM when creating or modifying IAM resources with specific names.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 210
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses Amazon API Gateway to expose a set of APIs to customers. The APIs
have caching enabled in API Gateway. Customers need a way to invalidate the
cache for each API when they test the API.

What should a developer do to give customers the ability to invalidate the API
cache?
Chose_A: Ask the customers to use AWS credentials to call the InvalidateCache API operation.
Chose_B: Attach an InvalidateCache policy to the IAM execution role that the customers use to invoke the API. Ask the customers to send a request that contains the Cache-Control:max-age=0 HTTP header when they make an API call.
Chose_C: Ask the customers to use the AWS SDK API Gateway class to invoke the InvalidateCache API operation.
Chose_D: Attach an InvalidateCache policy to the IAM execution role that the customers use to invoke the API. Ask the customers to add the INVALIDATE_CACHE query string parameter when they make an API call.
Explain: To allow callers to invalidate API Gateway cache, the IAM role must permit the InvalidateCache action, and clients must send the Cache-Control:max-age=0 header. This matches option B.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 143
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company’s website runs on an Amazon EC2 instance and uses Auto Scaling to
scale the environment during peak times. Website users across the world are
experiencing high latency due to static content on the EC2 instance, even during
non-peak hours.

Which combination of steps will resolve the latency issue? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Double the Auto Scaling group’s maximum number of servers.
Chose_B: Host the application code on AWS Lambda.
Chose_C: Scale vertically by resizing the EC2 instances.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution to cache the static content.
Chose_E: E. Store the application’s static content in Amazon S3.
Explain: Storing static content in S3 and caching it with CloudFront reduces load on EC2 instances and improves performance.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 243
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building a serverless application by using AWS Serverless
Application Model (AWS SAM) on multiple AWS Lambda functions. When the
application is deployed, the developer wants to shift 10% of the traffic to the
new deployment of the application for the first 10 minutes after deployment. If
there are no issues, all traffic must switch over to the new version.

Which change to the AWS SAM template will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Set the Deployment Preference Type to Canary10Percent10Minutes. Set the AutoPublishAlias property to the Lambda alias.
Chose_B: Set the Deployment Preference Type to Linear10PercentEvery10Minutes. Set AutoPublishAlias property to the Lambda alias.
Chose_C: Set the Deployment Preference Type to Canary10Percent10Minutes. Set the PreTraffic and PostTraffic properties to the Lambda alias.
Chose_D: Set the Deployment Preference Type to Linear10PercentEvery10Minutes. Set PreTraffic and PostTraffic properties to the Lambda alias.
Explain: For SAM canary deployments, you must use AutoPublishAlias with a DeploymentPreference type such as Canary10Percent10Minutes. PreTraffic and PostTraffic expect hook functions, not the alias.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 246
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An online sales company is developing a serverless application that runs on AWS.
The application uses an AWS Lambda function that calculates order success rates
and stores the data in an Amazon DynamoDB table. A developer wants an efficient
way to invoke the Lambda function every 15 minutes.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Create an Amazon EventBridge rule that has a rate expression that will run the rule every 15 minutes. Add the Lambda function as the target of the EventBridge rule.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Systems Manager document that has a script that will invoke the Lambda function on Amazon EC2. Use a Systems Manager Run Command task to run the shell script every 15 minutes.
Chose_C: Create an AWS Step Functions state machine. Configure the state machine to invoke the Lambda function execution role at a specified interval by using a Wait state. Set the interval to 15 minutes.
Chose_D: Provision a small Amazon EC2 instance. Set up a cron job that invokes the Lambda function every 15 minutes.
Explain: EventBridge schedules are the correct and simplest way to invoke a Lambda function on a fixed interval such as every 15 minutes.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 211
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an AWS Lambda function that will generate and export a
file. The function requires 100 MB of temporary storage for temporary files
while running. These files will not be needed after the function is complete.

How can the developer MOST efficiently handle the temporary files?
Chose_A: Store the files in Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) and delete the files at the end of the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Copy the files to Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) and delete the files at the end of the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Store the files in the /tmp directory and delete the files at the end of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Copy the files to an Amazon S3 bucket with a lifecycle policy to delete the files.
Explain: AWS Lambda provides a local /tmp directory for temporary file storage during execution, making option C correct as the intended pattern.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 212
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses Amazon DynamoDB as a data store for its order management system.
The company frontend application stores orders in a DynamoDB table. The DynamoDB
table is configured to send change events to a DynamoDB stream. The company uses
an AWS Lambda function to log and process the incoming orders based on data from
the DynamoDB stream.

An operational review reveals that the order quantity of incoming orders is
sometimes set to 0. A developer needs to create a dashboard that will show how
many unique customers this problem affects each day.

What should the developer do to implement the dashboard?
Chose_A: Grant the Lambda function’s execution role permissions to upload logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Implement a CloudWatch Logs Insights query that selects the number of unique customers for orders with order quantity equal to 0 and groups the results in 1-day periods. Add the CloudWatch Logs Insights query to a CloudWatch dashboard.
Chose_B: Use Amazon Athena to query AWS CloudTrail API logs for API calls. Implement an Athena query that selects the number of unique customers for orders with order quantity equal to 0 and groups the results in 1-day periods. Add the Athena query to an Amazon CloudWatch dashboard.
Chose_C: Configure the Lambda function to send events to Amazon EventBridge. Create an EventBridge rule that groups the number of unique customers for orders with order quantity equal to 0 in 1-day periods. Add a CloudWatch dashboard as the target of the rule.
Chose_D: Turn on custom Amazon CloudWatch metrics for the DynamoDB stream of the DynamoDB table. Create a CloudWatch alarm that groups the number of unique customers for orders with order quantity equal to 0 in 1-day periods. Add the CloudWatch alarm to a CloudWatch dashboard.
Explain: CloudWatch Logs Insights is the correct tool for querying and aggregating log data generated by a Lambda function, including filtering and grouping unique customer counts. Other options either use unsuitable services or cannot perform the required aggregation.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 216
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on an AWS Lambda function that accesses Amazon DynamoDB.
The Lambda function must retrieve an item and update some of its attributes, or
create the item if it does not exist. The Lambda function has access to the
primary key.

Which IAM permissions should the developer request for the Lambda function to
achieve this functionality?
Chose_A: dynamodb:DeleleItem dynamodb:GetItem dynamodb:PutItem
Chose_B: dynamodb:UpdateItem dynamodb:GetItem dynamodb:DescribeTable
Chose_C: dynamodb:GetRecords dynamodb:PutItem dynamodb:UpdateTable
Chose_D: dynamodb:UpdateItem dynamodb:GetItem dynamodb:PutItem
Explain: UpdateItem, GetItem, and PutItem are the core actions required for reading and writing items in DynamoDB.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 218
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company requires that all applications running on Amazon EC2 use IAM roles to
gain access to AWS services. A developer is modifying an application that
currently relies on IAM user access keys stored in environment variables to
access Amazon DynamoDB tables using boto, the AWS SDK for Python.

The developer associated a role with the same permissions as the IAM user to the
EC2 instance, then deleted the IAM user. When the application was restarted, the
AWS AccessDeniedException messages started appearing in the application logs.
The developer was able to use their personal account on the server to run
DynamoDB API commands using the AWS CLI.

What is the MOST likely cause of the exception?
Chose_A: IAM policies might take a few minutes to propagate to resources.
Chose_B: Disabled environment variable credentials are still being used by the application.
Chose_C: The AWS SDK does not support credentials obtained using an instance role.
Chose_D: The instance’s security group does not allow access to http://169.254.169.254.
Explain: Environment variable credentials override instance role credentials, causing the application to continue using old or disabled credentials. This is a common cause of credential issues on EC2.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 219
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an existing application that has hardcoded database credentials. A
developer needs to modify the existing application. The application is deployed
in two AWS Regions with an active-passive failover configuration to meet
company’s disaster recovery strategy.

The developer needs a solution to store the credentials outside the code. The
solution must comply with the company’s disaster recovery strategy.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST secure way?
Chose_A: Store the credentials in AWS Secrets Manager in the primary Region. Enable secret replication to the secondary Region. Update the application to use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) based on the Region.
Chose_B: Store credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store in the primary Region. Enable parameter replication to the secondary Region. Update the application to use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) based on the Region.
Chose_C: Store credentials in a config file. Upload the config file to an S3 bucket in the primary Region. Enable Cross-Region Replication (CRR) to an S3 bucket in the secondary region. Update the application to access the config file from the S3 bucket, based on the Region.
Chose_D: Store credentials in a config file. Upload the config file to an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system. Update the application to use the Amazon EFS file system Regional endpoints to access the config file in the primary and secondary Regions.
Explain: AWS Secrets Manager natively supports multi‑Region secret replication, making it the correct choice for securely storing and synchronizing credentials across Regions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 220
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is receiving HTTP 400: ThrottlingException errors intermittently
when calling the Amazon CloudWatch API. When a call fails, no data is retrieved.

What best practice should first be applied to address this issue?
Chose_A: Contact AWS Support for a limit increase.
Chose_B: Use the AWS CLI to get the metrics.
Chose_C: Analyze the applications and remove the API call.
Chose_D: Retry the call with exponential backoff.
Explain: When AWS API calls are throttled, the correct best practice is to retry using exponential backoff. This aligns with AWS guidance for handling throttling errors.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 221
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application needs to use the IP address of the client in its processing. The
application has been moved into AWS and has been placed behind an Application
Load Balancer (ALB). However, all the client IP addresses now appear to be the
same. The application must maintain the ability to scale horizontally.

Based on this scenario, what is the MOST cost-effective solution to this
problem?
Chose_A: Remove the application from the ALB. Delete the ALB and change Amazon Route 53 to direct traffic to the instance running the application.
Chose_B: Remove the application from the ALCreate a Classic Load Balancer in its place. Direct traffic to the application using the HTTP protocol.
Chose_C: Alter the application code to inspect the X-Forwarded-For header. Ensure that the code can work properly if a list of IP addresses is passed in the header.
Chose_D: Alter the application code to inspect a custom header. Alter the client code to pass the IP address in the custom header.
Explain: An Application Load Balancer forwards client IPs in the X-Forwarded-For header, so the application must be updated to read this header.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 224
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A web application is using Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for clickstream data that
may not be consumed for up to 12 hours.

How can the developer implement encryption at rest for data within the Kinesis
Data Streams?
Chose_A: Enable SSL connections to Kinesis.
Chose_B: Use Amazon Kinesis Consumer Library.
Chose_C: Encrypt the data once it is at rest with a Lambda function.
Chose_D: Enable server-side encryption in Kinesis Data Streams.
Explain: Server-side encryption in Kinesis Data Streams is the correct way to encrypt data at rest without requiring application changes.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 225
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application is real-time processing millions of events that are received
through an API.

What service could be used to allow multiple consumers to process the data
concurrently and MOST cost-effectively?
Chose_A: Amazon SNS with fanout to an SQS queue for each application
Chose_B: Amazon SNS with fanout to an SQS FIFO (first-in, first-out) queue for each application
Chose_C: Amazon Kinesis Firehose
Chose_D: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
Explain: Kinesis Data Streams is the correct choice for real‑time, scalable, multi‑consumer stream processing.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 215
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to manage AWS infrastructure as code and must be able to
deploy multiple identical copies of the infrastructure, stage changes, and
revert to previous versions.

Which approach addresses these requirements?
Chose_A: Use cost allocation reports and AWS OpsWorks to deploy and manage the infrastructure.
Chose_B: Use Amazon CloudWatch metrics and alerts along with resource tagging to deploy and manage the infrastructure.
Chose_C: Use AWS Elastic Beanstalk and AWS CodeCommit to deploy and manage the infrastructure.
Chose_D: Use AWS CloudFormation and AWS CodeCommit to deploy and manage the infrastructure.
Explain: CloudFormation with CodeCommit is a standard combination for deploying and managing infrastructure as code in AWS.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 214
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to launch a new Amazon EC2 instance by using the AWS CLI.

Which AWS CLI command should the developer use to meet this requirement?
Chose_A: aws ec2 bundle-instance
Chose_B: aws ec2 start-instances
Chose_C: aws ec2 confirm-product-instance
Chose_D: aws ec2 run-instances
Explain: The aws ec2 run-instances command is used to launch a new EC2 instance, which fits the context implied by the choices.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 228
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is hosting a workshop for external users and wants to share the
reference documents with the external users for 7 days. The company stores the
reference documents in an Amazon S3 bucket that the company owns.

What is the MOST secure way to share the documents with the external users?
Chose_A: Use S3 presigned URLs to share the documents with the external users. Set an expiration time of 7 days.
Chose_B: Move the documents to an Amazon WorkDocs folder. Share the links of the WorkDocs folder with the external users.
Chose_C: Create temporary IAM users that have read-only access to the S3 bucket. Share the access keys with the external users. Expire the credentials after 7 days.
Chose_D: Create a role that has read-only access to the S3 bucket. Share the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this role with the external users.
Explain: Pre-signed S3 URLs allow secure, temporary access to objects without creating AWS accounts for external users, matching the 7‑day requirement.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 213
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to troubleshoot an AWS Lambda function in a development
environment. The Lambda function is configured in VPC mode and needs to connect
to an existing Amazon RDS for SQL Server DB instance. The DB instance is
deployed in a private subnet and accepts connections by using port 1433.

When the developer tests the function, the function reports an error when it
tries to connect to the database.

Which combination of steps should the developer take to diagnose this issue?
(Choose two.)
Chose_A: Check that the function’s security group has outbound access on port 1433 to the DB instance’s security group. Check that the DB instance’s security group has inbound access on port 1433 from the function’s security group.
Chose_B: Check that the function’s security group has inbound access on port 1433 from the DB instance’s security group. Check that the DB instance’s security group has outbound access on port 1433 to the function’s security group.
Chose_C: Check that the VPC is set up for a NAT gateway. Check that the DB instance has the public access option turned on.
Chose_D: Check that the function’s execution role permissions include rds:DescribeDBInstances, rds:ModifyDBInstance. and rds:DescribeDBSecurityGroups for the DB instance.
Chose_E: E. Check that the function’s execution role permissions include ec2:CreateNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces, and ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface.
Explain: Lambda in a VPC connecting to RDS requires correct security group rules for DB connectivity and IAM permissions to manage ENIs.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 217
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has built a market application that stores pricing data in Amazon
DynamoDB with Amazon ElastiCache in front. The prices of items in the market
change frequently. Sellers have begun complaining that, after they update the
price of an item, the price does not actually change in the product listing.

What could be causing this issue?
Chose_A: The cache is not being invalidated when the price of the item is changed.
Chose_B: The price of the item is being retrieved using a write-through ElastiCache cluster.
Chose_C: The DynamoDB table was provisioned with insufficient read capacity.
Chose_D: The DynamoDB table was provisioned with insufficient write capacity.
Explain: Stale prices commonly result from cached values not being invalidated after updates in DynamoDB, making option A the correct choice.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 238
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on an application that is deployed on an Amazon EC2
instance. The developer needs a solution that will securely transfer files from
the application to an Amazon S3 bucket.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements in the MOST secure way?
Chose_A: Create an IAM user. Create an access key for the IAM user. Store the access key in the application’s environment variables.
Chose_B: Create an IAM role. Create an access key for the IAM role. Store the access key in the application’s environment variables.
Chose_C: Create an IAM role. Configure the IAM role to access the specific Amazon S3 API calls the application requires. Associate the IAM role with the EC2 instance.
Chose_D: Configure an S3 bucket policy for the S3 bucket. Configure the S3 bucket policy to allow access for the EC2 instance ID.
Explain: EC2 instances should access AWS services like S3 using an IAM role attached to the instance rather than storing access keys.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 244
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An AWS Lambda function is running in a company’s shared AWS account. The
function needs to perform an additional ec2:DescribeInstances action that is
directed at the company’s development accounts. A developer must configure the
required permissions across the accounts.

How should the developer configure the permissions to adhere to the principle of
least privilege?
Chose_A: Create an IAM role in the shared account. Add the ec2:DescribeInstances permission to the role. Establish a trust relationship between the development accounts for this role. Update the Lambda function IAM role in the shared account by adding the ec2:DescribeInstances permission to the role.
Chose_B: Create an IAM role in the development accounts. Add the ec2:DescribeInstances permission to the role. Establish a trust relationship with the shared account for this role. Update the Lambda function IAM role in the shared account by adding the iam:AssumeRole permissions.
Chose_C: Create an IAM role in the shared account. Add the ec2:DescribeInstances permission to the role. Establish a trust relationship between the development accounts for this role. Update the Lambda function IAM role in the shared account by adding the iam:AssumeRole permissions.
Chose_D: Create an IAM role in the development accounts. Add the ec2:DescribeInstances permission to the role. Establish a trust relationship with the shared account for this role. Update the Lambda function IAM role in the shared account by adding the ec2:DescribeInstances permission to the role.
Explain: To access EC2 resources in another account, the target account (development) must host the role with the needed permissions and trust the calling account. The Lambda role in the shared account assumes that role using iam:AssumeRole.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 222
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is designing a serverless application that customers use to select
seats for a concert venue. Customers send the ticket requests to an Amazon API
Gateway API with an AWS Lambda function that acknowledges the order and
generates an order ID. The application includes two additional Lambda functions:
one for inventory management and one for payment processing. These two Lambda
functions run in parallel and write the order to an Amazon Dynamo DB table.

The application must provide seats to customers according to the following
requirements. If a seat is accidently sold more than once, the first order that
the application received must get the seat. In these cases, the application must
process the payment for only the first order. However, if the first order is
rejected during payment processing, the second order must get the seat. In these
cases, the application must process the payment for the second order.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Send the order ID to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) FIFO topic that fans out to one Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) FIFO queue for inventory management and another SQS FIFO queue for payment processing.
Chose_B: Change the Lambda function that generates the order ID to initiate the Lambda function for inventory management. Then initiate the Lambda function for payment processing.
Chose_C: Send the order ID to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Subscribe the Lambda functions for inventory management and payment processing to the topic.
Chose_D: Deliver the order ID to an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. Configure the Lambda functions for inventory management and payment processing to poll the queue.
Explain: SNS FIFO can fan out ordered messages to multiple SQS FIFO queues, allowing both functions to process the same order ID while preserving order and ensuring exactly-once processing.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 223
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application uses AWS X-Ray to generate a large amount of trace data on an
hourly basis. A developer wants to use filter expressions to limit the returned
results through user-specified custom attributes.

How should the developer use filter expressions to filter the results in X-Ray?
Chose_A: Add custom attributes as annotations in the segment document.
Chose_B: Add custom attributes as metadata in the segment document.
Chose_C: Add custom attributes as new segment fields in the segment document.
Chose_D: Create new sampling rules that are based on custom attributes.
Explain: Annotations are the correct place to store custom attributes in AWS X-Ray when you need them to be indexed and searchable.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 229
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is planning to use an Amazon API Gateway and AWS Lambda to provide a
REST API. The developer will have three distinct environments to manage:
development, test, and production.

How should the application be deployed while minimizing the number of resources
to manage?
Chose_A: Create a separate API Gateway and separate Lambda function for each environment in the same Region.
Chose_B: Assign a Region for each environment and deploy API Gateway and Lambda to each Region.
Chose_C: Create one API Gateway with multiple stages with one Lambda function with multiple aliases.
Chose_D: Create one API Gateway and one Lambda function, and use a REST parameter to identify the environment.
Explain: Using API Gateway stages with Lambda aliases is the recommended pattern for managing multiple environments in a single Region.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 227
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has built an application that inserts data into an Amazon DynamoDB
table. The table is configured to use provisioned capacity. The application is
deployed on a burstable nano Amazon EC2 instance. The application logs show that
the application has been failing because of a
ProvisionedThroughputExceededException error.

Which actions should the developer take to resolve this issue? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Move the application to a larger EC2 instance.
Chose_B: Increase the number of read capacity units (RCUs) that are provisioned for the DynamoDB table.
Chose_C: Reduce the frequency of requests to DynamoDB by implementing exponential backoff.
Chose_D: Increase the frequency of requests to DynamoDB by decreasing the retry delay.
Chose_E: E. Change the capacity mode of the DynamoDB table from provisioned to on-demand.
Explain: Exponential backoff helps reduce throttling during high-demand periods, and switching to on‑demand capacity removes the need to manually manage RCUs, preventing throttling altogether.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 226
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
Given the following AWS CloudFormation template:

[https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image14.png]

What is the MOST efficient way to reference the new Amazon S3 bucket from
another AWS CloudFormation template?
Chose_A: Add an Export declaration to the Outputs section of the original template and use ImportValue in other templates.
Chose_B: Add Exported: true to the Content.Bucket in the original template and use ImportResource in other templates.
Chose_C: Create a custom AWS CloudFormation resource that gets the bucket name from the ContentBucket resource of the first stack.
Chose_D: Use Fn::Include to include the existing template in other templates and use the ContentBucket resource directly.
Explain: CloudFormation supports sharing values between stacks by exporting Outputs and importing them with ImportValue. This is the correct and standard method.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 230
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer registered an AWS Lambda function as a target for an Application
Load Balancer (ALB) using a CLI command. However, the Lambda function is not
being invoked when the client sends requests through the ALB.

Why is the Lambda function not being invoked?
Chose_A: A Lambda function cannot be registered as a target for an ALB.
Chose_B: A Lambda function can be registered with an ALB using AWS Management Console only.
Chose_C: The permissions to invoke the Lambda function are missing.
Chose_D: Cross-zone is not enabled on the ALB.
Explain: To use a Lambda function as a target for an Application Load Balancer, the Lambda function must allow the ALB to invoke it. Missing invoke permissions is the correct reason.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 231
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an AWS Lambda function that will connect to an Amazon
RDS for MySQL instance. The developer wants to store the database credentials.
The database credentials need to be encrypted and the database password needs to
be automatically rotated.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Store the database credentials as environment variables for the Lambda function. Set the environment variables to rotate automatically.
Chose_B: Store the database credentials in AWS Secrets Manager. Set up managed rotation on the database credentials.
Chose_C: Store the database credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store as secure string parameters. Set up managed rotation on the parameters.
Chose_D: Store the database credentials in the X-Amz-Security-Token parameter. Set up managed rotation on the parameter.
Explain: AWS Secrets Manager is the correct service for storing database credentials and enabling managed automatic rotation.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 232
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer wants to reduce risk when deploying a new version of an existing AWS
Lambda function. To test the Lambda function, the developer needs to split the
traffic between the existing version and the new version of the Lambda function.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure a weighted routing policy in Amazon Route 53. Associate the versions of the Lambda function with the weighted routing policy.
Chose_B: Create a function alias. Configure the alias to split the traffic between the two versions of the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Create an Application Load Balancer (ALB) that uses the Lambda function as a target. Configure the ALB to split the traffic between the two versions of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Create the new version of the Lambda function as a Lambda layer on the existing version. Configure the function to split the traffic between the two layers.
Explain: Lambda aliases support traffic shifting between versions, enabling canary or linear deployments.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 234
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is troubleshooting an application in an integration environment. In
the application, an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue consumes
messages and then an AWS Lambda function processes the messages. The Lambda
function transforms the messages and makes an API call to a third-party service.

There has been an increase in application usage. The third-party API frequently
returns an HTTP 429 Too Many Requests error message. The error message prevents
a significant number of messages from being processed successfully.

How can the developer resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Increase the SQS event source’s batch size setting.
Chose_B: Configure provisioned concurrency for the Lambda function based on the third-party API’s documented rate limits.
Chose_C: Increase the retry attempts and maximum event age in the Lambda function’s asynchronous configuration.
Chose_D: Configure maximum concurrency on the SQS event source based on the third-party service’s documented rate limits.
Explain: Setting maximum concurrency on the SQS event source is the correct way to throttle Lambda invocations to remain within the third‑party API rate limits.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 235
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a three-tier application that is deployed in Amazon Elastic
Container Service (Amazon ECS). The application is using an Amazon RDS for MySQL
DB instance. The application performs more database reads than writes.

During times of peak usage, the application’s performance degrades. When this
performance degradation occurs, the DB instance’s ReadLatency metric in Amazon
CloudWatch increases suddenly.

How should a developer modify the application to improve performance?
Chose_A: Use Amazon ElastiCache to cache query results.
Chose_B: Scale the ECS cluster to contain more ECS instances.
Chose_C: Add read capacity units (RCUs) to the DB instance.
Chose_D: Modify the ECS task definition to increase the task memory.
Explain: Using ElastiCache to cache query results is the appropriate solution when improving read performance or reducing load on a database.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 237
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is writing an application to encrypt files outside of AWS before
uploading the files to an Amazon S3 bucket. The encryption must be symmetric and
must be performed inside the application.

How can the developer implement the encryption in the application to meet these
requirements?
Chose_A: Create a data key in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). Use the AWS Encryption SDK to encrypt the files.
Chose_B: Create a Hash-Based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) key in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). Use the AWS Encryption SDK to encrypt the files.
Chose_C: Create a data key pair in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). Use the AWS CLI to encrypt the files.
Chose_D: Create a data key in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). Use the AWS CLI to encrypt the files.
Explain: Use a KMS data key with the AWS Encryption SDK to encrypt files; this is the correct and recommended approach.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 236
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an online web application that includes a product catalog. The
catalog is stored in an Amazon S3 bucket that is named DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET. The
application must be able to list the objects in the S3 bucket and must be able
to download objects through an IAM policy.

Which policy allows MINIMUM access to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image15.png]
Chose_B: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image16.png]
Chose_C: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image17.png]
Chose_D: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image18.png]
Explain: The most‑voted answer is consistent with known solutions for this question.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 239
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer created a web API that receives requests by using an internet-facing
Application Load Balancer (ALB) with an HTTPS listener. The developer configures
an Amazon Cognito user pool and wants to ensure that every request to the API is
authenticated through Amazon Cognito.

What should the developer do to meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Add a listener rule to the listener to return a fixed response if the Authorization header is missing. Set the fixed response to 401 Unauthorized.
Chose_B: Create an authentication action for the listener rules of the ALSet the rule action type to authenticate-cognito. Set the OnUnauthenticatedRequest field to “deny.”
Chose_C: Create an Amazon API Gateway API. Configure all API methods to be forwarded to the ALB endpoint. Create an authorizer of the COGNITO_USER_POOLS type. Configure every API method to use that authorizer.
Chose_D: Create a new target group that includes an AWS Lambda function target that validates the Authorization header by using Amazon Cognito. Associate the target group with the listener.
Explain: Application Load Balancers natively support Amazon Cognito authentication using the authenticate-cognito action on listener rules. This enforces authentication and denies unauthenticated requests without requiring API Gateway or Lambda.

Title:
