Chose_D: Define an AWS CloudFormation template for an AWS CodePipeline with CodeCommit as the source. Configure the template as an AWS Copilot CLI add-on. Use the AWS Copilot CLI to deploy the application.
Explain: AWS Copilot natively supports creating and deploying pipelines, including using CodeCommit as the source. Option C correctly uses Copilot’s built‑in pipeline functionality.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 344
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a new application for a pet store. The application will
manage customer rewards points. The developer will use Amazon DynamoDB to store
the data for the application. The developer needs to optimize query performance
and limit partition overload before actual performance analysis.

Which option should the developer use for a partition key to meet these
requirements?
Chose_A: A randomly generated universally unique identifier (UUID)
Chose_B: The customer's full name
Chose_C: The date when the customer signed up for the rewards program
Chose_D: The name of the customer's pet
Explain: A UUID is unique, non‑guessable, and provides good distribution for identifiers, unlike personal attributes or dates.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 345
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer uses AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On) to interact with
the AWS CLI and AWS SDKs on a local workstation. API calls to AWS services were
working when the SSO access was first configured. However, the developer is now
receiving Access Denied errors. The developer has not changed any configuration
files or scripts that were previously working on the workstation.

What is the MOST likely cause of the developer's access issue?
Chose_A: The access permissions to the developer's AWS CLI binary file have changed.
Chose_B: The permission set that is assumed by IAM Identity Center does not have the necessary permissions to complete the API call.
Chose_C: The credentials from the IAM Identity Center federated role have expired.
Chose_D: The developer is attempting to make API calls to the incorrect AWS account.
Explain: With AWS IAM Identity Center, CLI credentials are short‑lived. An expired federated token commonly causes failures during API calls.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 346
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is building a serverless application. The application uses an API key
to authenticate with a third-party application. The company wants to store the
external API key as a part of an AWS Lambda configuration. The company needs to
have full control over the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys that will
encrypt the API key and should be visible only to authorized entities.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Store the API key in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store as a string parameter. Use the default AWS KMS key that AWS provides to encrypt the API key.
Chose_B: Store the API key in AWS Lambda environment variables. Create an AWS KMS customer managed key to encrypt the API key.
Chose_C: Store the API key in the code repository. Use an AWS managed key to encrypt the code repository.
Chose_D: Store the API key as an Amazon DynamoDB table record. Use an AWS managed key to encrypt the API key.
Explain: API keys should not be stored in code or Lambda environment variables. The secure and recommended method is to store secrets in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store (or Secrets Manager) with KMS encryption.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 347
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is writing an application to analyze the traffic to a fleet of
Amazon EC2 instances. The EC2 instances run behind a public Application Load
Balancer (ALB). An HTTP server runs on each of the EC2 instances, logging all
requests to a log file.

The developer wants to capture the client public IP addresses. The developer
analyzes the log files and notices only the IP address of the ALB.

What must the developer do to capture the client public IP addresses in the log
file?
Chose_A: Add a Host header to the HTTP server log configuration file.
Chose_B: Install the Amazon CloudWatch Logs agent on each EC2 instance. Configure the agent to write to the log file.
Chose_C: Install the AWS X-Ray daemon on each EC2 instance. Configure the daemon to write to the log file.
Chose_D: Add an X-Forwarded-For header to the HTTP server log configuration file.
Explain: X-Forwarded-For is used to capture the client IP address when requests pass through a load balancer.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 351
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an internal website that contains sensitive data. The company
wants to make the website public. The company must ensure that only employees
who authenticate through the company's OpenID Connect (OIDC) identity provider
(IdP) can access the website. A developer needs to implement authentication
without editing the website.

Which combination of steps will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Create a public Network Load Balancer.
Chose_B: Create a public Application Load Balancer.
Chose_C: Configure a listener for the load balancer that listens on HTTPS port 443. Add a default authenticate action providing the OIDC IdP configuration.
Chose_D: Configure a listener for the load balancer that listens on HTTP port 80. Add a default authenticate action providing the OIDC IdP configuration.
Chose_E: E. Configure a listener for the load balancer that listens on HTTPS port 443. Add a default AWS Lambda action providing an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to a Lambda authentication function.
Explain: Only an Application Load Balancer supports OIDC authentication, and it must use an HTTPS listener with an authenticate action.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 352
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on a web application that requires selective activation
of specific features. The developer wants to keep the features hidden from end
users until the features are ready for public access.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create a feature flag configuration profile in AWS AppSync. Store the feature flag values in the configuration profile. Activate and deactivate feature flags as needed.
Chose_B: Store prerelease data in an Amazon DynamoDB table. Enable Amazon DynamoDB Streams in the table. Toggle between hidden and visible states by using DynamoDB Streams.
Chose_C: Create a feature flag configuration profile in AWS AppConfig. Store the feature flag values in the configuration profile. Activate and deactivate feature flags as needed.
Chose_D: Store prerelease data in AWS Amplify DataStore. Toggle between hidden and visible states by using Amplify DataStore cloud synchronization.
Explain: AWS AppConfig is the correct AWS service for managing feature flags and toggling features safely in applications.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 355
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is writing a web application that is deployed on Amazon EC2
instances behind an internet-facing Application Load Balancer (ALB). The
developer must add an Amazon CloudFront distribution in front of the ALB. The
developer also must ensure that customer data from outside the VPC is encrypted
in transit.

Which combination of CloudFront configuration settings should the developer use
to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Restrict viewer access by using signed URLs.
Chose_B: Set the Origin Protocol Policy setting to Match Viewer.
Chose_C: Enable field-level encryption.
Chose_D: Enable automatic object compression.
Chose_E: E. Set the Viewer Protocol Policy setting to Redirect HTTP to HTTPS.
Explain: Redirecting HTTP to HTTPS is typically the required setting for enforcing secure viewer connections. Matching the origin protocol is not usually required for this scenario.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 357
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is publishing critical log data to a log group in Amazon CloudWatch
Logs. The log group was created 2 months ago. The developer must encrypt the log
data by using an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key so that future data
can be encrypted to comply with the company's security policy.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST effort?
Chose_A: Use the AWS Encryption SDK for encryption and decryption of the data before writing to the log group.
Chose_B: Use the AWS KMS console to associate the KMS key with the log group.
Chose_C: Use the AWS CLI aws logs create-log-group command, and specify the key Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
Chose_D: Use the AWS CLI aws logs associate-kms-key command, and specify the key Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
Explain: The correct way to associate a KMS key with an existing CloudWatch Logs log group is by using the aws logs associate-kms-key CLI command.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 349
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs temporary access to resources in a second account.

What is the MOST secure way to achieve this?
Chose_A: Use the Amazon Cognito user pools to get short-lived credentials for the second account.
Chose_B: Create a dedicated IAM access key for the second account, and send it by mail.
Chose_C: Create a cross-account access role, and use sts:AssumeRole API to get short-lived credentials.
Chose_D: Establish trust, and add an SSH key for the second account to the IAM user.
Explain: Cross-account access should be implemented using an IAM role and sts:AssumeRole to obtain short‑lived credentials.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 356
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is implementing an AWS Lambda function that will be invoked when an
object is uploaded to Amazon S3. The developer wants to test the Lambda function
in a local development machine before publishing the function to a production
AWS account.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Upload an object to Amazon S3 by using the aws s3api put-object CLI command. Wait for the local Lambda invocation from the S3 event.
Chose_B: Create a sample JSON text file for a put object S3 event. Invoke the Lambda function locally. Use the aws lambda invoke CLI command with the JSON file and Lambda function name as arguments.
Chose_C: Use the sam local start-lambda CLI command to start Lambda. Use the sam local generate-event s3 put CLI command to create the Lambda test JSON file. Use the sam local invoke CLI command with the JSON file as the argument to invoke the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Create a JSON string for the put object S3 event. In the AWS Management Console, use the JSON string to create a test event for the local Lambda function. Perform the test.
Explain: SAM CLI provides built‑in commands to generate S3 events and invoke Lambda functions locally, making option C the correct approach.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 353
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer at a company writes an AWS CloudFormation template. The template
refers to subnets that were created by a separate AWS CloudFormation template
that the company's network team wrote. When the developer attempts to launch the
stack for the first time, the launch fails.

Which template coding mistakes could have caused this failure? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: The developer's template does not use the Ref intrinsic function to refer to the subnets.
Chose_B: The developer's template does not use the ImportValue intrinsic function to refer to the subnets.
Chose_C: The Mappings section of the developer's template does not refer to the subnets.
Chose_D: The network team's template does not export the subnets in the Outputs section.
Chose_E: E. The network team's template does not export the subnets in the Mappings section.
Explain: To reference resources from another CloudFormation stack, the network stack must export the values in the Outputs section, and the developer’s template must use ImportValue to retrieve them.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 354
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is running an application on an Amazon EC2 instance. When the
application tries to read an Amazon S3 bucket, the application fails. The
developer notices that the associated IAM role is missing the S3 read
permission. The developer needs to give the application the ability to read the
S3 bucket.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST application disruption?
Chose_A: Add the permission to the role. Terminate the existing EC2 instance. Launch a new EC2 instance.
Chose_B: Add the permission to the role so that the change will take effect automatically.
Chose_C: Add the permission to the role. Hibernate and restart the existing EC2 instance.
Chose_D: Add the permission to the S3 bucket. Restart the EC2 instance.
Explain: Updating an IAM role attached to an EC2 instance takes effect automatically without restarting or replacing the instance.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 348
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is developing a serverless application by using AWS Lambda functions.
One of the Lambda functions needs to access an Amazon RDS DB instance. The DB
instance is in a private subnet inside a VPC.

The company creates a role that includes the necessary permissions to access the
DB instance. The company then assigns the role to the Lambda function. A
developer must take additional action to give the Lambda function access to the
DB instance.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Assign a public IP address to the DB instance. Modify the security group of the DB instance to allow inbound traffic from the IP address of the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Set up an AWS Direct Connect connection between the Lambda function and the DB instance.
Chose_C: Configure an Amazon CloudFront distribution to create a secure connection between the Lambda function and the DB instance.
Chose_D: Configure the Lambda function to connect to the private subnets in the VPC. Add security group rules to allow traffic to the DB instance from the Lambda function.
Explain: Lambda must be placed in the VPC’s private subnets and appropriate security group rules must allow traffic to the RDS instance.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 350
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company wants to migrate applications from its on-premises servers to AWS. As
a first step, the company is modifying and migrating a non-critical application
to a single Amazon EC2 instance. The application will store information in an
Amazon S3 bucket. The company needs to follow security best practices when
deploying the application on AWS.

Which approach should the company take to allow the application to interact with
Amazon S3?
Chose_A: Create an IAM role that has administrative access to AWS. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.
Chose_B: Create an IAM user. Attach the AdministratorAccess policy. Copy the generated access key and secret key. Within the application code, use the access key and secret key along with the AWS SDK to communicate with Amazon S3.
Chose_C: Create an IAM role that has the necessary access to Amazon S3. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.
Chose_D: Create an IAM user. Attach a policy that provides the necessary access to Amazon S3. Copy the generated access key and secret key. Within the application code, use the access key and secret key along with the AWS SDK to communicate with Amazon S3.
Explain: The correct way for an EC2 instance to access S3 is to use an IAM role with the required permissions attached to the instance. This avoids storing access keys in code.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 401
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a monolithic desktop-based application that processes images. A
developer is converting the application into an AWS Lambda function by using
Python. Currently, the desktop application runs every 5 minutes to process the
latest image from an Amazon S3 bucket. The desktop application completes the
image processing task within 1 minute.

During testing on AWS, the developer notices that the Lambda function runs at
the specified 5-minute interval. However, the Lambda function takes more than 2
minutes to complete the image processing task. The developer needs a solution
that will improve the Lambda function's performance.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Update the instance type of the Lambda function to a compute optimized instance with at least eight virtual CPU (vCPU).
Chose_B: Update the configuration of the Lambda function to use the latest Python runtime.
Chose_C: Increase the memory that is allocated to the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Configure a reserved concurrency on the Lambda function.
Explain: Increasing Lambda memory also increases available CPU, which improves performance for compute‑bound workloads.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 402
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses AWS CloudFormation templates to manage infrastructure for a
public-facing application in its development, pre-production, and production
environments. The company needs to scale for increasing customer demand. A
developer must upgrade the Amazon RDS DB instance type to a larger instance.

The developer deploys an update to the CloudFormation stack with the instance
size change in the pre-production environment. The developer notices that the
stack is in an UPDATE_ROLLBACK_FAILED slate in CloudFormation.

Which option is the cause of this issue?
Chose_A: The new instance type specified in the CloudFormation template is invalid
Chose_B: The database was deleted or modified manually outside of the CloudFormation stack
Chose_C: There is a syntax error in the CloudFormation template
Chose_D: The developer has insufficient IAM permissions to provision an instance of the specified type
Explain: CloudFormation cannot manage resources that were changed or deleted outside the stack, which commonly causes stack update or creation failures.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 389
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has an application that uses an Amazon DynamoDB table with a
configured local secondary index (LSI). During application testing, the DynamoDB
table metrics report a ProvisionedThroughputExceededException error message. The
number of requests made by the test suite did not exceed the table's provisioned
capacity limits.

What is the cause of this issue?
Chose_A: The data in the table's partition key column is not evenly distributed.
Chose_B: The LSI's capacity is different from the table's capacity.
Chose_C: The application is not implementing exponential backoff retry logic while interacting with the DynamoDB API.
Chose_D: The application has the IAM permission to query the DynamoDB table but not to query the LSI.
Explain: LSIs share the same partition key as the base table, so uneven partition key distribution causes hot partitions that lead to throttling and timeouts when querying an LSI.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 373
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a serverless application that uses Amazon API Gateway backed by
AWS Lambda proxy integration. The company is developing several backend APIs.
The company needs a landing page to provide an overview of navigation to the
APIs.

A developer creates a new/LandingPage resource and a new GET method that uses
mock integration.

What should the developer do next to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure the integration request mapping template with Content-Type of text/html and statusCode of 200. Configure the integration response mapping template with Content-Type of application/json. In the integration response mapping template, include the LandingPage HTML code that references the APIs.
Chose_B: Configure the integration request mapping template with Content-Type of application/json. In the integration request mapping template, include the LandingPage HMTL code that references the APIs. Configure the integration response mapping template with Content-Type of text/html and statusCode of 200.
Chose_C: Configure the integration request mapping template with Content-Type of application/json and statusCode of 200. Configure the integration response mapping template with Content-Type of text/html. In the integration response mapping template, include the LandingPage HTML code that references the APIs.
Chose_D: Configure the integration request mapping template with Content-Type of text/html. In the integration request mapping template, include the LandingPage HTML code that references the APIs. Configure the integration response mapping template with Content-Type of application/json and statusCode of 200.
Explain: To return an HTML landing page from API Gateway, the HTML must be placed in the integration response mapping template with a Content-Type of text/html and a 200 status code. Option C correctly configures this.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 393
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company runs a critical application on Amazon Elastic Container Service
(Amazon ECS) by using Amazon EC2 instances. The company needs to migrate the
application to Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate. A developer is configuring Fargate and
the ECS capacity providers to make the change.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST downtime during
migration?
Chose_A: Use the PutClusterCapacityProviders API operation to associate the ECS cluster with the FARGATE and FARGATE_SPOT capacity provider strategies. Use FARGATE as Provider 1 with a base value. Use FARGATE_SPOT as Provider 2 for failover.
Chose_B: Use the CreateCapacityProvider API operation to associate the ECS cluster with the FARGATE and FARGATE_SPOT capacity provider strategies. Use FARGATE as Provider 1 with a base value. Use FARGATE_SPOT as Provider 2 for failover.
Chose_C: Use the PutClusterCapacityProviders API operation to associate the ECS cluster with the FARGATE and FARGATE_SPOT capacity provider strategies. Use FARGATE_SPOT as Provider 1 with a base value. Use FARGATE as Provider 2 for failover.
Chose_D: Use the CreateCapacityProvider API operation to associate the ECS cluster with the FARGATE and FARGATE_SPOT capacity provider strategies. Use FARGATE_SPOT as Provider 1 with a base value. Use FARGATE as Provider 2 for failover.
Explain: FARGATE and FARGATE_SPOT are AWS-managed capacity providers, so they cannot be created. They must be associated with the cluster using PutClusterCapacityProviders, making option A correct.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 397
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD)
pipeline that uses AWS CodeArtifact and AWS CodeBuild. The build artifacts are
between 0.5 GB and 1.5 GB in size. The builds happen frequently and retrieve
many dependencies from CodeArtifact each time.

The builds have been slow because of the time it takes to transfer dependencies.
The developer needs to improve build performance by reducing the number of
dependencies that are retrieved for each build.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Specify an Amazon S3 cache in CodeBuild. Add the S3 cache folder path to the buildspec.yaml file for the build project.
Chose_B: Specify a local cache in CodeBuild. Add the CodeArtifact repository name to the buildspec.yaml file for the build project.
Chose_C: Specify a local cache in CodeBuild. Add the cache folder path to the buildspec.yaml file for the build project.
Chose_D: Retrieve the buildspec.yaml file directly from CodeArtifact. Add the CodeArtifact repository name to the buildspec.yaml file for the build project.
Explain: CodeBuild supports local caching to speed up dependency retrieval. Specifying a local cache and defining the cache folder path in buildspec.yaml is the correct approach.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 391
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a development team that uses AWS CodeCommit for version control.
The development team has CodeCommit repositories in multiple AWS accounts. The
team is expanding to include developers who work in various locations.

The company must ensure that the developers have secure access to the
repositories.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST operationally efficient
way?
Chose_A: Configure IAM roles for each developer and grant access individually.
Chose_B: Configure permission sets in AWS IAM Identity Center to grant access to the accounts.
Chose_C: Share AWS access keys with the development team for direct repository access.
Chose_D: Use public SSH keys for authentication to the CodeCommit repositories.
Explain: IAM Identity Center permission sets are the correct and scalable way to grant developers access to CodeCommit repositories across AWS accounts.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 392
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer received the following error message during an AWS CloudFormation
deployment:

DELETE_FAILED (The following resource(s) failed to delete:
[ASGInstanceRole12345678].)

Which action should the developer take to resolve this error?
Chose_A: Contact AWS Support to report an issue with the Auto Scaling Groups (ASG) service.
Chose_B: Add a DependsOn attribute to the ASGInstanceRole12345678 resource in the CloudFormation template. Then delete the stack.
Chose_C: Modify the CloudFormation template to retain the ASGInstanceRole12345678 resource. Then manually delete the resource after deployment.
Chose_D: Add a force parameter when calling CloudFormation with the role-arn of ASGInstanceRole12345678.
Explain: When a CloudFormation stack cannot delete an IAM role because it is still attached to an Auto Scaling group, the proper fix is to mark the resource as Retain so the stack can delete successfully, then remove the resource manually.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 394
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a web application that is hosted on AWS. The application is behind
an Amazon CloudFront distribution. A developer needs a dashboard to monitor
error rates and anomalies of the CloudFront distribution as frequently as
possible.

Which combination of steps should the developer take to meet these requirements?
(Choose two.)
Chose_A: Stream the CloudFront distribution logs to an Amazon S3 bucket. Detect anomalies and error rates by using Amazon Athena.
Chose_B: Enable real-time logs on the CloudFront distribution. Create a data stream in Amazon Kinesis Data Streams.
Chose_C: Set up Amazon Kinesis Data Streams to send the logs to Amazon OpenSearch Service by using an AWS Lambda function. Make a dashboard in OpenSearch Dashboards.
Chose_D: Stream the CloudFront distribution logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
Chose_E: E. Set up Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to send the logs to AWS CloudTrail. Create CloudTrail metrics, alarms, and dashboards.
Explain: CloudFront real-time logs must be enabled (B), and sending them through Kinesis Data Streams to OpenSearch with a dashboard (C) satisfies real‑time analysis and visualization requirements.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 361
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is writing an application, which stores data in an Amazon DynamoDB
table. The developer wants to query the DynamoDB table by using the partition
key and a different sort key value. The developer needs the latest data with all
recent write operations.

How should the developer write the DynamoDB query?
Chose_A: Add a local secondary index (LSI) during table creation. Query the LSI by using eventually consistent reads.
Chose_B: Add a local secondary index (LSI) during table creation. Query the LSI by using strongly consistent reads.
Chose_C: Add a global secondary index (GSI) during table creation. Query the GSI by using eventually consistent reads.
Chose_D: Add a global secondary index (GSI) during table creation. Query the GSI by using strongly consistent reads.
Explain: Strongly consistent reads are only supported on the base table and LSIs. If the requirement involves strong consistency on an alternate sort key, an LSI must be used.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 359
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that uses an AWS Lambda function to process data. A
developer must implement encryption in transit for all sensitive configuration
data, such as API keys, that is stored in the application. The developer creates
an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer managed key.

What should the developer do next to meet the encryption requirement?
Chose_A: Create parameters of the String type in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. For each parameter, specify the KMS key ID to encrypt the parameter in transit. Reference the GetParameter API call in the Lambda environment variables.
Chose_B: Create secrets in AWS Secrets Manager by using the customer managed KMS key. Create a new Lambda function and set up a Lambda layer. Configure the Lambda layer to retrieve the values from Secrets Manager.
Chose_C: Create objects in Amazon S3 for each sensitive data field. Specify the customer managed KMS key to encrypt the object. Configure the Lambda function to retrieve the objects from Amazon S3 during data processing.
Chose_D: Create encrypted Lambda environment variables. Specify the customer managed KMS key to encrypt the variables. Enable encryption helpers for encryption in transit. Grant permission to the Lambda function's execution role to access the KMS key.
Explain: Sensitive data for Lambda should not be stored in environment variables. Using AWS Secrets Manager with a customer-managed KMS key is the recommended and more secure solution for managing and retrieving secrets at runtime.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 358
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on an app for a company that uses an Amazon DynamoDB
table named Orders to store customer orders. The table uses OrderID as the
partition key and there is no sort key. The table contains more than 100,000
records. The developer needs to add a functionality that will retrieve all
Orders records that contain an OrderSource attribute with the MobileApp value.

Which solution will improve the user experience in the MOST efficient way?
Chose_A: Perform a Scan operation on the Orders table. Provide a QueryFilter condition to filter to only the items where the OrderSource attribute is equal to the MobileApp value.
Chose_B: Create a local secondary index (LSI) with OrderSource as the partition key. Perform a Query operation by using MobileApp as the key.
Chose_C: Create a global secondary index (GSI) with OrderSource as the sort key. Perform a Query operation by using MobileApp as the key.
Chose_D: Create a global secondary index (GSI) with OrderSource as the partition key. Perform a Query operation by using MobileApp as the key.
Explain: To query efficiently by a non-key attribute such as OrderSource, a GSI must be created with that attribute as the partition key.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 385
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An IAM role is attached to an Amazon EC2 instance that explicitly denies access
to all Amazon S3 API actions. The EC2 instance credentials file specifies the
IAM access key and secret access key, which allow full administrative access.

Given that multiple modes of IAM access are present for this EC2 instance, which
of the following is correct?
Chose_A: The EC2 instance will only be able to list the S3 buckets.
Chose_B: The EC2 instance will only be able to list the contents of one S3 bucket at a time.
Chose_C: The EC2 instance will be able to perform all actions on any S3 bucket.
Chose_D: The EC2 instance will not be able to perform any S3 action on any S3 bucket.
Explain: Without any S3 permissions granted to the EC2 instance role, it cannot perform any S3 actions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 398
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company that has large online business uses an Amazon DynamoDB table to store
sales data. The company enabled Amazon DynamoDB Streams on the table. The
transaction status of each sale is stored in a TransactionStatus attribute in
the table. The value of the TransactionStatus attribute must be either failed,
pending, or completed.

The company wants to be notified of failed sales where the Price attribute is
above a specific threshold. A developer needs to set up notification for the
failed sales.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Create an event source mapping between DynamoDB Streams and an AWS Lambda function. Use Lambda event filtering to trigger the Lambda function only if sales fail when the price is above the specified threshold. Configure the Lambda function to publish the data to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic.
Chose_B: Create an event source mapping between DynamoDB Streams and an AWS Lambda function. Configure the Lambda function handler code to publish to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic if sales fail when price is above the specified threshold.
Chose_C: Create an event source mapping between DynamoDB Streams and an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Use event filtering to publish to the SNS topic if sales fail when the price is above the specified threshold.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon CloudWatch alarm to monitor the DynamoDB Streams sales data. Configure the alarm to publish to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic if sales fail due when price is above the specified threshold.
Explain: Lambda supports event filtering for DynamoDB Streams, allowing the function to trigger only when conditions are met. SNS cannot be directly mapped to Streams, and CloudWatch cannot alarm on stream-level record content.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 360
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an ecommerce application. When there is a sale event,
the application needs to concurrently call three third-party systems to record
the sale. The developer wrote three AWS Lambda functions. There is one Lambda
function for each third-party system, which contains complex integration logic.

These Lambda functions are all independent. The developer needs to design the
application so each Lambda function will run regardless of others' success or
failure.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Publish the sale event from the application to an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. Configure the three Lambda functions to poll the queue.
Chose_B: Publish the sale event from the application to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Subscribe the three Lambda functions to be triggered by the SNS topic.
Chose_C: Publish the sale event from the application to an Application Load Balancer (ALB). Add the three Lambda functions as ALB targets.
Chose_D: Publish the sale event from the application to an AWS Step Functions state machine. Move the logic from the three Lambda functions into the Step Functions state machine.
Explain: SNS is the correct service for fan-out to multiple Lambda functions when an event must trigger all of them simultaneously.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 362
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer manages an application that writes customer orders to an Amazon
DynamoDB table. The orders use customer_id as the partition key, order_id as the
sort key, and order_date as an attribute. A new access pattern requires
accessing data by order_date and order_id. The developer needs to implement a
new AWS Lambda function to support the new access pattern.

How should the developer support the new access pattern in the MOST
operationally efficient way?
Chose_A: Add a new local secondary index (LSI) to the DynamoDB table that specifies order_date as the partition key and order_id as the sort key. Write the new Lambda function to query the new LSI index.
Chose_B: Write the new Lambda function to scan the DynamoDB table. In the Lambda function, write a method to retrieve and combine results by order_date and order_id.
Chose_C: Add a new global secondary index (GSI) to the DynamoDB table that specifies order_date as the partition key and order_id as the sort key. Write the new Lambda function to query the new GSI index.
Chose_D: Enable DynamoDB Streams on the table. Choose the new and old images information to write to the DynamoDB stream. Write the new Lambda function to query the DynamoDB stream
Explain: To query using a new access pattern based on order_date and order_id, a GSI is required because LSIs cannot be added after table creation. A GSI enables efficient queries without scanning.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 364
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer wrote an application that uses an AWS Lambda function to
asynchronously generate short videos based on requests from customers. This
video generation can take up to 10 minutes. After the video is generated, a URL
to download the video is pushed to the customer's web browser. The customer
should be able to access these videos for at least 3 hours after generation.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Store the video in the /tmp folder within the Lambda execution environment. Push a Lambda function URL to the customer.
Chose_B: Store the video in an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system attached to the function. Generate a pre-signed URL for the video object and push the URL to the customer.
Chose_C: Store the video in Amazon S3. Generate a pre-signed URL for the video object and push the URL to the customer.
Chose_D: Store the video in an Amazon CloudFront distribution. Generate a pre-signed URL for the video object and push the URL to the customer.
Explain: S3 is the correct storage service for video delivery through pre-signed URLs. Lambda /tmp is temporary, EFS does not support presigned URLs, and CloudFront requires S3 as an origin.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 381
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer updates an AWS Lambda function that an Amazon API Gateway API uses.
The API is the backend for a web application.

The developer needs to test the updated Lambda function before deploying the
Lambda function to production. The testing must not affect any production users
of the web application.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST operationally efficient
way?
Chose_A: Create a canary release deployment for the existing API stage. Deploy the API to the existing stage. Test the updated Lambda function by using the existing URL.
Chose_B: Update the API Gateway API endpoint type to private. Deploy the changes to the existing API stage. Test the API by using the existing URL.
Chose_C: Create a new test API stage in API Gateway. Add stage variables to deploy the updated Lambda function to only the test stage. Test the updated Lambda function by using the new stage URL.
Chose_D: Create a new AWS CloudFormation stack to deploy a copy of the entire production API and Lambda function. Use the stack's API URL to test the updated Lambda function.
Explain: Creating a new test stage with stage variables allows testing a new Lambda version without impacting the production stage.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 382
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer wants the ability to roll back to a previous version of an AWS
Lambda function in the event of errors caused by a new deployment.

How can the developer achieve this with MINIMAL impact on users?
Chose_A: Change the application to use an alias that points to the current version. Deploy the new version of the code. Update the alias to use the newly deployed version. If too many errors are encountered, point the alias back to the previous version.
Chose_B: Change the application to use an alias that points to the current version. Deploy the new version of the code. Update the alias to direct 10% of users to the newly deployed version. If too many errors are encountered, send 100% of traffic to the previous version.
Chose_C: Do not make any changes to the application. Deploy the new version of the code. If too many errors are encountered, point the application back to the previous version using the version number in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
Chose_D: Create three aliases: new, existing, and router. Point the existing alias to the current version. Have the router alias direct 100% of users to the existing alias. Update the application to use the router alias. Deploy the new version of the code. Point the new alias to this version. Update the router alias to direct 10% of users to the new alias. If too many errors are encountered, send 100% of traffic to the existing alias.
Explain: Weighted Lambda aliases allow shifting a small percentage of traffic to a new version for canary deployments, with quick rollback if errors occur.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 363
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a web application for a school that stores data in
Amazon DynamoDB. The ExamScores table has the following attributes: student_id,
subject_name, and top_score.

Each item in the ExamScores table is identified with student_id as the partition
key and subject_name as the sort key. The web application needs to display the
student _id for the top scores for each school subject. The developer needs to
increase the speed of the queries to retrieve the student_id for the top scorer
for each school subject.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create a local secondary index (LSI) with subject_name as the partition key and top_score as the sort key.
Chose_B: Create a local secondary index (LSI) with top_score as the partition key and student_id as the sort key.
Chose_C: Create a global secondary index (GSI) with subject_name as the partition key and top_score as the sort key.
Chose_D: Create a global secondary index (GSI) with subject_name as the partition key and student_id as the sort key.
Explain: To query items by subject and sort them by top_score, a GSI with subject_name as the partition key and top_score as the sort key is required. LSIs cannot change the partition key.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 365
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an AWS Lambda function that is invoked by messages to an
Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. The messages represent
customer data updates from a customer relationship management (CRM) system

The developer wants the Lambda function to process only the messages that
pertain to email address changes. Additional subscribers to the SNS topic will
process any other messages.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Use Lambda event filtering to allow only messages that are related to email address changes to invoke the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Use an SNS filter policy on the Lambda function subscription to allow only messages that are related to email address changes to invoke the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Subscribe an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue to the SNS topic. Configure the SQS queue with a filter policy to allow only messages that are related to email address changes. Connect the SQS queue to the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Configure the Lambda code to check the received message. If the message is not related to an email address change, configure the Lambda function to publish the message back to the SNS topic for the other subscribers to process.
Explain: SNS supports filter policies on subscriptions, allowing only specific messages to trigger the Lambda function.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 366
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is designing a fault-tolerant environment where client sessions will
be saved.

How can the developer ensure that no sessions are lost if an Amazon EC2 instance
fails?
Chose_A: Use sticky sessions with an Elastic Load Balancer target group.
Chose_B: Use Amazon SQS to save session data.
Chose_C: Use Amazon DynamoDB to perform scalable session handling.
Chose_D: Use Elastic Load Balancer connection draining to stop sending requests to failing instances.
Explain: DynamoDB is the correct choice for scalable, centralized, and highly available session management. Other options do not provide proper scalable session handling.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 367
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating AWS CloudFormation templates to manage an application's
deployment in Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) through AWS
CodeDeploy. The developer wants to automatically deploy new versions of the
application to a percentage of users before the new version becomes available
for all users.

How should the developer manage the deployment of the new version?
Chose_A: Modify the CloudFormation template to include a Transform section and the AWS::CodeDeploy::BlueGreen hook.
Chose_B: Deploy the new version in a new CloudFormation stack. After testing is complete, update the application's DNS records for the new stack.
Chose_C: Run CloudFormation stack updates on the application stack to deploy new application versions when they are available.
Chose_D: Create a nested stack for the new version. Include a Transform section and the AWS::CodeDeploy::BlueGreen hook.
Explain: Using the AWS::CodeDeploy::BlueGreen hook in the Transform section enables CloudFormation blue/green deployments for application updates.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 368
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has written a distributed application that uses microservices. The
microservices are running on Amazon EC2 instances. Because of message volume,
the developer is unable to match log output from each microservice to a specific
transaction. The developer needs to analyze the message flow to debug the
application.

Which combination of steps should the developer take to meet this requirement?
(Choose two.)
Chose_A: Download the AWS X-Ray daemon. Install the daemon on an EC2 instance. Ensure that the EC2 instance allows UDP traffic on port 2000.
Chose_B: Configure an interface VPC endpoint to allow traffic to reach the global AWS X-Ray daemon on TCP port 2000.
Chose_C: Enable AWS X-Ray. Configure Amazon CloudWatch to push logs to X-Ray.
Chose_D: Add the AWS X-Ray software development kit (SDK) to the microservices. Use X-Ray to trace requests that each microservice makes.
Chose_E: E. Set up Amazon CloudWatch metric streams to collect streaming data from the microservices.
Explain: You must instrument the microservices with the X-Ray SDK and run the X-Ray daemon to collect and send trace data.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 369
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is working on a new serverless application. A developer needs to find
an automated way to deploy AWS Lambda functions and the dependent infrastructure
with minimum coding effort. The application also needs to be reliable.

Which method will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Build the application by using shell scripts to create .zip files for each Lambda function. Manually upload the .zip files to the AWS Management Console.
Chose_B: Build the application by using the AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM). Use a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline and the SAM CLI to deploy the Lambda functions.
Chose_C: Build the application by using shell scripts to create .zip files for each Lambda function. Upload the .zip files. Deploy the .zip files as Lambda functions by using the AWS CLI in a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline.
Chose_D: Build a container for each Lambda function. Store the container images in AWS CodeArtifact. Deploy the containers as Lambda functions by using the AWS CLI in a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline.
Explain: AWS SAM with a CI/CD pipeline is the recommended and most efficient approach for building and deploying multiple Lambda functions in a serverless application.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 370
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to modify an application architecture to meet new functional
requirements. Application data is stored in Amazon DynamoDB and processed for
analysis in a nightly batch. The system analysts do not want to wait until the
next day to view the processed data and have asked to have it available in
near-real time.

Which application architecture pattern would enable the data to be processed as
it is received?
Chose_A: Event driven
Chose_B: Client-server driven
Chose_C: Fan-out driven
Chose_D: Schedule driven
Explain: Without the full question text, the best determination is that the most‑voted answer is likely correct. Event-driven is a common correct pattern in DVA‑C02 scenario questions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 371
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company hosts its application in the us-west-1 Region. The company wants to
add redundancy in the us-east-1 Region.

The application secrets are stored in AWS Secrets Manager in us-west-1. A
developer needs to replicate the secrets to us-east-1.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Configure secret replication for each secret. Add us-east-1 as a replication Region. Choose an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key in us-east-1 to encrypt the replicated secrets.
Chose_B: Create a new secret in us-east-1 for each secret. Configure secret replication in us-east-1. Set the source to be the corresponding secret in us-west-1. Choose an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key in us-west-1 to encrypt the replicated secrets.
Chose_C: Create a replication rule for each secret. Set us-east-1 as the destination Region. Configure the rule to run during secret rotation. Choose an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key in us-east-1 to encrypt the replicated secrets.
Chose_D: Create a Secrets Manager lifecycle rule to replicate each secret to a new Amazon S3 bucket in us-west-1. Configure an S3 replication rule to replicate the secrets to us-east-1.
Explain: Secrets Manager supports native cross‑Region replication by adding a replication Region and selecting the KMS key in the destination Region, which is exactly what option A describes.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 372
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company runs an ecommerce application on AWS. The application stores data in
an Amazon Aurora database.

A developer is adding a caching layer to the application. The caching strategy
must ensure that the application always uses the most recent value for each data
item.

Which caching strategy will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Implement a TTL strategy for every item that is saved in the cache.
Chose_B: Implement a write-through strategy for every item that is created and updated.
Chose_C: Implement a lazy loading strategy for every item that is loaded.
Chose_D: Implement a read-through strategy for every item that is loaded.
Explain: A write-through caching strategy keeps the cache synchronized with the data store on every write, ensuring consistency and reducing stale data.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 374
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer creates an AWS Lambda function that is written in Java. During
testing, the Lambda function does not work how the developer expected. The
developer wants to use tracing capabilities to troubleshoot the problem.

Which AWS service should the developer use to accomplish this goal?
Chose_A: AWS Trusted Advisor
Chose_B: Amazon CloudWatch
Chose_C: AWS X-Ray
Chose_D: AWS CloudTrail
Explain: AWS X-Ray is typically the correct service when a question involves tracing, analyzing, or debugging distributed applications.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 375
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is developing an application that will be accessed through the Amazon
API Gateway REST API. Registered users should be the only ones who can access
certain resources of this API. The token being used should expire automatically
and needs to be refreshed periodically.

How can a developer meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create an Amazon Cognito identity pool, configure the Amazon Cognito Authorizer in API Gateway, and use the temporary credentials generated by the identity pool.
Chose_B: Create and maintain a database record for each user with a corresponding token and use an AWS Lambda authorizer in API Gateway.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon Cognito user pool, configure the Cognito Authorizer in API Gateway, and use the identity or access token.
Chose_D: Create an IAM user for each API user, attach an invoke permissions policy to the API, and use an IAM authorizer in API Gateway.
Explain: Cognito user pools are used to authenticate users and provide JWT tokens that API Gateway can verify with a Cognito authorizer.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 376
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company used AWS to develop an application for customers. The application
includes an Amazon API Gateway API that invokes AWS Lambda functions. The Lambda
functions process data and store the data in Amazon DynamoDB tables.

The company must monitor the entire application to identify potential
bottlenecks in the architecture that can negatively affect customers.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Instrument the application with AWS X-Ray. Inspect the service map to identify errors and issues.
Chose_B: Configure Lambda exceptions and additional logging to Amazon CloudWatch. Use CloudWatch Logs Insights to query the logs.
Chose_C: Configure API Gateway to log responses to Amazon CloudWatch. Create a metric filter for the TooManyRequestsException error message.
Chose_D: Use Amazon CloudWatch metrics for the DynamoDB tables to identify all the ProvisionedThroughputExceededException error messages.
Explain: AWS X-Ray provides end-to-end tracing and a visual service map, making it the most effective choice for identifying errors and performance issues in distributed applications.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 377
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company launched an online portal to announce a new product that the company
will release in 6 months. The portal requests that users enter an email address
to receive communications about the product. The company needs to create a REST
API that will store the email addresses in Amazon DynamoDB.

A developer has created an AWS Lambda function that can store the email
addresses. The developer will deploy the Lambda function by using the AWS
Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM). The developer must provide access to the
Lambda function over HTTP.

Which solutions will meet these requirements with the LEAST additional
configuration? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Expose the Lambda function by using function URLs.
Chose_B: Expose the Lambda function by using a Gateway Load Balancer.
Chose_C: Expose the Lambda function by using a Network Load Balancer.
Chose_D: Expose the Lambda function by using AWS Global Accelerator.
Chose_E: E. Expose the Lambda function by using Amazon API Gateway.
Explain: Lambda function URLs and API Gateway are the standard and correct ways to expose a Lambda function externally.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 379
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is monitoring an application that runs on an Amazon EC2 instance.
The developer has configured a custom Amazon CloudWatch metric with data
granularity of 1 second. If any issues occur, the developer wants to be notified
within 30 seconds by Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

What should the developer do to meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Configure a high-resolution CloudWatch alarm.
Chose_B: Set up a custom CloudWatch dashboard.
Chose_C: Use Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights.
Chose_D: Change to a default CloudWatch metric.
Explain: High‑resolution CloudWatch alarms are used when more frequent metric evaluation is required, making option A the most appropriate.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 380
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a web application that contains an Amazon API Gateway REST API. A
developer has created an AWS CloudFormation template for the initial deployment
of the application. The developer has deployed the application successfully as
part of an AWS CodePipeline continuous integration and continuous delivery
(CI/CD) process. All resources and methods are available through the deployed
stage endpoint.

The CloudFormation template contains the following resource types:

• AWS::ApiGateway::RestApi
• AWS::ApiGateway::Resource
• AWS::ApiGateway::Method
• AWS::ApiGateway::Stage
• AWS::ApiGateway::Deployment

The developer adds a new resource to the REST API with additional methods and
redeploys the template. CloudFormation reports that the deployment is successful
and that the stack is in the UPDATE_COMPLETE state. However, calls to all new
methods are returning 404 (Not Found) errors.

What should the developer do to make the new methods available?
Chose_A: Specify the disable-rollback option during the update-stack operation.
Chose_B: Unset the CloudFormation stack failure options.
Chose_C: Add an AWS CodeBuild stage to CodePipeline to run the aws apigateway create-deployment AWS CLI command.
Chose_D: Add an action to CodePipeline to run the aws cloudfront create-invalidation AWS CLI command.
Explain: To deploy changes to an API Gateway stage, a deployment must be explicitly created. Adding a CodeBuild stage to run the create-deployment command automates this as part of the pipeline.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 383
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company maintains a REST service using Amazon API Gateway and the API Gateway
native API key validation. The company recently launched a new registration
page, which allows users to sign up for the service. The registration page
creates a new API key using CreateApiKey and sends the new key to the user. When
the user attempts to call the API using this key, the user receives a 403
Forbidden error. Existing users are unaffected and can still call the API.

What code updates will grant these new users access to the API?
Chose_A: The createDeployment method must be called so the API can be redeployed to include the newly created API key.
Chose_B: The updateAuthorizer method must be called to update the API's authorizer to include the newly created API key.
Chose_C: The importApiKeys method must be called to import all newly created API keys into the current stage of the API.
Chose_D: The createUsagePlanKey method must be called to associate the newly created API key with the correct usage plan.
Explain: After creating an API key, it must be associated with the appropriate usage plan using createUsagePlanKey so the key can be used for the API.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 386
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses an AWS Lambda function to transfer files from an Amazon S3 bucket
to the company's SFTP server. The Lambda function connects to the SFTP server by
using credentials such as username and password. The company uses Lambda
environment variables to store these credentials.

A developer needs to implement encrypted username and password credentials.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Remove the user credentials from the Lambda environment. Implement IAM database authentication.
Chose_B: Move the user credentials from Lambda environment variables to AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store.
Chose_C: Move the user credentials from Lambda environment variables to AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS).
Chose_D: Move the user credentials from the Lambda environment to an encrypted .txt file. Store the file in an S3 bucket.
Explain: Storing credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store is the appropriate way to securely manage secrets for Lambda instead of environment variables.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 387
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a new batch application that will run on an Amazon EC2
instance. The application requires read access to an Amazon S3 bucket. The
developer needs to follow security best practices to grant S3 read access to the
application.

Which solution meets these requirements?
Chose_A: Add the permissions to an IAM policy. Attach the policy to a role. Attach the role to the EC2 instance profile.
Chose_B: Add the permissions inline to an IAM group. Attach the group to the EC2 instance profile.
Chose_C: Add the permissions to an IAM policy. Attach the policy to a user. Attach the user to the EC2 instance profile.
Chose_D: Add the permissions to an IAM policy. Use IAM web identity federation to access the S3 bucket with the policy.
Explain: EC2 instances should access AWS services using an IAM role with an attached policy via an instance profile.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 378
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a website that displays a daily newsletter. When a user visits the
website, an AWS Lambda function processes the browser's request and queries the
company's on-premises database to obtain the current newsletter. The newsletters
are stored in English. The Lambda function uses the Amazon Translate
TranslateText API operation to translate the newsletters, and the translation is
displayed to the user.

Due to an increase in popularity, the website's response time has slowed. The
database is overloaded. The company cannot change the database and needs a
solution that improves the response time of the Lambda function.

Which solution meets these requirements?
Chose_A: Change to asynchronous Lambda function invocation.
Chose_B: Cache the translated newsletters in the Lambda/tmp directory.
Chose_C: Enable TranslateText API caching.
Chose_D: Change the Lambda function to use parallel processing.
Explain: Caching translation results in the Lambda /tmp directory reduces repeated TranslateText API calls and improves performance.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 388
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that receives batches of orders from partners every
day. The application uses an AWS Lambda function to process the batches.

If a batch contains no orders, the Lambda function must publish to an Amazon
Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic as soon as possible.

Which combination of steps will meet this requirement with the LEAST
implementation effort? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Update the existing Lambda function's code to send an Amazon CloudWatch custom metric for the number of orders in a batch for each partner.
Chose_B: Create a new Lambda function as an Amazon Kinesis data stream consumer. Configure the new Lambda function to track orders and to publish to the SNS topic when a batch contains no orders.
Chose_C: Set up an Amazon CloudWatch alarm that will send a notification to the SNS topic when the value of the custom metric is 0.
Chose_D: Schedule a new Lambda function to analyze Amazon CloudWatch metrics every 24 hours to identify batches that contain no orders. Configure the Lambda function to publish to the SNS topic.
Chose_E: E. Modify the existing Lambda function to log orders to an Amazon Kinesis data stream.
Explain: Publishing a custom metric from the existing Lambda function and using a CloudWatch alarm to detect a value of zero is the correct and most efficient solution.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 390
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer manages a website that distributes its content by using Amazon
CloudFront. The website's static artifacts are stored in an Amazon S3 bucket.

The developer deploys some changes and can see the new artifacts in the S3
bucket. However, the changes do not appear on the webpage that the CloudFront
distribution delivers.

How should the developer resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Configure S3 Object Lock to update to the latest version of the files every time an S3 object is updated.
Chose_B: Configure the S3 bucket to clear all old objects from the bucket before new artifacts are uploaded.
Chose_C: Set CloudFront to invalidate the cache after the artifacts have been deployed to Amazon S3.
Chose_D: Set CloudFront to modify the distribution origin after the artifacts have been deployed to Amazon S3.
Explain: CloudFront continues serving cached content unless explicitly invalidated. After deploying new artifacts to S3, a CloudFront cache invalidation ensures users receive the latest files.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 395
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer creates an Amazon DynamoDB table. The table has OrderID as the
partition key and NumberOfItemsPurchased as the sort key. The data type of the
partition key and the sort key is Number.

When the developer queries the table, the results are sorted by
NumberOfItemsPurchased in ascending order. The developer needs the query results
to be sorted by NumberOfItemsPurchased in descending order.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Create a local secondary index (LSI) on the NumberOfItemsPurchased sort key.
Chose_B: Change the sort key from NumberOfItemsPurchased to NumberOfItemsPurchasedDescending.
Chose_C: In the Query operation, set the ScanIndexForward parameter to false.
Chose_D: In the Query operation, set the KeyConditionExpression parameter to false.
Explain: Setting ScanIndexForward to false returns results in descending order without changing the table design.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 399
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An AWS Lambda function is invoked asynchronously to process events.
Occasionally, the Lambda function falls to process events. A developer needs to
collect and analyze these failed events to fix the issue.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements with the LEAST
development effort?
Chose_A: Add logging statements for all events in the Lambda function. Filter AWS CloudTrail logs for errors.
Chose_B: Configure the Lambda function to start an AWS Step Functions workflow with retries for failed events.
Chose_C: Add a dead-letter queue to send messages to an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) standard queue.
Chose_D: Add a dead-letter queue to send messages to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) FIFO topic.
Explain: Lambda dead-letter queues should use an SQS standard queue or an SNS topic. Using an SQS queue is the correct and most common solution for capturing failed Lambda events.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 400
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that uses an Amazon S3 bucket for object storage. A
developer needs to configure in-transit encryption for the S3 bucket. All the S3
objects containing personal data needs to be encrypted at rest with AWS Key
Management Service (AWS KMS) keys, which can be rotated on demand.

Which combination of steps will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Write an S3 bucket policy to allow only encrypted connections over HTTPS by using permissions boundary.
Chose_B: Configure an S3 bucket policy to enable client-side encryption for the objects containing personal data by using an AWS KMS customer managed key.
Chose_C: Configure the application to encrypt the objects by using an AWS KMS customer managed key before uploading the objects containing personal data to Amazon S3.
