Chose_D: Write an S3 bucket policy to allow only encrypted connections over HTTPS by using the aws:SecureTransport condition.
Chose_E: E. Configure S3 Block Public Access settings for the S3 bucket to allow only encrypted connections over HTTPS.
Explain: Client-side encryption with a KMS CMK (C) protects personal data before upload, and enforcing HTTPS with aws:SecureTransport (D) ensures secure transport. These together meet typical compliance and security needs.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 408
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an application that must transfer expired items from
Amazon DynamoDB to Amazon S3. The developer sets up the DynamoDB table to
automatically delete items after a specific TTL. The application must process
the items in DynamoDB and then must store the expired items in Amazon S3. The
entire process, including item processing and storage in Amazon S3, will take 5
minutes.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Configure DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) to query for expired items based on the TTL. Save the results to Amazon S3.
Chose_B: Configure DynamoDB Streams to invoke an AWS Lambda function. Program the Lambda function to process the items and to store the expired items in Amazon S3.
Chose_C: Deploy a custom application on an Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) cluster on Amazon EC2 instances. Program the custom application to process the items and to store the expired items in Amazon S3.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon EventBridge rule to invoke an AWS Lambda function. Program the Lambda function to process the items and to store the expired items in Amazon S3.
Explain: When DynamoDB TTL expires an item, the deletion event is sent to DynamoDB Streams. A Lambda function can process these REMOVE events and store expired items in S3, which matches option B.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 410
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer builds a serverless application on AWS by using Amazon API Gateway,
AWS Lambda functions, and Amazon Route 53. During testing, the developer notices
errors but cannot immediately locate the root cause.

To identify the errors, the developer needs to search all the application's
logs.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements with the LEAST
operational overhead?
Chose_A: Set up API Gateway health checks to monitor the application's availability. Use the Amazon CloudWatch PutMetricData API operation to publish the logs to CloudWatch. Search and query the logs by using Amazon Athena.
Chose_B: Set up Route 53 health checks to monitor the application's availability. Turn on AWS CloudTrail logs for all the AWS services that the application uses. Send the logs to a specified Amazon S3 bucket. Use Amazon Athena to query the log files directly from Amazon S3.
Chose_C: Configure all the application's AWS services to publish a real-time feed of log events to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. Configure the delivery stream to publish all the logs to an Amazon S3 bucket. Use Amazon OpenSearch Service to search and analyze the logs.
Chose_D: Set up Route 53 health checks to monitor the application's availability. Turn on Amazon CloudWatch Logs for the API Gateway stages to log API requests with a JSON log format. Use CloudWatch Logs Insights to search and analyze the logs from the AWS services that the application uses.
Explain: Route 53 health checks monitor availability, and CloudWatch Logs with Logs Insights is the correct approach for analyzing API Gateway and associated service logs.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 404
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses AWS X-Ray to monitor a serverless application. The components of
the application have different request rates. The user interactions and
transactions are important to trace, but they are low in volume. The background
processes such as application health checks, polling, and connection maintenance
generate high volumes of read-only requests.

Currently, the default X-Ray sampling rules are universal for all requests. Only
the first request per second and some additional requests are recorded. This
setup is not helping the company review the requests based on service or request
type.

A developer must configure rules to trace requests based on service or request
properties. The developer must trace the user interactions and transactions
without wasting effort recording minor background tasks.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Disable sampling for high-volume read-only requests. Sample at a lower rate for all requests that handle user interactions or transactions.
Chose_B: Disable sampling and trace all requests for requests that handle user interactions or transactions. Sample high-volume read-only requests at a higher rate.
Chose_C: Disable sampling and trace all requests for requests that handle user interactions or transactions. Sample high-volume read-only requests at a lower rate.
Chose_D: Disable sampling for high-volume read-only requests. Sample at a higher rate for all requests that handle user interactions or transactions.
Explain: User-interaction or transactional requests should be fully traced, while high-volume read-only requests should be sampled at a lower rate to control X-Ray costs and maintain visibility where it matters most.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 407
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an ecommerce web application that uses an on-premises MySQL
database as a data store. The company migrates the on-premises MySQL database to
Amazon RDS for MySQL.

A developer needs to configure the application's access to the RDS for MySQL
database. The developer's solution must not use long term credentials.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Enable IAM database authentication on the RDS for MySQL DB instance. Create an IAM role that has the minimum required permissions. Assign the role to the application.
Chose_B: Store the MySQL credentials as secrets in AWS Secrets Manager. Create an IAM role that has the minimum required permissions to retrieve the secrets. Assign the role to the application.
Chose_C: Configure the MySQL credentials as environment variables that are available at runtime for the application.
Chose_D: Store the MySQL credentials as SecureString parameters in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Create an IAM role that has the minimum required permissions to retrieve the parameters. Assign the role to the application.
Explain: Secrets Manager is the recommended way to securely store and automatically rotate database credentials. IAM DB authentication (A) is only correct when the question explicitly requires passwordless IAM-based MySQL auth, which is not stated.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 409
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has an application that uses WebSocket APIs in Amazon API Gateway.
The developer wants to use an API Gateway Lambda authorizer to control access to
the application.

The developer needs to add credential caching and reduce repeated usage of
secret keys and authorization tokens on every request.

Which combination of steps should the developer take to meet these requirements?
(Choose two.)
Chose_A: Use a token-based Lambda authorizer.
Chose_B: Use a request parameter-based Lambda authorizer.
Chose_C: Configure an integration request mapping template to reference the context map from the APIGateway Lambda authorizer.
Chose_D: Configure an integration request mapping template to reference the identity API key value from the API Gateway Lambda authorizer.
Chose_E: E. Use VPC endpoint policies for the WebSocket APIs.
Explain: Lambda authorizers return context data that can be accessed in integration request mapping templates. Token‑based authorizers plus mapping templates referencing context are the correct approach.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 403
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to store files in an Amazon S3 bucket for a company's
application. Each S3 object can have multiple versions. The objects must be
permanently removed 1 year after object creation.

The developer creates an S3 bucket that has versioning enabled.

What should the developer do next to meet the data retention requirements?
Chose_A: Create an S3 Lifecycle rule on the S3 bucket. Configure the rule to expire current versions of objects and permanently delete noncurrent versions 1 year after object creation.
Chose_B: Create an event notification for all object creation events in the S3 bucket. Configure the event notification to invoke an AWS Lambda function. Program the Lambda function to check the object creation date and to delete the object if the object is older than 1 year.
Chose_C: Create an event notification for all object removal events in the S3 bucket. Configure the event notification to invoke an AWS Lambda function. Program the Lambda function to check the object creation date and to delete the object if the object is older than 1 year.
Chose_D: Create an S3 Lifecycle rule on the S3 bucket. Configure the rule to delete expired object delete markers and permanently delete noncurrent versions 1 year after object creation.
Explain: To automatically delete S3 objects older than one year, an S3 Lifecycle rule that expires current versions and permanently deletes noncurrent versions is the correct solution.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 406
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company had an Amazon RDS for MySQL DB instance that was named mysql-db. The
DB instance was deleted within the past 90 days.

A developer needs to find which IAM user or role deleted the DB instance in the
AWS environment.

Which solution will provide this information?
Chose_A: Retrieve the AWS CloudTrail events for the resource mysql-db where the event name is DeleteDBInstance. Inspect each event.
Chose_B: Retrieve the Amazon CloudWatch log events from the most recent log stream within the rds/mysql-db log group. Inspect the log events.
Chose_C: Retrieve the AWS X-Ray trace summaries. Filter by services with the name mysql-db. Inspect the ErrorRootCauses values within each summary.
Chose_D: Retrieve the AWS Systems Manager deletions inventory. Filter the inventory by deletions that have a TypeName value of RDS. Inspect the deletion details.
Explain: CloudTrail records RDS DeleteDBInstance API calls, including who performed the deletion, making it the correct method.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 411
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to freeze changes to an AWS CodeCommit repository before a
production release. The developer will work on new features while a quality
assurance (QA) team tests the release.

The QA testing and all bug fixes must take place in isolation from the main
branch. After the release, the developer must integrate all bug fixes into the
main branch.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create a release branch from the latest Git commit that will be in the release. Apply fixes to the release branch. Continue developing new features, and merge the features into the main branch. Merge the release branch into the main branch after the release.
Chose_B: Create a Git tag on the latest Git commit that will be in the release. Continue developing new features, and merge the features into the main branch. Apply fixes to the main branch. Update the Git tag for the release to be on the latest commit on the main branch.
Chose_C: Create a release branch from the latest Git commit that will be in the release. Apply fixes to the release branch. Continue developing new features, and merge the features into the main branch. Rebase the main branch onto the release branch after the release.
Chose_D: Create a Git tag on the latest Git commit that will be in the release. Continue developing new features, and merge the features into the main branch. Apply the Git commits for fixes to the Git tag for the release.
Explain: Creating a release branch, applying fixes there, and merging it back after release follows standard GitFlow practices and avoids modifying tags, which should remain immutable.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 384
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses an AWS CloudFormation template to deploy and manage its AWS
infrastructure. The CloudFormation template creates Amazon VPC security groups
and Amazon EC2 security groups.

A manager finds out that some engineers modified the security groups of a few
EC2 instances for testing purposes. A developer needs to determine what
modifications occurred.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Add a Conditions section statement in the source YAML file of the template. Run the CloudFormation stack.
Chose_B: Perform a drift detection operation on the CloudFormation stack.
Chose_C: Execute a change set for the CloudFormation stack.
Chose_D: Use Amazon Detective to detect the modifications.
Explain: CloudFormation drift detection is the correct method to identify configuration changes made outside CloudFormation.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 396
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to use a code template to create an automated deployment of an
application onto Amazon EC2 instances. The template must be configured to repeat
deployment, installation, and updates of resources for the application. The
template must be able to create identical environments and roll back to previous
versions.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Use AWS Amplify for automatic deployment templates. Use a traffic-splitting deployment to copy any deployments. Modify any resources created by Amplify, if necessary.
Chose_B: Use AWS CodeBuild for automatic deployment. Upload the required AppSpec file template. Save the appspec.yml file in the root directory folder of the revision. Specify the deployment group that includes the EC2 instances for the deployment.
Chose_C: Use AWS CloudFormation to create an infrastructure template in JSON format to deploy the EC2 instances. Use CloudFormation helper scripts to install the necessary software and to start the application. Call the scripts directly from the template.
Chose_D: Use AWS AppSync to deploy the application. Upload the template as a GraphQL schema. Specify the EC2 instances for deployment of the application. Use resolvers as a version control mechanism and to make any updates to the deployments.
Explain: CloudFormation is the correct service for deploying EC2-based applications using infrastructure-as-code templates. The other choices misuse services that are not appropriate for EC2 application deployment.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 412
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is setting up AWS CodePipeline for a new application. During each
build, the developer must generate a test report.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Create an AWS CodeBuild build project that runs tests. Configure the buildspec file with the test report information.
Chose_B: Create an AWS CodeDeploy deployment that runs tests. Configure the AppSpec file with the test report information.
Chose_C: Run the builds on an Amazon EC2 instance that has AWS Systems Manager Agent (SSM Agent) installed and activated.
Chose_D: Create a repository in AWS CodeArtifact. Select the test report template.
Explain: AWS CodeBuild natively supports running tests and generating test reports through the buildspec file, which matches the requirement.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 413
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer built an application by using multiple AWS Lambda functions. The
Lambda functions must access dynamic configuration data at runtime. The data is
maintained as a 6 KB JSON document in AWS AppConfig. The configuration data
needs to be updated without requiring the redeployment of the application.

The developer needs a solution that will give the Lambda functions access to the
dynamic configuration data.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements with the LEAST
development effort?
Chose_A: Migrate the document from AWS AppConfig to a Lambda environment variable. Read the document at the runtime.
Chose_B: Configure the AWS AppConfig Agent Lambda extension. Access the dynamic configuration data by calling the extension on a local host.
Chose_C: Use the AWS X-Ray SDK to call the AWS AppConfig APIs. Retrieve the configuration file at runtime.
Chose_D: Migrate the configuration file to a Lambda deployment package. Read the file from the file system at runtime.
Explain: The AWS AppConfig Agent Lambda extension is the correct way for Lambda functions to retrieve dynamic configuration data locally without extra API calls.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 414
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has AWS Lambda functions that need to access a company's internal
data science libraries and reference data. Separate teams manage the libraries
and the data. The teams must be able to update and upload new data
independently. The Lambda functions are connected to the company's central VPC.

Which solution will provide the Lambda functions with access to the libraries
and data?
Chose_A: Attach an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume to the Lambda functions by using EBS Multi-Attach in the central VPC. Update the Lambda function execution roles to give the functions to access the EBS volume. Update the Lambda function code to reference the files in the EBS volume.
Chose_B: Compress the libraries and reference data in a Lambda /tmp folder. Update the Lambda function code to reference the files in the /tmp folder.
Chose_C: Set up an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system with mount targets in the central VPConfigure the Lambda functions to mount the EFS file system. Update the Lambda function execution roles to give the functions to access the EFS file system.
Chose_D: Set up an Amazon FSx for Windows File Server file system with mount targets in the central VPC. Configure the Lambda functions to mount the Amazon FSx file system. Update the Lambda function execution roles to give the functions to access the Amazon FSx file system.
Explain: Amazon EFS is the correct way to share large libraries or reference data across multiple Lambda functions, including those in a VPC.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 405
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer uses an AWS Lambda function in an application to edit users'
uploaded photos. The developer needs to update the Lambda function code and
needs to test the updates.

For testing, the developer must divide the user traffic between the original
version of the Lambda function and the new version of the Lambda function.

Which combination of steps will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Publish a version of the original Lambda function. Make the necessary changes to the Lambda code. Publish a new version of the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Use AWS CodeBuild to detect updates to the Lambda function. Configure CodeBuild to incrementally shift traffic from the original version of the Lambda function to the new version of the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Update the original version of the Lambda function to add a function URL. Make the necessary changes to the Lambda code. Publish another function URL for the updated Lambda code.
Chose_D: Create an alias that points to the original version of the Lambda function. Configure the alias to be a weighted alias that also includes the new version of the Lambda function. Divide traffic between the two versions.
Chose_E: E. Create an alias that points to the original function URL. Configure the alias to be a weighted alias that also includes the additional function URL. Divide traffic between the two function URLs.
Explain: AWS Lambda supports gradual traffic shifting only through aliases with weighted routing. Publishing versions alone does not provide traffic shifting, so option D is the correct solution.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 417
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an application on Amazon Elastic Container Service
(Amazon ECS). The developer needs to configure the application parameters. The
developer must configure limits for the application's maximum number of
simultaneous connections and maximum number of transactions per second.

The maximum number of connections and transactions can change in the future. The
developer needs a solution that can automatically deploy these changes to the
application, as needed, without causing downtime.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Make the configuration changes for the application. Use AWS CodeDeploy to create a deployment configuration. Specify an in-place deployment to deploy the changes.
Chose_B: Bootstrap the application to use the AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) and make the configuration changes. Specify the ECSCanary10Percent15Minutes launch type in the properties section of the ECS resource. Deploy the application by using the AWS CDK to implement the changes.
Chose_C: Install the AWS AppConfig agent on Amazon ECS. Configure an IAM role with access to AWS AppConfig. Make the deployment changes by using AWS AppConfig. Specify Canary10Percent20Minutes as the deployment strategy.
Chose_D: Create an AWS Lambda function to make the configuration changes. Create an Amazon CloudWatch alarm that monitors the Lambda function every 5 minutes to check if the Lambda function has been updated. When the Lambda function is updated, deploy the changes by using AWS CodeDeploy.
Explain: AWS AppConfig allows safe, controlled configuration deployments using strategies like canary releases. Installing the AppConfig agent on ECS and using a canary strategy directly meets the requirement.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 420
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is developing a publicly accessible single-page application. The
application makes calls from a client web browser to backend services to provide
a user interface to customers. The application depends on a third-party web
service exposed as an HTTP API. The web client must provide an API key to the
third-party web service by using the HTTP header as part of the HTTP request.
The company's API key must not be exposed to the users of the web application.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
Chose_A: Use Amazon API Gateway to create a private REST API. Create an HTTP integration to integrate with the third-party HTTP API. Add the company’s API key to the HTTP headers list of the integration request configuration.
Chose_B: Use Amazon API Gateway to create a private REST API. Create an AWS Lambda proxy integration. Make calls to the third-party HTTP API from the Lambda function. Pass the company's API key as an HTTP request header.
Chose_C: Use Amazon API Gateway to create a REST API. Create an HTTP integration to integrate with the third-party HTTP API. Add the company's API key to the HTTP headers list of the integration request configuration.
Chose_D: Use Amazon API Gateway to create a REST API. Create an AWS Lambda proxy integration. Make calls to the third-party HTTP API from the Lambda function. Pass the company's API key as an HTTP request header.
Explain: A public REST API with a direct HTTP integration is the simplest and correct method to forward requests to a third-party API while adding required headers.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 421
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is setting up the deployment of application stacks to new test
environments by using the AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK). The application
contains the code for several AWS Lambda functions that will be deployed as
assets. Each Lambda function is defined by using the AWS CDK Lambda construct
library.

The developer has already successfully deployed the application stacks to the
alpha environment in the first account by using the AWS CDK CLI's cdk deploy
command. The developer is preparing to deploy to the beta environment in a
second account for the first time. The developer makes no significant changes to
the CDK code between deployments, but the initial deployment in the second
account is unsuccessful and returns a NoSuchBucket error.

Which command should the developer run before redeployment to resolve this
error?
Chose_A: cdk synth
Chose_B: cdk bootstrap
Chose_C: cdk init
Chose_D: cdk destroy
Explain: cdk bootstrap is used to set up the initial resources required for deploying CDK applications, which matches typical exam scenarios for these answer choices.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 423
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A development team wants to immediately build and deploy an application whenever
there is a change to the source code.

Which approaches could be used to trigger the deployment? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Store the source code in an Amazon S3 bucket. Configure AWS CodePipeline to start whenever a file in the bucket changes.
Chose_B: Store the source code in an encrypted Amazon EBS volume. Configure AWS CodePipeline to start whenever a file in the volume changes.
Chose_C: Store the source code in an AWS CodeCommit repository. Configure AWS CodePipeline to start whenever a change is committed to the repository.
Chose_D: Store the source code in an Amazon S3 bucket. Configure AWS CodePipeline to start every 15 minutes.
Chose_E: E. Store the source code in an Amazon EC2 instance’s ephemeral storage. Configure the instance to start AWS CodePipeline whenever there are changes to the source code.
Explain: CodeCommit is the correct source repository for CodePipeline with native commit-based triggers. Using S3 for source code is not appropriate when version control is required.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 428
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is deploying an application on Amazon EC2 instances that run in
Account A. The application needs to read data from an existing Amazon Kinesis
data stream in Account B.

Which actions should the developer take to provide the application with access
to the stream? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Update the instance profile role in Account A with stream read permissions.
Chose_B: Create an IAM role with stream read permissions in Account B.
Chose_C: Add a trust policy to the instance profile role and IAM role in Account B to allow the instance profile role to assume the IAM role.
Chose_D: Add a trust policy to the instance profile role and IAM role in Account B to allow reads from the stream.
Chose_E: E. Add a resource-based policy in Account B to allow read access from the instance profile role.
Explain: To allow an EC2 instance profile role in Account A to read a Kinesis stream in Account B, you create a role in Account B with stream read permissions and add a trust policy allowing the instance profile role to assume it.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 430
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that is deployed on AWS Elastic Beanstalk. The
application generates user-specific PDFs and stores the PDFs in an Amazon S3
bucket. The application then uses Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES) to
send the PDFs by email to subscribers.

Users no longer access the PDFs 90 days after the PDFs are generated. The S3
bucket is not versioned and contains many obsolete PDFs.

A developer must reduce the number of files in the S3 bucket by removing PDFs
that are older than 90 days.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Update the application code. In the code, add a rule to scan all the objects in the S3 bucket every day and to delete objects after 90 days.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Lambda function. Program the Lambda function to scan all the objects in the S3 bucket every day and to delete objects after 90 days.
Chose_C: Create an S3 Lifecycle rule for the S3 bucket to expire objects after 90 days.
Chose_D: Partition the S3 objects with a // key prefix. Create an AWS Lambda function to remove objects that have prefixes that have reached the expiration date.
Explain: S3 Lifecycle rules are the correct and simplest way to automatically expire objects after 90 days.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 432
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company processes incoming documents from an Amazon S3 bucket. Users upload
documents to an S3 bucket using a web user interface. Upon receiving files in
S3, an AWS Lambda function is invoked to process the files, but the Lambda
function times out intermittently.

If the Lambda function is configured with the default settings, what will happen
to the S3 event when there is a timeout exception?
Chose_A: Notification of a failed S3 event is sent as an email through Amazon SNS.
Chose_B: The S3 event is sent to the default Dead Letter Queue.
Chose_C: The S3 event is processed until it is successful.
Chose_D: The S3 event is discarded after the event is retried twice.
Explain: For S3-triggered Lambda asynchronous invocations, Lambda retries the event twice. If there is no DLQ configured, the event is discarded after the retries.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 431
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is troubleshooting an application. The application includes several
AWS Lambda functions that invoke an Amazon API Gateway API. The API Gateway's
method request is set up to use an Amazon Cognito authorizer for authentication.

All the Lambda functions pass the user ID as part of the Authorization header to
the API Gateway API. The API Gateway API returns a 403 status code for all GET
requests.

How should the developer resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Modify the client GET request to include a valid API key in the Authorization header.
Chose_B: Modify the client GET request to include a valid token in the Authorization header.
Chose_C: Update the resource policy for the API Gateway API to allow the execute-api:Invoke action.
Chose_D: Modify the client to send an OPTIONS preflight request before the GET request.
Explain: A 403 error typically indicates that the caller is authenticated but not authorized. Updating the API Gateway resource policy to allow execute-api:Invoke resolves missing permission issues.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 445
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a script to automate the deployment process for a
serverless application. The developer wants to use an existing AWS Serverless
Application Model (AWS SAM) template for the application.

What should the developer use for the project? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Call aws cloudformation package to create the deployment package. Call aws cloudformation deploy to deploy the package afterward.
Chose_B: Call sam package to create the deployment package. Call sam deploy to deploy the package afterward.
Chose_C: Call aws s3 cp to upload the AWS SAM template to Amazon S3. Call aws lambda update-function-code to create the application.
Chose_D: Create a ZIP package locally and call aws serverlessrepo create-applicatiion to create the application.
Chose_E: E. Create a ZIP package and upload it to Amazon S3. Call aws cloudformation create-stack to create the application.
Explain: AWS SAM applications should be built and deployed using 'sam package' followed by 'sam deploy', which correctly prepares and deploys serverless applications.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 415
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that uses an AWS Lambda function to consume
messages from an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. The SQS queue
is configured with a dead-letter queue. Due to a defect in the application, AWS
Lambda failed to process some messages. A developer fixed the bug and wants to
process the failed messages again.

How should the developer resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Use the SendMessageBatch API to send messages from the dead-letter queue to the original SQS queue.
Chose_B: Use the ChangeMessageVisibility API to configure messages in the dead-letter queue to be visible in the original SQS queue.
Chose_C: Use the StartMessageMoveTask API to move messages from the dead-letter queue to the original SQS queue.
Chose_D: Use the PurgeQueue API to remove messages from the dead-letter queue and return the messages to the original SQS queue.
Explain: StartMessageMoveTask is the correct API for moving messages from an SQS dead-letter queue back to the source queue.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 418
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has built an application running on AWS Lambda using AWS Serverless
Application Model (AWS SAM).

What is the correct sequence of steps to successfully deploy the application?
Chose_A: 1. Build the SAM template in Amazon EC2. 2. Package the SAM template to Amazon EBS storage. 3. Deploy the SAM template from Amazon EBS.
Chose_B: 1. Build the SAM template locally. 2. Package the SAM template onto Amazon S3. 3. Deploy the SAM template from Amazon S3.
Chose_C: 1. Build the SAM template locally. 2. Deploy the SAM template from Amazon S3. 3. Package the SAM template for use.
Chose_D: 1. Build the SAM template locally. 2. Package the SAM template from AWS CodeCommit. 3. Deploy the SAM template to CodeCommit.
Explain: The correct SAM workflow is to build locally, package artifacts to Amazon S3, and deploy from S3.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 419
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to deploy the code for a new application on an AWS Lambda
function. The application needs a dependency file that is 500 MB to run the
business logic.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Compress the application code and dependencies into a .zip file. Directly upload the .zip file as a deployment package for the Lambda function instead of copying the code.
Chose_B: Compress the application code and dependencies into a .zip file. Upload the .zip file to an Amazon S3 bucket. Configure the Lambda function to run the code from the .zip file in the S3 bucket.
Chose_C: Package the application code and dependencies into a container image. Upload the image to an Amazon S3 bucket. Configure the Lambda function to run the code in the image.
Chose_D: Package the application code and dependencies into a container image. Push the image to an Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) repository. Deploy the image to the Lambda function.
Explain: Lambda supports deploying code as container images stored in Amazon ECR. This is the correct method when packaging the application and dependencies into a container image.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 424
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application integrating an Amazon API Gateway with an
AWS Lambda function. When calling the API, the developer receives the following
error:

Wed Nov 08 01:13:00 UTC 2017 : Method completed with status: 502

What should the developer do to resolve the error?
Chose_A: Change the HTTP endpoint of the API to an HTTPS endpoint.
Chose_B: Change the format of the payload sent to the API Gateway.
Chose_C: Change the format of the Lambda function response to the API call.
Chose_D: Change the authorization header in the API call to access the Lambda function.
Explain: Issues where API Gateway cannot properly interpret a Lambda response are typically resolved by correcting the Lambda function’s output format.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 425
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building various microservices for an application that will run
on Amazon EC2 instances. The developer needs to monitor the end-to-end view of
the requests between the microservices and debug any issues in the various
microservices.

What should the developer do to accomplish these tasks?
Chose_A: Use Amazon CloudWatch to aggregate the microservices' logs and metrics, and build the monitoring dashboard.
Chose_B: Use AWS CloudTrail to aggregate the microservices' logs and metrics, and build the monitoring dashboard.
Chose_C: Use the AWS X-Ray SDK to add instrumentation in all the microservices, and monitor using the X-Ray service map.
Chose_D: Use AWS Health to monitor the health of all the microservices.
Explain: AWS X-Ray provides distributed tracing and service maps, which are ideal for monitoring microservices architectures.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 426
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building a microservice that uses AWS Lambda to process messages
from an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) standard queue. The Lambda
function calls external APIs to enrich the SQS message data before loading the
data into an Amazon Redshift data warehouse. The SQS queue must handle a maximum
of 1,000 messages per second.

During initial testing, the Lambda function repeatedly inserted duplicate data
into the Amazon Redshift table. The duplicate data led to a problem with data
analysis. All duplicate messages were submitted to the queue within 1 minute of
each other.

How should the developer resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Create an SQS FIFO queue. Enable message deduplication on the SQS FIFO queue.
Chose_B: Reduce the maximum Lambda concurrency that the SQS queue can invoke.
Chose_C: Use Lambda's temporary storage to keep track of processed message identifiers
Chose_D: Configure a message group ID for every sent message. Enable message deduplication on the SQS standard queue.
Explain: FIFO queues support native message deduplication. Standard queues do not, so option D is invalid. Creating a FIFO queue with deduplication is the correct solution.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 433
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer uses Amazon S3 Event Notifications to invoke AWS Lambda functions.
The Lambda functions process images after the images are uploaded to S3 buckets.
The developer has set up a development S3 bucket, a production S3 bucket, a
development Lambda function, and a production Lambda function in the same AWS
account.

The developer notices that uploads to the development S3 bucket wrongly invoke
the production Lambda function. The developer must prevent development data from
affecting the production Lambda function.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Update the execution role for the production Lambda function. Add a policy that allows the execution role to read from only the production S3 bucket.
Chose_B: Update the S3 bucket policy for the production S3 bucket to invoke the production Lambda function. Update the S3 bucket policy for the development S3 bucket to invoke the development Lambda function.
Chose_C: Separate the development environment and the production environment into their own AWS accounts. Update the execution role for each Lambda function. Add a policy that allows the execution role to read from only the S3 bucket that is in the same account.
Chose_D: Separate the development environment and the production environment into their own AWS accounts. Add a resource policy to the Lambda functions to allow only S3 bucket events in the same account to invoke the functions.
Explain: Separating environments into different AWS accounts and using Lambda resource policies ensures that only S3 events from the same account can invoke each function, providing strong isolation between dev and prod.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 439
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a solution to track an account's Amazon S3 buckets over
time. The developer has created an AWS Lambda function that will run on a
schedule. The function will list the account's S3 buckets and will store the
list in an Amazon DynamoDB table. The developer receives a permissions error
when the developer runs the function with the AWSLambdaBasicExecutionRole AWS
managed policy.

Which combination of permissions should the developer use to resolve this error?
(Choose two.)
Chose_A: Cross-account IAM role
Chose_B: Permission for the Lambda function to list buckets in Amazon S3
Chose_C: Permission for the Lambda function to write in DynamoDB
Chose_D: Permission for Amazon S3 to invoke the Lambda function
Chose_E: E. Permission for DynamoDB to invoke the Lambda function
Explain: These permissions allow the Lambda function to list S3 buckets and write to DynamoDB, which fits the scenario implied by the answer.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 440
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses AWS to run its learning management system (LMS) application. The
application runs on Amazon EC2 instances behind an Application Load Balancer
(ALB). The application's domain name is managed in Amazon Route 53. The
application is deployed in a single AWS Region, but the company wants to improve
application performance for users all over the world.

Which solution will improve global performance with the LEAST operational
overhead?
Chose_A: Set up an Amazon CloudFront distribution that uses the ALB as the origin server. Configure Route 53 to create a DNS alias record that points the application's domain name to the CloudFront distribution URL.
Chose_B: Launch more EC2 instances behind the ALConfigure the ALB to use session affinity (sticky sessions). Create a Route 53 alias record for the ALB by using a geolocation routing policy.
Chose_C: Create an AWS Client VPN endpoint in the VPInstruct users to connect to the VPN to access the application. Create a Route 53 alias record for the VPN endpoint. Configure Route 53 to use a geolocation routing policy.
Chose_D: Deploy the application to multiple Regions across the world. Create a Route 53 alias record for the ALB by using a latency-based routing policy.
Explain: Using CloudFront in front of an ALB improves global performance and availability, and Route 53 aliasing to the CloudFront distribution is the correct approach.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 441
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer hosts a static website on Amazon S3 and connects the website to an
Amazon CloudFront distribution. The website uses a custom domain name that
points to the CloudFront URL.

The developer has set up a continuous integration and continuous delivery
(CI/CD) pipeline. The pipeline automatically runs when changes occur in an AWS
CodeCommit repository. The pipeline has a source stage and then a build stage.
The build stage invokes an AWS CodeBuild project that references a buildspec.yml
file. The buildspec.yml file builds the code and deploys the static files to the
S3 bucket.

The pipeline runs successfully, and the latest website files are visible in the
S3 bucket and at the S3 website URL. However, when the developer accesses the
website through the CloudFront domain, the updates are not reflected on the
website.

What should the developer configure the buildspec.yml file to do to resolve this
issue?
Chose_A: Properly synchronize the objects in the S3 bucket with new files from the source stage.
Chose_B: Delete the previous website files in the S3 bucket and redeploy the website files.
Chose_C: Invalidate the file caches for the primary CloudFront distribution.
Chose_D: Modify the cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) policy of the S3 bucket and redeploy the website files.
Explain: CloudFront continues serving cached content unless it is invalidated. Invalidating the CloudFront cache ensures users receive the latest files stored in the S3 bucket.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]

Question:
A gaming application stores scores for players in an Amazon DynamoDB table that
has four attributes: user_id, user_name, user_score, and user_rank. The users
are allowed to update their names only. A user is authenticated by web identity
federation.

Which set of conditions should be added in the policy attached to the role for
the dynamodb:PutItem API call?

Chose_B: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image20.png]
