Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 444
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a database of products. Queries for frequently accessed
products must have retrieval times of microseconds. To ensure data consistency,
the application cache must be updated whenever products are added, changed, or
deleted.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Set up an Amazon DynamoDB database and a DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster.
Chose_B: Set up an Amazon RDS database and an Amazon ElastiCache for Redis cluster. Implement a lazy loading caching strategy with ElastiCache.
Chose_C: Setup an Amazon DynamoDB database that has an in-memory cache. Implement a lazy loading caching strategy in the application.
Chose_D: Set up an Amazon RDS database and an Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster. Specify a TTL setting for the DAX cluster.
Explain: DynamoDB paired with DAX is the correct AWS-managed solution for microsecond read performance and caching without application changes.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 416
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on an application that will be deployed on AWS. The
developer needs to test and debug the code locally. The code is packaged and
stored in an Amazon S3 bucket.

How can the developer test and debug the code locally with the LEAST amount of
configuration?
Chose_A: Create an application and a deployment group in AWS CodeDeploy. For the compute platform, specify the local machine as the individual instance for the deployment. For the repository type, specify that the application is stored in Amazon S3. Start the deployment to test on the local machine.
Chose_B: Create a repository in AWS CodeArtifact. Publish the application code package to the repository. Before deployment, create an upstream repository to test and validate the code.
Chose_C: Create a build project in AWS CodeBuild. In AWS CodePipeline, add a CodeBuild test action by adding a stage and an action. For the action provider, specify a CodeBuild test and the build project. View the build log to see the test results.
Chose_D: Install the AWS CodeDeploy agent locally to validate the deployment package. Run the codedeploy-local command. Specify the S3 bucket where the code package is located by using the --bundle-location option.
Explain: codedeploy-local is the correct tool for validating a CodeDeploy bundle locally before uploading to AWS.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 427
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that uses an Amazon API Gateway API to invoke an
AWS Lambda function. The application is latency sensitive.

A developer needs to configure the Lambda function to reduce the cold start time
that is associated with default scaling.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Publish a new version of the Lambda function. Configure provisioned concurrency. Set the provisioned concurrency limit to meet the company requirements.
Chose_B: Increase the Lambda function's memory to the maximum amount. Increase the Lambda function's reserved concurrency limit.
Chose_C: Increase the reserved concurrency of the Lambda function to a number that matches the current production load.
Chose_D: Use Service Quotas to request an increase in the Lambda function's concurrency limit for the AWS account where the function is deployed.
Explain: Provisioned concurrency ensures the required number of Lambda execution environments are pre-initialized to handle predictable load and eliminate cold starts.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 429
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An ecommerce startup is preparing for an annual sales event. As the traffic to
the company's application increases, the development team wants to be notified
when the Amazon EC2 instance's CPU utilization exceeds 80%.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Create a custom Amazon CloudWatch alarm that sends a notification to an Amazon SNS topic when the CPU utilization exceeds 80%.
Chose_B: Create a custom AWS CloudTrail alarm that sends a notification to an Amazon SNS topic when the CPU utilization exceeds 80%.
Chose_C: Create a cron job on the EC2 instance that invokes the --describe-instance-information command on the host instance every 15 minutes and sends the results to an Amazon SNS topic.
Chose_D: Create an AWS Lambda function that queries the AWS CloudTrail logs for the CPUUtilization metric every 15 minutes and sends a notification to an Amazon SNS topic when the CPU utilization exceeds 80%.
Explain: CPUUtilization is a standard EC2 CloudWatch metric. The correct solution is to create a CloudWatch alarm that sends notifications via SNS.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 450
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has an application that uses AWS Lambda functions and AWS
CloudFormation templates. Usage of the application has increased. As a result,
the Lambda functions are encountering rate limit errors when they retrieve data.

The Lambda functions retrieve an advanced parameter from AWS Systems Manager
Parameter Store on every call. The parameter changes only during new
deployments. Because the application’s usage is unpredictable, the developer
needs a way to avoid the rate limiting.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
Chose_A: Configure the Lambda functions to use reserved concurrency that is equal to the last month’s average number of concurrent invocations.
Chose_B: Add a retry mechanism with exponential backoff to the call to Parameter Store.
Chose_C: Request a service quota increase for Parameter Store GetParameter API operations to match the expected usage of the Lambda functions.
Chose_D: Add an SSM dynamic reference as an environment variable to the Lambda functions resource in the CloudFormation templates.
Explain: Using SSM dynamic references as Lambda environment variables removes the need for runtime GetParameter API calls, eliminating throttling and improving performance.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 451
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is using an AWS Lambda function to process data. The developer needs
to extract custom metrics about processing times from the Lambda logs. The
developer needs to analyze the metrics, set alarms, and detect issues in real
time.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Publish custom metric data to AWS CloudTrail by using the PutMetricData API operation. Classify and collect the metrics. Create graphs and alarms in CloudTrail for the custom metrics.
Chose_B: Use the open source client libraries provided by Amazon to generate the logs in the Amazon CloudWatch embedded metric format. Use CloudWatch to create the required graphs and alarms for the custom metrics.
Chose_C: Use Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights to create custom metrics by querying the logs that come from the Lambda function. Use CloudWatch to create the required graphs and alarms for the custom metrics.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon Kinesis data stream to stream log events in real time from Lambda. Specify an Amazon S3 bucket as the destination for the Kinesis data stream. Use Amazon CloudWatch to visualize the log data and to set alarms.
Explain: The correct way to publish custom metrics from Lambda is to use CloudWatch Embedded Metric Format with the supported client libraries.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 458
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has implemented a pipeline in AWS CodePipeline. The company is using a
single AWS account and does not use AWS Organizations. The company needs to test
its AWS CloudFormation templates in its primary AWS Region and a disaster
recovery Region.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the MOST operational
efficiency?
Chose_A: In the CodePipeline pipeline, implement an AWS CodeDeploy action for each Region to deploy and test the CloudFormation templates. Update CodePipeline and AWS CodeBuild with appropriate permissions.
Chose_B: Configure CodePipeline to deploy and test the CloudFormation templates. Use CloudFormation StackSets to start deployment across both Regions.
Chose_C: Configure CodePipeline to invoke AWS CodeBuild to deploy and test the CloudFormation templates in each Region. Update CodeBuild and CloudFormation with appropriate permissions.
Chose_D: Use the Snyk action in CodePipeline to deploy and test the CloudFormation templates in each Region.
Explain: Using CloudFormation StackSets is the correct way to deploy CloudFormation templates across multiple Regions through CodePipeline.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 438
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a virtual reality (VR) game. The game has a serverless backend
that consists of Amazon API Gateway, AWS Lambda, and Amazon DynamoDB. Recently,
the company noticed a sudden increase of new users globally. The company also
noticed delays in the retrieval of user data.

Which AWS service or feature can the company use to reduce the database response
time to microseconds?
Chose_A: Amazon ElastiCache
Chose_B: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX)
Chose_C: DynamoDB auto scaling
Chose_D: Amazon CloudFront
Explain: DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) is the correct choice when the question involves reducing response times or providing in‑memory caching specifically for DynamoDB.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 448
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application on AWS. The application has an Amazon API
Gateway API that sends requests to an AWS Lambda function. The API is
experiencing increased latency because the Lambda function has limited available
CPU to fulfill the requests.

Before the developer deploys the API into production, the developer must
configure the Lambda function to have more CPU.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Increase the virtual CPU (vCPU) cores quota of the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Increase the amount of memory that is allocated to the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Increase the ephemeral storage size of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Increase the timeout value of the Lambda function.
Explain: Increasing Lambda memory also increases the allocated CPU, which improves performance. vCPU cannot be increased directly.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 435
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has a serverless application that uses an Amazon API Gateway API to
invoke an AWS Lambda function. A developer creates a fix for a defect in the
Lambda function code. The developer wants to deploy this fix to the production
environment.

To test the changes, the developer needs to send 10% of the live production
traffic to the updated Lambda function version.

Which combination of steps will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Publish a new version of the Lambda function that contains the updated code.
Chose_B: Set up a new stage in API Gateway with a new Lambda function version. Enable weighted routing in API Gateway stages.
Chose_C: Create an alias for the Lambda function. Configure weighted routing on the alias. Specify a 10% weight for the new Lambda function version.
Chose_D: Set up a routing policy on a Network Load Balancer. Configure 10% of the traffic to go to the new Lambda function version.
Chose_E: E. Set up a weighted routing policy by using Amazon Route 53. Configure 10% of the traffic to go to the new Lambda function version.
Explain: To send a small percentage of traffic to a new Lambda version, you must first publish the new version and then use a Lambda alias with weighted routing. Options A and C together provide this.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 422
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is automating a new application deployment with AWS Serverless
Application Model (AWS SAM). The new application has one AWS Lambda function and
one Amazon S3 bucket. The Lambda function must access the S3 bucket to only read
objects.

How should the developer configure AWS SAM to grant the necessary read privilege
to the S3 bucket?
Chose_A: Reference a second Lambda authorizer function.
Chose_B: Add a custom S3 bucket policy to the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) topic for only S3 object reads. Reference the topic in the template.
Chose_D: Add the S3ReadPolicy template to the Lambda function's execution role.
Explain: To allow a Lambda function to read from S3, you attach the S3ReadPolicy to its execution role. This grants the required permissions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 452
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to fix an AWS CodeDeploy deployment that failed. During the
failed deployment, the developer received the following error message:

“The overall deployment failed because too many individual instances failed
deployment, too few healthy instances are available for deployment, or some
instances in your deployment group are experiencing problems. (Error code:
HEALTH-CONSTRAINTS)”

What are the possible causes of the failed deployment? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: The CodeDeploy agent was not running on the instances that CodeDeploy was trying to deploy to.
Chose_B: The unified Amazon CloudWatch agent was not running on the instances that CodeDeploy was trying to deploy to.
Chose_C: The developer’s IAM role did not have the necessary permissions to perform code deployment to the instances.
Chose_D: CodeDeploy was trying to deploy to instances that were attached to an IAM instance profile that did not have the required permissions.
Chose_E: E. CodeDeploy was trying to deploy to instances that were not set up with correct CodeDeploy health checks.
Explain: CodeDeploy most commonly fails when the CodeDeploy agent is not running on the target instances or when the attached IAM instance profile lacks required permissions. Health checks are not a standard cause of CodeDeploy deployment failures in this context.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 453
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is developing a serverless application that requires storage of
sensitive API keys as environment variables for various services. The
application requires the automatic rotation of the encryption keys every year.

Which solution will meet these requirements with no development effort?
Chose_A: Encrypt the environment variables by using AWS Secrets Manager. Set up automatic rotation in Secrets Manager.
Chose_B: Encrypt the environment variables by using AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer managed keys. Enable automatic key rotation.
Chose_C: Encrypt the environment variables by using AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) AWS managed keys. Configure a custom AWS Lambda function to automate key rotation.
Chose_D: Encrypt the environment variables by using AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Set up automatic rotation in Parameter Store.
Explain: KMS key rotation does not rotate or re-encrypt existing Lambda environment variables. Secrets Manager provides proper automatic rotation for sensitive data.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 436
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a video search application for a global company. The
video files have an average size of 2.5 TB. The video storage system must
provide instant access to the video files for the first 90 days. After the first
90 days, the video files can take more than 10 minutes to load.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
Chose_A: Upload the video files to the Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) Standard storage class for the first 90 days. After 90 days, transition the video files to the EFS Standard-Infrequent Access (Standard-IA) storage class.
Chose_B: Upload the video files to Amazon S3. Use the S3 Glacier Deep Archive storage class for the first 90 days. After 90 days, transition the video file to the S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval storage class.
Chose_C: Use Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) to store the video files for the first 90 days. After 90 days, transition the video files to the Amazon S3 Glacier Deep Archive storage class.
Chose_D: Upload the video files to Amazon S3. Use the S3 Glacier Instant Retrieval storage class for the first 90 days. After 90 days, transition the video files to the S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval storage class.
Explain: S3 Glacier Instant Retrieval provides low‑cost storage with immediate access, suitable for the first 90 days. After that period, transitioning to Glacier Flexible Retrieval reduces cost for infrequently accessed archives.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 456
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application ingests data from an Amazon Kinesis data stream. The shards in
the data stream are set for normal traffic.

During tests for peak traffic, the application ingests data slowly. A developer
needs to adjust the data stream to handle the peak traffic.

What should the developer do to meet this requirement MOST cost-effectively?
Chose_A: Install the Kinesis Producer Library (KPL) to ingest data into the data stream.
Chose_B: Switch to on-demand capacity mode for the data stream. Specify a partition key when writing data to the data stream.
Chose_C: Decrease the amount of time that data is kept in the data stream by using the DecreaseStreamRetentionPeriod API operation.
Chose_D: Increase the shard count in the data stream by using the UpdateShardCount API operation.
Explain: Increasing the shard count raises the stream’s ingest and read capacity, resolving throughput bottlenecks.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 455
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application stores user data in Amazon S3 buckets in multiple AWS Regions. A
developer needs to implement a solution that analyzes the user data in the S3
buckets to find sensitive information. The analysis findings from all the S3
buckets must be available in the eu-west-2 Region.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Create an AWS Lambda function to generate findings. Program the Lambda function to send the findings to another S3 bucket in eu-west-2.
Chose_B: Configure Amazon Macie to generate findings. Use Amazon EventBridge to create rules that copy the findings to eu-west-2.
Chose_C: Configure Amazon Inspector to generate findings. Use Amazon EventBridge to create rules that copy the findings to eu-west-2.
Chose_D: Configure Amazon Macie to generate findings and to publish the findings to AWS CloudTrail. Use a CloudTrail trail to copy the results to eu-west-2.
Explain: Amazon Macie automatically generates findings and publishes them to EventBridge, which can forward events to another region. This matches the requirement without extra components.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 501
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is launching a global application that delivers content to multiple
countries. The developer needs to serve specific content based on the country of
each user and each user’s primary language. The developer must ensure that
content is served reliably and with low latency.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create an Amazon API Gateway REST API. Create an AWS Global Accelerator standard accelerator to resolve requests to the API. Configure endpoint groups on the accelerator. Attach listeners for each country and language.
Chose_B: Store the content in a centralized Amazon S3 bucket. Enable S3 Transfer Acceleration on the bucket. Create an Amazon Route 53 hosted zone that includes the endpoint for the S3 bucket. Create records in Route 53 that use geoproximity and geolocation routing policies.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon API Gateway REST API. Connect the REST API to AWS WAF. Use geo match statements and regex match statements to allow or deny requests based on the labels returned from web request evaluations.
Chose_D: Configure an Amazon CloudFront distribution that uses the application as an origin. Configure the distribution to forward the Accept-Language header and the CloudFront-Viewer-Country header to the origin.
Explain: CloudFront is the correct service for global content delivery and can forward Accept-Language and country headers so the application can return localized content.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 502
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company generates SSL certificates from a third-party provider. The company
imports the certificates into AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) to use with public
web applications.

A developer must implement a solution to notify the company’s security team 90
days before an imported certificate expires. The company already has configured
an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. The company also has
configured an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic that has the
security team’s email address as a subscriber.

Which solution will provide the security team with the required notification
about certificates?
Chose_A: Create an Amazon EventBridge rule that specifies the ACM Certificate Approaching Expiration event type. Set the SNS topic as the EventBridge rule’s target.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Lambda function to search for all certificates that are expiring within 90 days. Program the Lambda function to send each identified certificate’s Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in a message to the SQS queue.
Chose_C: Create an AWS Step Functions workflow that is invoked by each certificate’s expiration notification from AWS CloudTrail. Create an AWS Lambda function to send each certificate's Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in a message to the SQS queue.
Chose_D: Configure AWS Config with the acm-certificate-expiration-check managed rule to run every 24 hours. Create an Amazon EventBridge rule that includes an event pattern that specifies the Config Rules Compliance Change detail type and the configured rule. Set the SNS topic as the EventBridge rule’s target.
Explain: ACM natively emits the Certificate Approaching Expiration event to EventBridge. The simplest and correct solution is to create an EventBridge rule for that event and send notifications to SNS.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 503
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has an AWS Lambda function that needs to access an Amazon DynamoDB
table named DailyOrders. The Lambda function must be able to perform read
operations on the table. The Lambda function must not be able to perform write
operations on the table.

The developer needs to create an IAM policy to associate with the Lambda
function's execution role.

Which IAM policy statement will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image34.png]
Chose_B: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image35.png]
Chose_C: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image36.png]
Chose_D: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image37.png]
Explain: The question text was not provided, but based on available information, the most voted answer is assumed to be correct.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 504
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on a new authorization mechanism for an application. The
developer must create an Amazon API Gateway API and must test JSON Web Token
(JWT) authorization on the API.

The developer must use the built-in authorizer and must avoid managing the code
with custom logic. The developer needs to define an API route that is available
at /auth to test the authorizer configuration.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create a WebSocket API and the /auth route. Configure and attach the JWT authorizer to the API. Deploy the API.
Chose_B: Create a WebSocket API and the /auth route. Create and configure an AWS Lambda authorizer. Attach the Lambda authorizer to the API. Deploy the API.
Chose_C: Create an HTTP API and the /auth route. Create and configure an AWS Lambda authorizer. Attach the Lambda authorizer to the /auth route. Deploy the API.
Chose_D: Create an HTTP API and the /auth route. Configure the JWT authorizer. Attach the JWT authorizer to the /auth route. Deploy the API.
Explain: HTTP APIs natively support JWT authorizers, which can be attached directly to routes such as /auth. This is the simplest and correct setup for JWT-based authorization.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 505
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is creating a new application that gives users the ability to upload
and share short video files. The average size of the video files is 10 MB. After
a user uploads a file, a message needs to be placed into an Amazon Simple Queue
Service (Amazon SQS) queue so the file can be processed. The files need to be
accessible for processing within 5 minutes.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
Chose_A: Write the files to Amazon S3 Glacier Deep Archive. Add the S3 location of the files to the SQS queue.
Chose_B: Write the files to Amazon S3 Standard. Add the S3 location of the files to the SQS queue.
Chose_C: Write the files to an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) General Purpose SSD volume. Add the EBS location of the files to the SQS queue.
Chose_D: Write messages that contain the contents of the uploaded files to the SQS queue.
Explain: Large files should be stored in S3 Standard and only a pointer or location should be sent through SQS to avoid size limits and ensure quick access.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 506
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is updating the code for an AWS Lambda function to add new
capabilities. The Lambda function has version aliases for production and
development environments that run separate versions of the function. The
developer needs to configure a staging environment for the Lambda function to
handle invocations to both the development version and the production version.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create a weighted alias that references the production version of the function and the updated version of the function.
Chose_B: Add a Network Load Balancer. Add the production version of the function and updated version of the function as targets.
Chose_C: Use AWS CodeDeploy to create a linear traffic shifting deployment
Chose_D: Create a tag for the Lambda function that contains the production version and updated version of the code.
Explain: AWS CodeDeploy is the recommended and supported service for performing controlled and automated traffic shifting deployments for Lambda functions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 528
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an ecommerce application that uses multiple AWS Lambda
functions. Each function performs a specific step in a customer order workflow,
such as order processing and inventory management.

The developer must ensure that the Lambda functions run in a specific order.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Configure an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue to contain messages about each step a function must perform. Configure the Lambda functions to run sequentially based on the order of messages in the SQS queue.
Chose_B: Configure an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic to contain notifications about each step a function must perform. Subscribe the Lambda functions to the SNS topic. Use subscription filters based on the step each function must perform.
Chose_C: Configure an AWS Step Functions state machine to invoke the Lambda functions in a specific order.
Chose_D: Configure Amazon EventBridge Scheduler schedules to invoke the Lambda functions in a specific order.
Explain: AWS Step Functions is the correct service for orchestrating multiple Lambda functions in a specific, controlled order.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 519
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is writing a mobile application that allows users to view images
from an S3 bucket. The users must be able to log in with their Amazon login, as
well as supported social media accounts.

How can the developer provide this authentication functionality?
Chose_A: Use Amazon Cognito with web identity federation.
Chose_B: Use Amazon Cognito with SAML-based identity federation.
Chose_C: Use IAM access keys and secret keys in the application code to allow Get* on the S3 bucket.
Chose_D: Use AWS STS AssumeRole in the application code and assume a role with Get* permissions on the S3 bucket.
Explain: For client-side access to S3 without embedding credentials, Amazon Cognito with web identity federation is the correct approach.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 514
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has deployed an AWS Lambda function that is subscribed to an Amazon
Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. The developer must implement a
solution to add a record of each Lambda function invocation to an Amazon Simple
Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Configure the SQS queue as a dead-letter queue for the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Create code that uses the AWS SDK to call the SQS SendMessage operation to add the invocation details to the SQS queue. Add the code to the end of the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Add two asynchronous invocation destinations to the Lambda function: one destination for successful invocations and one destination for failed invocations. Configure the SQS queue as the destination for each type. Create an Amazon CloudWatch alarm based on the DestinationDeliveryFailures metric to catch any message that cannot be delivered.
Chose_D: Add a single asynchronous invocation destination to the Lambda function to capture successful invocations. Configure the SQS queue as the destination. Create an Amazon CloudWatch alarm based on the DestinationDeliveryFailures metric to catch any message that cannot be delivered.
Explain: Using asynchronous invocation destinations for both success and failure and sending them to SQS is the correct way to capture all invocation results and monitor delivery failures.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 510
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An AWS Lambda function generates a 3 MB JSON file and then uploads it to an
Amazon S3 bucket daily. The file contains sensitive information, so the
developer must ensure that it is encrypted before uploading to the bucket.

Which of the following modifications should the developer make to ensure that
the data is encrypted before uploading it to the bucket?
Chose_A: Use the default AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key for Amazon S3 in the Lambda function code.
Chose_B: Use the S3 managed key and call the GenerateDataKey API to encrypt the file.
Chose_C: Use the GenerateDataKey API, then use that data key to encrypt the file in the Lambda function code.
Chose_D: Use an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer managed key for Amazon S3 in the Lambda function code.
Explain: To encrypt data in Lambda before uploading to S3, you must call GenerateDataKey from a KMS customer-managed key, then use the returned plaintext data key to encrypt the file. Options using S3-managed keys cannot directly generate data keys.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 457
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application that uses an AWS Lambda function to
process data. The application requires minimum latency. The Lambda function must
have predictable function start times. All setup activities for the execution
environment must happen before invocation of the Lambda function.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Increase the memory of the Lambda function to the maximum amount. Configure an Amazon EventBridge rule to schedule invocations of the Lambda function every minute to keep the execution environment active.
Chose_B: Optimize the static initialization code that runs when a new execution environment is prepared for the first time. Decrease and compress the size of the Lambda function package and the imported libraries and dependencies.
Chose_C: Increase the reserved concurrency of the Lambda function to the maximum value for unreserved account concurrency. Run any setup activities manually before the initial invocation of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Publish a new version of the Lambda function. Configure provisioned concurrency for the Lambda function with the required minimum number of execution environments.
Explain: Provisioned concurrency keeps Lambda execution environments initialized and warm, minimizing cold-start latency. This is the correct solution for improving performance during initial invocations.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 460
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is implementing a serverless application by using AWS CloudFormation
to provision Amazon S3 web hosting. Amazon API Gateway, and AWS Lambda
functions. The Lambda function source code is zipped and uploaded to an S3
bucket. The S3 object key of the zipped source code is specified in the Lambda
resource in the CloudFormation template.

The developer notices that there are no changes in the Lambda function every
time the CloudFormation stack is updated.

How can the developer resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Create a new Lambda function alias before updating the CloudFormation stack.
Chose_B: Change the S3 object key or the S3 version in the CloudFormation template before updating the CloudFormation stack.
Chose_C: Upload the zipped source code to another S3 bucket before updating the CioudFormation stack.
Chose_D: Associate a cade signing configuration with the Lambda function before updating the CloudFormation stack.
Explain: CloudFormation requires a change to the Lambda code reference when updating a Lambda-backed resource. Changing the S3 object key or version ensures CloudFormation detects a code update.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 462
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application that processes a stream of user-supplied
data. The data stream must be consumed by multiple Amazon EC2 based processing
applications in parallel and in real time. Each processor must be able to resume
without losing data if there is a service interruption. The application
architect plans to add other processors in the near future, and wants to
minimize the amount of data duplication involved.

Which solution will satisfy these requirements?
Chose_A: Publish the data to Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS).
Chose_B: Publish the data to Amazon Data Firehose.
Chose_C: Publish the data to Amazon EventBridge.
Chose_D: Publish the data to Amazon Kinesis Data Streams.
Explain: Kinesis Data Streams is the correct service for real‑time ingestion of high‑throughput streaming data.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 464
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is using AWS CloudFormation to deploy an AWS Lambda function. The
developer needs to set the Lambda function's timeout value based on the
environment parameter of the template. The template contains mappings of
EnvironmentData for each environment's timeout value. The environment parameter
and EnvironmentData mappings are as follows:

Environment parameter:

[https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image27.png]

EnvironmentData mappings:

[https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image28.png]

Which statement will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Timeout: !GetAtt [EnvironmentData, !Ref Environment, Timeout]
Chose_B: Timeout: !FindInMap [EnvironmentData, !Ref Environment, Timeout]
Chose_C: Timeout: !Select [EnvironmentData, !Ref Environment, Timeout]
Chose_D: Timeout: !ForEach[EnvironmentData, !Ref Environment, Timeout]
Explain: Fn::FindInMap is the correct intrinsic function to retrieve values from a CloudFormation mapping.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 465
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company’s AWS accounts are in an organization in AWS Organizations. An
application in Account A uses environment variables that are stored as
parameters in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. A developer is creating a new
application in Account B that needs to use the same environment variables.

The application in Account B needs access to the parameters in Account A without
duplicating the parameters into Account B.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Configure the application in Account B to use credentials for an IAM user in AccountA that has access to the parameters.
Chose_B: Create an assumable IAM role in Account A. Grant the role the permission to access the parameters.
Chose_C: Configure cross-account resource sharing for the parameters by using AWS Resource Access Manager (AWS RAM).
Chose_D: Write a script that stores the parameter values in a private Amazon S3 bucket that both accounts can access.
Explain: AWS RAM cannot share SSM Parameter Store parameters. Cross-account access requires creating an IAM role in Account A that Account B can assume.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 471
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that uses an Amazon Cognito user pool for
authentication. A developer needs to add a new REST API that will use the user
pool to authenticate requests.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Create a new API key and a new usage plan. Associate the API key and the REST API with the usage plan.
Chose_B: Create a Cognito authorizer for the correct user pool. Reference the header that contains the Cognito token.
Chose_C: Create an AWS Lambda token authorizer. Reference the authorization token in the event payload. Authenticate requests based on the token value.
Chose_D: Create an AWS Lambda request authorizer. Reference the authorization header in the event payload. Authenticate requests by using the header value in a request to the Cognito API.
Explain: Using an Amazon Cognito authorizer is the correct way to validate Cognito user pool tokens in API Gateway.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 473
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer created reusable code that several AWS Lambda functions need to use.
The developer bundled the code into a zip archive. The developer needs to deploy
the code to AWS and update the Lambda functions to use the code.

Which solution will meet this requirement in the MOST operationally efficient
way?
Chose_A: Upload the zip archive to Amazon S3. Configure an import path on the Lambda functions to point to the zip archive.
Chose_B: Create a new Lambda function that contains and runs the shared code. Update the existing Lambda functions to invoke the new Lambda function synchronously.
Chose_C: Create a Lambda layer that contains the zip archive. Attach the Lambda layer to the Lambda functions.
Chose_D: Create a Lambda container image that includes the shared code. Use the container image as a Lambda base image for all the functions.
Explain: Lambda layers are the correct way to share common code across multiple Lambda functions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 475
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer manages encryption keys in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). The
developer must ensure that all encryption keys can be deleted immediately when
the keys are no longer required. The developer wants a solution that is highly
available and does not require manual management for compute infrastructure.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Use AWS KMS managed keys. When the keys are no longer required, schedule the keys for immediate deletion.
Chose_B: Use customer managed keys with imported key material. When the keys are no longer required, delete the imported key material.
Chose_C: Use customer managed keys. When the keys are no longer required, delete the key material.
Chose_D: Use customer managed keys and an AWS CloudHSM key store. When the keys are no longer required, schedule the keys for immediate deletion.
Explain: Only customer managed KMS keys with imported key material allow immediate key deletion by removing the imported material. All other KMS key types require a waiting period.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 477
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application interacts with Amazon Aurora to store and track customer
information. The primary database is set up with multiple read replicas for
improving the performance of the read queries. However, one of the Aurora
replicas is receiving most or all of the traffic, while the other Aurora replica
remains idle.

How can this issue be resolved?
Chose_A: Disable application-level DNS caching.
Chose_B: Enable application-level DNS caching.
Chose_C: Enable application pooling
Chose_D: Disable application pooling
Explain: Disabling application-level DNS caching ensures the application always resolves the most current IP addresses, which is important when backend endpoints change frequently.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 480
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company runs a new application on AWS Elastic Beanstalk. The company needs to
deploy updates to the application. The updates must not cause any downtime for
application users.

The deployment must forward a specified percentage of incoming client traffic to
a new application version during an evaluation period.

Which deployment type will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: rolling
Chose_B: traffic-splitting
Chose_C: in-place
Chose_D: immutable
Explain: Traffic-splitting is used when gradually shifting traffic between versions, which is likely what the question required.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 516
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to configure an AWS Lambda function to make HTTP POST requests
to an internal application. The application is in the same AWS account that
hosts the function. The internal application runs on Amazon EC2 instances in a
private subnet within a VPC.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure a VPC endpoint to connect to the private subnet. Attach the endpoint to the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Attach the Lambda function to the VPC and to the private subnet.
Chose_C: Configure a VPN connection between the Lambda function and the private subnet. Attach the VPN to the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Configure the VPC route table to include the Lambda function’s IP address.
Explain: To access resources in a private subnet, the Lambda function must be configured to run within the VPC and attached to the private subnet.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 469
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an application that uses an Amazon DynamoDB table. The
developer needs to develop code that reads all records that were added to the
table during the previous day, creates HTML reports, and pushes the reports into
third-party storage. The item size varies from 1 KB to 4 KB, and the index
structure is defined with the date. The developer needs to minimize the read
capacity that the application requires from the DynamoDB table.

Which DynamoDB API operation should the developer use in the code to meet these
requirements?
Chose_A: Query
Chose_B: Scan
Chose_C: BatchGetItem
Chose_D: GetItem
Explain: The question text was not provided, so the correct answer cannot be determined.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 476
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an ecommerce application. The application's API sends order data
to an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SOS) queue. A developer needs to
modify the application to enrich the order data before the application sends the
order data to a fulfillment system.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Create an AWS Lambda function to poll the SOS queue. enrich the message data, and send the enriched data to the fulfilment system, Create an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Subscribe the Lambda function to the SNS topic.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Step Functions state machine. Configure an Amazon EventBridge rule to run the state machine when an order is published to the SQS queue. Map the orders to an AWS Lambda function. Program the Lambda function to perform the data enrichment and to invoke the state machine. Configure the last step of the state machine to send the enriched data to the fulfilment system,
Chose_C: Create an Amazon EMR cluster to read messages from the SQS queue. Configure an EMR job to enrich the order data. Create and configure an Amazon S3 bucket as the output location. Adjust the order fulfilment system to retrieve the enriched files from the S3 bucket.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon EventBridge pipe that uses event enrichment. Configure the SQS queue as a source for the pipe. Set the fulfillment system as the target of the pipe.
Explain: EventBridge Pipes natively supports reading from SQS, performing event enrichment, and sending the enriched data to a target system without custom polling or orchestration.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 490
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company hosts applications on premises. The on-premises servers generate audit
logs that are available through an HTTP endpoint.

The company needs an automated solution to regularly ingest and store large
volumes of audit data from the on-premises servers. The company also needs to
perform queries on the audit data.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST operationally efficient
way?
Chose_A: Export the audit logs. Upload the logs to Amazon S3. Import the logs to an Amazon RDS DB instance.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Lambda function to call the HTTP endpoint to fetch audit logs. Configure an Amazon EventBridge scheduled rule to invoke the Lambda function. Configure the Lambda function to push the logs to AWS CloudTrail Lake.
Chose_C: Use AWS DataSync to transfer audit logs to an Amazon S3 bucket. Load the logs into an Amazon S3 bucket. Use Amazon Athena to query the bucket.
Chose_D: Install the Amazon CloudWatch agent on the on-premises servers. Give the agent the ability to push audit logs to CloudWatch. Use CloudWatch Insights to query the logs.
Explain: Lambda scheduled to pull logs from an HTTP endpoint and ingest them into CloudTrail Lake matches AWS best practices for centralized, queryable audit log storage.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 512
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An Amazon Data Firehose delivery stream is receiving customer data that contains
personally identifiable information. A developer needs to remove pattern-based
customer identifiers from the data and store the modified data in an Amazon S3
bucket.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Implement Firehose data transformation as an AWS Lambda function. Configure the function to remove the customer identifiers. Set an Amazon S3 bucket as the destination of the delivery stream.
Chose_B: Launch an Amazon EC2 instance. Set the EC2 instance as the destination of the delivery stream. Run an application on the EC2 instance to remove the customer identifiers. Store the transformed data in an Amazon S3 bucket.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon OpenSearch Service instance. Set the OpenSearch Service instance as the destination of the delivery stream. Use search and replace to remove the customer identifiers. Export the data to an Amazon S3 bucket.
Chose_D: Create an AWS Step Functions workflow to remove the customer identifiers. As the last step in the workflow, store the transformed data in an Amazon S3 bucket. Set the workflow as the destination of the delivery stream.
Explain: Kinesis Data Firehose supports native data transformation using Lambda, making option A the correct and most efficient way to remove customer identifiers before storing data in S3.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 509
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A gaming company has deployed a web portal on AWS Elastic Beanstalk. The company
sometimes needs to deploy new versions three or four times in a day. The company
needs to deploy new features for all users as quickly as possible. The solution
must minimize performance impact and must maximize availability.

What solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Use a rolling deployment policy to deploy to Amazon EC2 instances.
Chose_B: Use an immutable deployment policy to deploy to Amazon EC2 instances.
Chose_C: Use an all-at-once deployment policy to deploy to Amazon EC2 instances.
Chose_D: Use a-canary deployment strategy to deploy changes to Amazon EC2 instances.
Explain: Immutable deployments are typically the safest and most reliable option for EC2-based deployments, offering predictable rollback and avoiding configuration drift.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 521
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is hosting an Amazon AP! Gateway REST API that calls a single AWS
Lambda function. The function is infrequently invoked by multiple clients at the
same time.

The code performance is optimal, but the company wants to optimize the startup
time of the function

What can a developer do to optimize the initialization of the function?
Chose_A: Enable API Gateway caching for the REST API.
Chose_B: Configure provisioned concurrency for the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Use Lambda proxy integration for the REST API.
Chose_D: Configure AWS Global Accelerator for the Lambda function.
Explain: Provisioned concurrency is the correct option when the question involves reducing Lambda cold starts or improving consistent performance.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 459
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an Amazon API Gateway REST API that integrates with an AWS Lambda
function. The API’s development stage references a development alias of the
Lambda function named dev.

A developer needs make a production alias of the Lambda function named prod
available through the API.

Which solution meets these requirements?
Chose_A: Create a new method on the API. Name the method production. Configure the method to include a stage variable that points to the prod Lambda function alias.
Chose_B: Create a new method on the API. Name the method production. Configure an integration request on the API’s development stage that points to the prod Lambda function alias.
Chose_C: Deploy the API to a new stage named production. Configure the stage to include a stage variable that points to the prod Lambda function alias.
Chose_D: Deploy the API to a new stage named production. Configure an integration request on the API’s production stage that points to the prod Lambda function alias.
Explain: To route an API Gateway stage to a specific Lambda alias, you deploy a new stage and configure a stage variable that the integration request uses to reference the correct Lambda alias.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 496
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company offers a business-to-business software service that runs on dedicated
infrastructure deployed in each customer’s AWS account. Before a feature
release, the company needs to run integration tests on real AWS test
infrastructure. The test infrastructure consists of Amazon EC2 instances and an
Amazon RDS database.

A developer must set up a continuous delivery process that will provision the
test infrastructure across the different AWS accounts. The developer then must
run the integration tests.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST administrative
effort?
Chose_A: Use AWS CodeDeploy with AWS CloudFormation StackSets to deploy the infrastructure. Use Amazon CodeGuru to run the tests.
Chose_B: Use AWS CodePipeline with AWS CloudFormation StackSets to deploy the infrastructure. Use AWS CodeBuild to run the tests.
Chose_C: Use AWS CodePipeline with AWS CloudFormation change sets to deploy the infrastructure. Use a CloudFormation custom resource to run the tests.
Chose_D: Use AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) templates with AWS CloudFormation change sets to deploy the infrastructure. Use AWS CodeDeploy to run the tests.
Explain: CodePipeline orchestrates the workflow, CloudFormation StackSets handles multi‑account or multi‑region infrastructure deployment, and CodeBuild is the correct service for running automated tests.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 526
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application that will process messages from an Amazon
Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) standard queue. The application needs to
process the messages in an Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) task.

Which actions will result in the MOST cost-effective processing of the messages?
(Choose two.)
Chose_A: Use long polling to query the queue for new messages.
Chose_B: Use short polling to query the queue for new messages.
Chose_C: Use message batching to retrieve messages from the queue.
Chose_D: Use Amazon ElastiCache to cache messages in the queue.
Chose_E: E. Use an SQS FIFO queue to manage the messages.
Explain: Long polling reduces empty responses and batching improves efficiency when retrieving messages from SQS.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 442
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on an ecommerce application that stores data in an Amazon
RDS for MySQL cluster. The developer needs to implement a caching layer for the
application to retrieve information about the most viewed products.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Edit the RDS for MySQL cluster by adding a cache node. Configure the cache endpoint instead of the cluster endpoint in the application.
Chose_B: Create an Amazon ElastiCache for Redis cluster. Update the application code to use the ElastiCache for Redis cluster endpoint.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster in front of the RDS for MySQL cluster. Configure the application to connect to the DAX endpoint instead of the RDS endpoint.
Chose_D: Configure the RDS for MySQL cluster to add a standby instance in a different Availability Zone. Configure the application to read the data from the standby instance.
Explain: To improve read performance and reduce load on an RDS MySQL database, the correct solution is to add an ElastiCache Redis cluster and update the application to use it as a cache.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 541
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company wants to send notifications to customers to advertise a sale on the
company’s products. The company needs to use Amazon Simple Notification Service
(Amazon SNS) FIFO topics.

The company needs to examine the rate at which the topics send notifications and
the latency with which the topics send notifications.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the MOST operational
efficiency?
Chose_A: Use AWS X-Ray. Enable active tracing for Amazon SNS.
Chose_B: Use the Amazon CloudWatch NumberOfNotificationsFailed metric.
Chose_C: Use AWS CloudTrail to log all Amazon SNS API calls.
Chose_D: Use Amazon GuardDuty. Enable runtime monitoring.
Explain: AWS X-Ray with active tracing for SNS is the correct method to trace and analyze SNS message delivery paths.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 486
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an AWS Step Functions state machine to handle an order
processing workflow. When the state machine receives an order, the state machine
pauses until the order has been confirmed. A record that is added to an Amazon
DynamoDB table by another service confirms each order.

The developer must complete the order processing workflow.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Update the state machine to query the DynamoDB table by using the DynamoDB GetItem state to determine whether a record exists. If the record does exist, continue to the next state. If the record does not exist, wait 5 minutes and check again.
Chose_B: Subscribe an AWS Lambda function to a DynamoDB table stream. Configure the Lambda function to run when a new record is added to the table. When the Lambda function receives the appropriate record, run the redrive execution command on the running state machine.
Chose_C: Subscribe an AWS Lambda function to the DynamoDB table stream. Configure the Lambda function to run when a new record is added to the table. When the Lambda function receives the appropriate record, stop the current state machine invocation and start a new invocation.
Chose_D: Invoke an AWS Lambda function from the state machine. Configure the Lambda function to continuously poll the DynamoDB table for the appropriate record and to return when a record exists. Continue the state machine invocation when the Lambda function returns. If the Lambda function times out, then fail the state machine.
Explain: Using a GetItem check with a Wait loop is the correct Step Functions pattern for periodically checking DynamoDB for a record without requiring streams or out‑of‑band coordination.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 548
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a new application that will give users the ability to
upload documents to Amazon S3. The contents of the documents must not be
accessible to any third party.

Which type of encryption will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Client-side encryption by using the S3 Encryption Client with a Raw RSA wrapping key that is stored on the user’s device
Chose_B: Server-side encryption with S3 managed keys (SSE-S3)
Chose_C: Server-side encryption with AWS KMS keys (SSE-KMS)
Chose_D: Dual-layer server-side encryption with AWS KMS keys (DSSE-KMS)
Explain: SSE-KMS is generally the correct choice when the question involves AWS‑managed encryption with auditability and fine‑grained key controls.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 546
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building the authentication mechanism for a new mobile app. Users
need to be able to sign up, sign in, and access secured backend AWS resources.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Use AWS Identity and Access Management Access Analyzer to generate IAM policies. Create an IAM role. Attach the policies to the role. Integrate the IAM role with an identity provider that the mobile app uses.
Chose_B: Create an IAM policy that grants access to the backend resources. Create an IAM role. Attach the policy to the role. Create an Amazon API Gateway endpoint. Attach the role to the endpoint. Integrate the endpoint with the mobile app.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon Cognito identity pool. Configure permissions by choosing a default IAM role for authenticated users or guest users in the identity pool. Associate the identity pool with an identity provider. Integrate the identity pool with the mobile app.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon Cognito user pool. Configure the security requirements by choosing a password policy, multi-factor authentication (MFA) requirements, and user account recovery options. Create an app client. Integrate the app client with the mobile app.
Explain: Cognito identity pools provide AWS credentials to a mobile app so it can access backend AWS resources. User pools (option D) handle authentication only and do not grant AWS resource access.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 555
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer created several AWS Lambda functions that write data to a single
Amazon S3 bucket. The developer configured all the Lambda functions to send logs
and metrics to Amazon CloudWatch.

The developer receives reports that one of the Lambda functions writes data to
the bucket very slowly. The developer needs to measure the latency between the
problematic Lambda function and the S3 bucket.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Enable AWS X-Ray on the Lambda function. In the generated trace map, select the line between Lambda and Amazon S3.
Chose_B: Query the Lambda function’s log file in Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights. Return the average of the auto-discovered @duration field.
Chose_C: Enable CloudWatch Lambda Insights on the function. View the latency graph that CloudWatch Lambda Insights provides.
Chose_D: Enable AWS X-Ray on the Lambda function. Select Amazon S3 in the latency graph to view the latency histogram.
Explain: X-Ray trace maps let you select the segment between Lambda and S3 to view the latency for that specific downstream call.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 551
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application includes an Amazon DynamoDB table that is named orders. The table
has a primary partition key of id and a global secondary index (GSI) that is
named an accountIndex. The GSI has a partition key of accountId and a sort key
of orderDateTime.

A developer needs to create an AWS Lambda function to retrieve the orders that
have an accountId of 100.

Which solution will meet this requirement by using the LEAST read capacity?
Chose_A: Define a DynamoDB API request for the GetItem action with the following parameters: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image43.png]
Chose_B: Define a DynamoDB API request for the BatchGetItem action with the following parameters: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image44.png]
Chose_C: Define a DynamoDB API request for the Scan action with the following parameters: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image45.png]
Chose_D: Define a DynamoDB API request for the Query action with the following parameters: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image46.png]
Explain: Without the full question context, the Query action is the most plausible correct choice among the provided options and aligns with the most‑voted answer.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 557
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is designing a game that stores data in an Amazon DynamoDB table.
The partition key of the table is the country of the player. After a sudden
increase in the number of players in a specific country, the developer notices
ProvisionedThroughputExceededException errors.

What should the developer do to resolve these errors?
Chose_A: Use strongly consistent table reads.
Chose_B: Revise the primary key to use more unique identifiers.
Chose_C: Use pagination to reduce the size of the items that the queries return.
Chose_D: Use the Scan operation to retrieve the data.
Explain: Revising the primary key to increase uniqueness helps distribute read and write traffic evenly across partitions, preventing performance issues in DynamoDB.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 507
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has implemented an AWS Lambda function that inserts new customers
into an Amazon RDS database. The function is expected to run hundreds of times
each hour. The function and RDS database are in the same VPC. The function is
configured to use 512 MB of RAM and is based on the following pseudo code:

[https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image38.png]

After successfully testing the function multiple times, the developer notices
that the execution time is longer than expected.

What should the developer do to improve performance?
Chose_A: Increase the reserved concurrency of the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Increase the size of the RDS database to facilitate an increased number of database connections each hour.
Chose_C: Move the database connection and close statement out of the handler. Place the connection in the global space.
Chose_D: Replace Amazon RDS with Amazon DynamoDB to implement control over the number of writes per second.
Explain: Reusing the database connection outside the Lambda handler reduces connection churn and prevents running out of connections.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 508
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is troubleshooting the permissions of an application that needs to
make changes to an Amazon RDS database. The developer has access to the IAM role
that the application is using.

Which command structure should the developer use to test the role permissions?
Chose_A: aws sts assume-role
Chose_B: aws iam attach-role-policy
Chose_C: aws ssm resume-session
Chose_D: aws rds add-role-to-db-cluster
Explain: Without the full question, the command most commonly associated with AWS role switching is aws sts assume-role, making the voted answer likely correct.

Balancer (ALB), Amazon EC2 instances, and Amazon RDS. There is an alias record
in Amazon Route 53 that points to the ALB. When the developer tries to access
the ALB from a laptop, the request times out.

Which logs should the developer investigate to verify that the request is
reaching the AWS network?
Chose_A: VPC Flow Logs
Chose_B: Amazon Route 53 logs
Chose_C: AWS Systems Manager Agent logs
Chose_D: Amazon CloudWatch agent logs

Title:
