[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 523
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has an application that uses AWS Security Token Service (AWS STS).
The application calls the STS AssumeRole API operation to provide trusted users
with temporary security credentials. The application calls AWS STS at the
service's default endpoint: https://sts.amazonaws.com.

The application is deployed in an Asia Pacific AWS Region. The application is
experiencing errors that are related to intermittent latency when the
application calls AWS STS.

What should the developer do to resolve this issue?
Chose_A: Update the application to use the GetSessionToken API operation.
Chose_B: Update the application to use the AssumeRoleWithSAML API operation.
Chose_C: Update the application to use a Regional STS endpoint that is closer to the application deployment.
Chose_D: Update the application to use the AssumeRoleWithWebldentity API operation. Move the STS endpoint to a global endpoint.
Explain: Using a Regional STS endpoint reduces latency and is the correct fix for performance issues related to STS calls.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 538
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company generates SSL certificates from a third-party provider. The company
imports the certificates into AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) to use with public
web applications.

A developer must implement a solution to notify the company’s security team 90
days before an imported certificate expires. The company already has configured
an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. The company also has
configured an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic that has the
security team’s email address as a subscriber.

Which solution will provide the security team with the required notification
about certificates?
Chose_A: Create an Amazon EventBridge rule that specifies the ACM Certificate Approaching Expiration event type. Set the SNS topic as the EventBridge rule’s target.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Lambda function to search for all certificates that are expiring within 90 days. Program the Lambda function to send each identified certificate’s Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in a message to the SQS queue.
Chose_C: Create an AWS Step Functions workflow that is invoked by each certificate’s expiration notification from AWS CloudTrail. Create an AWS Lambda function to send each certificate's Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in a message to the SQS queue.
Chose_D: Configure AWS Config with the acm-certificate-expiration-check managed rule to run every 24 hours. Create an Amazon EventBridge rule that includes an event pattern that specifies the Config Rules Compliance Change detail type and the configured rule. Set the SNS topic as the EventBridge rule’s target.
Explain: ACM natively publishes 'ACM Certificate Approaching Expiration' events to EventBridge, which is the correct and simplest way to detect expiring certificates and trigger notifications. The AWS Config rule in option D is slower, runs only every 24 hours, and is not the recommended mechanism.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 466
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
In a move toward using microservices, a company’s management team has asked all
development teams to build their services so that API requests depend only on
that service’s data store. One team is building a Payments service which has its
own database; the service needs data that originates in the Accounts database.
Both are using Amazon DynamoDB.

What approach will result in the simplest, decoupled, and reliable method to get
near-real time updates from the Accounts database?
Chose_A: Use AWS Glue to perform frequent ETL updates from the Accounts database to the Payments database.
Chose_B: Use Amazon ElastiCache in Payments, with the cache updated by triggers in the Accounts database.
Chose_C: Use Amazon Data Firehose to deliver all changes from the Accounts database to the Payments database.
Chose_D: Use Amazon DynamoDB Streams to deliver all changes from the Accounts database to the Payments database.
Explain: DynamoDB Streams is the correct service for capturing and propagating real‑time changes between DynamoDB tables.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 467
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer compiles an AWS Lambda function and packages the result as a .zip
file. The developer uses the Functions page on the Lambda console to attempt to
upload the local packaged .zip file. When pushing the package ta Lambda, the
console returns the following error:

[https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image29.png]

Which solutions can the developer use to publish the code? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Upload the package to Amazon 3. Use the Functions page on the Lambda console to upload the package from the S3 location.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Support ticket to increase the maximum package size.
Chose_C: Use the update-function-code AWS CLI command. Pass the --publish parameter.
Chose_D: Repackage the Lambda function as a Docker container image. Upload the image to Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR). Create a new Lambda function by using the Lambda console. Reference the image that is deployed to Amazon ECR.
Chose_E: E. Sign the .zip file digitally. Create a new Lambda function by using the Lambda console. Update the configuration of the new Lambda function to include the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the code signing configuration.
Explain: When a Lambda deployment package exceeds the size limits for direct upload, you can upload the code to S3 for zip-based functions or package the function as a container image in ECR. Options A and D cover these supported methods.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 468
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company runs an application on Amazon EC2 instances in an Auto Scaling group.
The application experiences variable loads throughout each day.

The company needs to collect detailed metrics from the EC2 instances to
right-size the instances. The company also wants to monitor custom application
metrics to ensure the application is performing efficiently.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Install the AWS X-Ray agent on the instances. Configure the agent to collect the EC2 instance metrics and the custom application metrics.
Chose_B: Install the Amazon CloudWatch agent on the instances. Configure the agent to collect the EC2 instance metrics and the custom application metrics.
Chose_C: Install the AWS SDK in the application’s cade. Update the application to use the AWS SDK to collect and publish the EC2 instance metrics and the custom application metrics.
Chose_D: Configure AWS CloudTrail to capture and analyze the EC2 instance metrics and the custom application metrics.
Explain: The CloudWatch agent is used to collect both EC2 instance metrics and custom application metrics, which matches the requirement.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]

Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is launching a feature that uses an HTTP API built with Amazon API
Gateway and AWS Lambda. An API Gateway endpoint performs several independent
tasks that run in a Lambda function. The independent tasks can take up to 10
minutes in total to finish running.

Users report that the endpoint sometimes returns an HTTP 604 status code. The
Lambda function invocations are successful.

Which solution will stop the endpoint from returning the HTTP 504 status cade?
Chose_A: Increase the Lambda function’s timeout value.
Chose_B: Increase the reserved concurrency of the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Increase the memory that is available to the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Refactor the Lambda function to start an AWS Step Functions state machine.
Explain: Without the full question, the only option that is generally correct for handling long-running or complex workflows that exceed Lambda limits is refactoring to Step Functions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 472
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is testing an AWS Lambda function that has an event source of an
Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. The developer notices that some
of the messages the Lambda function processes re-appear in the queue while the
messages are being processed.

The developer must correct this behavior.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Increase the timeout of the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Increase the visibility timeout of the SQS queue.
Chose_C: Increase the memory allocation of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Increase the batch size in the event source mapping.
Explain: For Lambda functions triggered by SQS, the queue's visibility timeout must exceed the Lambda function's processing time to prevent message retries.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 474
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A team has an Amazon API Gateway REST API that consists of a single resource and
a GET method that is backed by an AWS Lambda integration.

A developer makes a change to the Lambda function and deploys the function as a
new version. The developer needs to set up a process to test the new version of
the function before using the new version in production. The tests must not
affect the production REST API.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Create a new resource in the REST API. Add a GET method to the new resource, and add a Lambda integration to the updated version of the Lambda function. Deploy the new version.
Chose_B: Create a new stage for the REST API. Create a stage variable. Assign the stage variable to the Lambda function. Set the API Gateway integrated Lambda function name to the stage variable. Deploy the new version.
Chose_C: Create a new REST API. Add a resource that has a single GET method that is integrated with the updated version of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Update the Lambda integration of the existing GET method to point to the updated version of the Lambda function. Deploy the new version.
Explain: Stage variables allow API Gateway to point to different Lambda versions without recreating resources or APIs. This matches best practice for updating Lambda integrations across stages.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 478
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company runs continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines for
its application on AWS CodePipeline. A developer must write unit tests and run
them as part of the pipelines before staging the artifacts for testing.

How should the developer incorporate unit tests as part of CI/CD pipelines?
Chose_A: Create a separate CodePipeline pipeline to run unit tests.
Chose_B: Update the AWS CodeBuild build specification to include a phase for running unit tests.
Chose_C: Install the AWS CodeDeploy agent on an Amazon EC2 instance to run unit tests.
Chose_D: Create a testing branch in a git repository for the pipelines to run unit tests.
Explain: Unit tests should be run within the CodeBuild buildspec so they are executed automatically during the build phase of the CI/CD pipeline.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02

Question:
A developer is troubleshooting a three-tier application, which is deployed on
Amazon EC2 instances. There is a connectivity problem between the application
servers and the database servers.

Which AWS services or tools should be used to identity the faulty component?
(Choose two.)
Chose_A: AWS CloudTrail
Chose_B: AWS Trusted Advisor
Chose_C: Amazon VPC Flow Logs
Chose_D: Network access control lists
Chose_E: E. AWS Config rules
Explain: VPC Flow Logs provide network-level visibility, and AWS Config rules evaluate resource configuration compliance. This pairing is the most appropriate given the choices.

Title:

[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is making changes to a custom application that uses AWS Elastic
Beanstalk.

Which solutions will update the Elastic Beanstalk environment with the new
application version after the developer completes the changes? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Package the application code into a zip file. Use the AWS Management Console to upload the .zip file and deploy the packaged application.
Chose_B: Package the application code into a .tar file. Use the AWS Management Console to create a new application version from the .tar file. Update the environment by using the AWS CLI.
Chose_C: Package the application code into a .tar file. Use the AWS Management Console to upload the .tar file and deploy the packaged application.
Chose_D: Package the application code into a .zip file. Use the AWS CL to create a new application version from the .zip file and to update the environment.
Chose_E: E. Package the application code into a .zip file. Use the AWS Management Console to create a new application version from the .zip file. Rebuild the environment by using the AWS CLI.
Explain: Elastic Beanstalk requires application bundles in .zip format. Using the AWS CLI to create a new application version and update the environment is the correct deployment workflow.

Title:

deploy a CloudFormation stack to AWS.

What must the developer do to complete these tasks?
Chose_A: Install the AWS CLI. Configure the AWS CLI by using an IAM user name and password.
Chose_B: Install the AWS CLI. Configure the AWS CLI by using an SSH key.
Chose_C: Install the AWS CLI, Configure the AWS CLI by using an IAM user access key and secret key.
Chose_D: Install an AWS software development kit (SDK). Configure the SDK by using an X.509 certificate.
Explain: The AWS CLI is configured using an IAM user access key and secret access key. Other listed methods are not valid for AWS CLI authentication.

accounts. The company needs to collect and visualize trace data across these
accounts.

What should be used to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: AWS X-Ray
Chose_B: Amazon CloudWatch
Chose_C: Amazon VPC flow logs
Chose_D: Amazon OpenSearch Service
Explain: The question text is missing, but AWS X-Ray is typically the correct choice for tracing and debugging distributed application requests.

Title:

Question:
A developer must cache dependent artifacts from Maven Central, a public package
repository, as part of an application’s build pipeline. The build pipeline has
an AWS CodeArtifact repository where artifacts of the build are published. The
developer needs a solution that requires minimum changes to the build pipeline.

Which solution meets these requirements?
Chose_A: Modify the existing CodeAriifact repository to associate an upstream repository with the public package repository.
Chose_B: Create a new CodeAtfact repository that has an external connection to the public package repository.
Chose_C: Create a new CodeAifact domain that contains a new repository that has an external connection to the public package repository.
Chose_D: Modify the CodeAnifact repository resource policy to allow artifacts to be fetched from the public package repository.
Explain: To allow a CodeArtifact repository to retrieve packages from a public repository, you associate an upstream repository. This is done by modifying the existing repository configuration.

The developer wants to update the integration request mapping template so the

Chose_B: [https://img.examtopics.com/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/image31.png]

Title:

[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is writing a web application that must share secure documents with
end users. The documents are stored in a private Amazon S3 bucket. The
application must allow only authenticated users to download specific documents
when requested, and only for a duration of 15 minutes.

How can the developer meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Copy the documents to a separate S3 bucket that has a lifecycle policy for deletion after 15 minutes.
Chose_B: Create a presigned S3 URL using the AWS SDK with an expiration time of 15 minutes.
Chose_C: Use server-side encryption with AWS KMS managed keys (SSE-KMS) and download the documents using HTTPS.
Chose_D: Modify the S3 bucket policy to only allow specific users to download the documents. Revert the change after 15 minutes.
Explain: Presigned URLs allow temporary, time-limited access to S3 objects, making them ideal for 15‑minute access windows.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 488
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is developing a set of AWS Lambda functions to process data. The
Lambda functions need to use a common third-party library as a dependency. The
library is frequently updated with new features and bug fixes. The company wants
to ensure that the Lambda functions always use the latest version of the
library.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST operationally efficient
way?
Chose_A: Store the dependency and the function code in an Amazon S3 bucket.
Chose_B: Create a Lambda layer that includes the library. Attach the layer to each Lambda function.
Chose_C: Install the dependency in an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system. Attach the file system to each Lambda function.
Chose_D: Create a new Lambda function to load the library. Configure the existing Lambda functions to invoke the new Lambda function when the existing functions need to use the library.
Explain: Lambda layers are the correct way to share common libraries across multiple Lambda functions. EFS is only needed for very large or frequently updated dependencies.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 489
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company’s application includes an Amazon DynamoDB table for product orders.
The table has a primary partition key of orderId and has no sort key. The
company is adding a new feature that requires the application to query the table
by using the customerId attribute.

Which solution will provide this query functionality?
Chose_A: Change the existing primary key by setting customerId as the sort key.
Chose_B: Create a new global secondary index (GSI) on the table with a partition key of customerId.
Chose_C: Create a new local secondary index (LSI) on the table with a partition key of customerId.
Chose_D: Create a new local secondary index (LSI) on the table with a partition key of orderId and a sort key of customerId.
Explain: To query efficiently by a non-key attribute such as customerId, you must create a GSI with customerId as the partition key.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 491
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application that includes an AWS Lambda function that
is written in .NET Core. The Lambda function’s code needs to interact with
Amazon DynamoDB tables and Amazon S3 buckets. The developer must minimize the
Lambda function’s deployment time and invocation duration.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Increase the Lambda function’s memory.
Chose_B: Include the entire AWS SDK for .NET in the Lambda function’s deployment package.
Chose_C: Include only the AWS SDK for .NET modules for DynamoDB and Amazon S3 in the Lambda function’s deployment package.
Chose_D: Configure the Lambda function to download the AWS SDK for .NET from an S3 bucket at runtime.
Explain: To minimize the Lambda deployment package size, you should include only the required AWS SDK for .NET modules, such as DynamoDB and S3.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 492
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A development team has an Amazon API Gateway REST API that is backed by an AWS
Lambda function.

Users have reported performance issues for the Lambda function. The development
team identified the source of the issues as a cold start of the Lambda function.
The development team needs to reduce the time needed for the Lambda function to
initialize.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Change the Lambda concurrency to reserved concurrency.
Chose_B: Increase the timeout of the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Increase the memory allocation of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Configure provisioned concurrency for the Lambda function.
Explain: Provisioned concurrency is used to reduce cold starts and improve Lambda performance for predictable workloads.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 493
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A video streaming company has a pipe in Amazon EventBridge Pipes that uses an
Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue as an event source. The pipe
publishes all source events to a target EventBridge event bus. Before events are
published, the pipe uses an AWS Lambda function to retrieve the stream status of
each event from a database and adds the stream status to each source event.

The company wants the pipe to publish events to the event bus only if the video
stream has a status of ready.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Add a filter step to the pipe that will match on a stream status of ready.
Chose_B: Update the Lambda function to return only video streams that have a status of ready.
Chose_C: Include a filter for a status of ready in all EventBridge rules that subscribe to the event bus.
Chose_D: Add an input transformer to the pipe output that filters streams that have a status of ready.
Explain: EventBridge Pipes perform filtering in the filter step, not in the output transformer. Filtering on stream status should be done in the pipe’s filter step.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 494
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to build a workflow to handle messages that are sent to an
Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. When a message reaches the
queue, the workflow must implement a delay before invoking an AWS Lambda
function to process the message.

Which solution will meet this requirement in the MOST operationally efficient
way?
Chose_A: Create an AWS Step Functions state machine to process the SQS queue. Use a Wait state to delay the Lambda function’s processing for the required number of seconds after message delivery to the SQS queue. Use Amazon EventBridge to invoke the state machine every 5 minutes.
Chose_B: Configure the Lambda function to poll the SQS queue. Update the Lambda code to republish each message with a custom attribute that contains a future time when the message should be fully processed. Update the Lambda code to fully process messages when the custom attribute’s future time has passed.
Chose_C: Set the DelaySeconds value of the SQS queue to be the number of seconds required to delay delivery of the messages. Add an event source mapping for the Lambda function. Specify the SQS queue as a source.
Chose_D: Set the Visibility Timeout value of the SQS queue to be the number of seconds required to delay delivery of the messages. Add an event source mapping for the Lambda function. Specify the SQS queue as a source.
Explain: Setting the SQS queue’s DelaySeconds delays message delivery before Lambda processes them. This is the appropriate and native way to defer message processing.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 495
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is building an application to accept data from customers. The data
must be encrypted at rest and in transit.

The application uses an Amazon API Gateway API that resolves to AWS Lambda
functions. The Lambda functions store the data in an Amazon Aurora MySQL DB
cluster. The application worked properly during testing.

A developer configured an Amazon CloudFront distribution with field-level
encryption that uses an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. After the
configuration of the distribution, the application behaved unexpectedly. All the
data in the database changed from plaintext to ciphertext.

The developer must ensure that the data is not stored in the database as the
ciphertext from the CloudFront field-level encryption.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Change the CloudFront Viewer protocol policy from “HTTP and HTTPS” to “HTTPS only.”
Chose_B: Add a Lambda function that uses the KMS key to decrypt the data fields before saving the data to the database.
Chose_C: Enable encryption on the DB cluster by using the same KMS key that is used in CloudFront.
Chose_D: Request and deploy a new SSL certificate to use with the CloudFront distribution.
Explain: Without decrypting at Lambda, the DB should be encrypted at rest with the same KMS key. Option C is the most likely correct answer given the choices.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 497
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an application that uses an AWS Lambda function to
transform and load data from an Amazon S3 bucket. When the developer tests the
application, the developer finds that some invocations of the Lambda function
are slower than others.

The developer needs to update the Lambda function to have predictable invocation
durations that run with low latency. Any initialization activities, such as
loading libraries and instantiating clients, must run during allocation time
rather than during actual function invocations.

Which combination of steps will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Create a schedule group in Amazon EventBridge Scheduler to invoke the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Configure provisioned concurrency for the Lambda function to have the necessary number of execution environments.
Chose_C: Use the $LATEST version of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Configure reserved concurrency for the Lambda function to have the necessary number of execution environments.
Chose_E: E. Deploy changes, and publish a new version of the Lambda function.
Explain: Provisioned concurrency requires publishing a new version, and then you can allocate provisioned concurrency to that version.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 498
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer created an AWS Lambda function named ProcessMessages. The Lambda
function is invoked asynchronously when a message is published to an Amazon
Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic named InputTopic. The developer
uses a second SNS topic named ErrorTopic to handle alerts of failures for other
services.

The developer wants to receive notifications from the ErrorTopic SNS topic when
the ProcessMessages Lambda function fails to process a message.

Which solution will meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Configure a subscription for the ErrorTopic SNS topic. Configure a filter policy for failures. Specify the ProcessMessages Lambda function as the endpoint.
Chose_B: Configure a failure destination for the ProcessMessages Lambda function. Specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the ErrorTopic SNS topic as the destination ARN.
Chose_C: Configure a trigger for the ProcessMessages Lambda function. Specify the ErrorTopic SNS topic as the trigger topic. Configure a filter policy on the topic for failures
Chose_D: Configure a delivery policy on the ErrorTopic SNS topic. Configure a filter policy for failures. Specify the Lambda function as the input endpoint.
Explain: Configuring a failure destination on the Lambda function and pointing it to the SNS topic is the correct method for sending failed invocations to SNS.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 499
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is developing a new application that uses Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and
AWS Lambda resources. The company wants to allow employees to access the AWS
Management Console by using existing credentials that the company stores and
manages in an on-premises Microsoft Active Directory. Each employee must have a
specific level of access to the AWS resources that is based on the employee’s
role.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Configure AWS Directory Service to create an Active Directory in AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory. Establish a trust relationship with the on-premises Active Directory. Configure IAM roles and trust policies to give the employees access to the AWS resources.
Chose_B: Use LDAP to directly integrate the on-premises Active Directory with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). Map Active Directory groups to IAM roles to control access to AWS resources.
Chose_C: Implement a custom identity broker to authenticate users into the on-premises Active Directory. Configure the identity broker to use AWS Security Token Service (AWS STS) to grant authorized users IAM role based access to the AWS resources.
Chose_D: Configure Amazon Cognito to federate users into the on-premises Active Directory. Use Cognito user pools to manage user identities and to manage user access to the AWS resources.
Explain: IAM cannot directly integrate with Active Directory, and AWS Managed Microsoft AD with trust does not provide federation by itself. A custom identity broker using STS is the correct AWS-recommended pattern.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 500
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an Amazon DynamoDB table that contains records of users that have
signed up for a trial of the company’s product. The company is using a
spreadsheet to track data about the product trial. The company needs to ensure
the spreadsheet is automatically updated with the latest information when
individual trials begin, are updated, or finish.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create a DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster from the table. Set the view type to old image. Create an AWS Lambda function that uses the cluster data to update the spreadsheet. Subscribe the Lambda function to the cluster.
Chose_B: Create a DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster from the table. Set the view type to new image. Create an AWS Lambda function that uses the cluster data to update the spreadsheet. Subscribe the Lambda function to the cluster.
Chose_C: Enable a DynamoDB stream for the table. Set the view type to new image. Create an AWS Lambda function that uses the stream data to update the spreadsheet. Subscribe the Lambda function to the stream.
Chose_D: Enable a DynamoDB stream for the table. Set the view type to old image. Create an AWS Lambda function that uses the stream data to update the spreadsheet. Subscribe the Lambda function to the stream.
Explain: DynamoDB Streams with the New Image setting allows a Lambda function to react to item changes and update the spreadsheet accordingly.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 461
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer published a change to a new version of an AWS Lambda function. To
test the change, the developer must route 50% of the traffic to the new version
and 60% of the traffic to the current version.

What is the MOST operationally efficient way to meet this requirement?
Chose_A: Create two Amazon Route 53 records that use a simple routing policy to route traffic to the different versions of the Lambda function. Create another Route 53 record that uses a weighted routing policy to route 50% of the traffic to each simple routing record. Test the Lambda function by using the weighted routing record.
Chose_B: Create an Amazon API Gateway API with a POST method that is integrated with the Lambda function. Add a stage variable that includes the version of the Lambda function. Add a canary release that will override the version variable 50% of the time. Deploy and test the Lambda function through the API Gateway stage.
Chose_C: Create a Lambda function alias. Set the weight to 50% for the current version and 50% for the new version. Set the event source mappings for the Lambda function to point to the alias.
Chose_D: Update the event source mappings for the Lambda function. In the mappings, set the weight to 50% for the current version and 50% for the new version.
Explain: Weighted traffic shifting between Lambda versions is done through aliases, not event source mappings. Option C correctly uses an alias with 50/50 weights and points event source mappings to the alias.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 463
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application is experiencing performance issues based on increased demand.
This increased demand is on read-only historical records pulled from an Amazon
RDS-hosted database with custom views and queries. A developer must improve
performance without changing the database structure.

Which approach will improve performance and MINIMIZE management overhead?
Chose_A: Deploy Amazon DynamoDB, move all the data, and point to DynamoDB.
Chose_B: Deploy Amazon ElastiCache (Redis OSS) and cache the data for the application.
Chose_C: Deploy Memcached on Amazon EC2 and cache the data for the application.
Chose_D: Deploy Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) on Amazon RDS to improve cache performance.
Explain: ElastiCache is the correct AWS-managed caching solution. Running Memcached on EC2 is not recommended when a fully managed cache service exists.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 511
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is building a social media application. A developer is modifying an
AWS Lambda function that updates a database with data that tracks each user's
online activity. A web application server uses the AWS SDK to invoke the Lambda
function.

The developer has tested the new Lambda code and is ready to deploy the code
into production. However, the developer wants to allow only a small percentage
of the invocations from the AWS SDK to call the new code.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure a Lambda version that has a specific weight value for the updated Lambda function.
Chose_B: Create an alias for the Lambda function. Configure a specific weight value for the updated version.
Chose_C: Create an Application Load Balancer. Specify weighted target groups for the original Lambda function and the updated Lambda function.
Chose_D: Create a Network Load Balancer. Specify weighted target groups for the original Lambda function and the updated Lambda function.
Explain: Traffic shifting between Lambda versions is done using aliases with weighted routing.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 513
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building a three-tier web application that should be able to
handle a minimum of 5000 requests per minute. Requirements state that the web
tier should be completely stateless while the application maintains session
state for the users.

How can session data be externalized, keeping latency at the LOWEST possible
value?
Chose_A: Create an Amazon RDS instance, then implement session handling at the application level to leverage a database inside the RDS database instance for session data storage.
Chose_B: Implement a shared file system solution across the underlying Amazon EC2 instances, then implement session handling at the application level to leverage the shared file system for session data storage.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon ElastiCache (Memcached) cluster, then implement session handling at the application level to leverage the cluster for session data storage.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon DynamoDB table, then implement session handling at the application level to leverage the table for session data storage.
Explain: ElastiCache (Memcached or Redis) is the best option for fast, scalable, centralized session storage for distributed applications running on multiple EC2 instances.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 515
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An AWS Lambda function that handles application requests uses the default Lambda
logging mechanism to log the timestamp, processing time, and status of requests.

A developer needs to create Amazon CloudWatch metrics based on the logs. The
developer needs to write the metrics to a custom CloudWatch metrics namespace.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Use Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights to generate custom metrics from the logs by using CloudWatch embedded metric format (EMF).
Chose_B: Use Amazon CloudWatch RUM to generate custom metrics from the logs by using CloudWatch embedded metric format (EMF).
Chose_C: Use Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights to generate custom metrics from the logs by using JSON format.
Chose_D: Use the CloudWatch embedded metric format (EMF) for the structure of the log statements to generate custom CloudWatch metrics.
Explain: Embedded Metric Format (EMF) must be used directly in application log statements so CloudWatch can automatically extract and generate custom metrics.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 518
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
Two containerized microservices are hosted on Amazon EC2 ECS. The first
microservice reads an Amazon RDS Aurora database instance, and the second
microservice reads an Amazon DynamoDB table.

How can each microservice be granted the minimum privileges?
Chose_A: Set ECS_ENABLE_TASK_IAM_ROLE to false on EC2 instance boot in ECS agent configuration file. Run the first microservice with an IAM role for ECS tasks with read-only access for the Aurora database. Run the second microservice with an IAM role for ECS tasks with read-only access to DynamoDB.
Chose_B: Set ECS_ENABLE_TASK_IAM ROLE to false on EC2 instance boot in the ECS agent configuration file. Grant the instance profile role read-only access to the Aurora database and DynamoDB.
Chose_C: Set ECS_ENABLE_TASK_IAM ROLE to true on EC2 instance boot in the ECS agent configuration file. Run the first microservice with an IAM role for ECS tasks with read-only access for the Aurora database. Run the second microservice with an IAM role for ECS tasks with read-only access to DynamoDB.
Chose_D: Set ECS_ENABLE_TASK_IAM_ROLE to true on EC2 instance boot in the ECS agent configuration file. Grant the instance profile role read-only access to the Aurora database and DynamoDB.
Explain: ECS tasks should use task IAM roles, which requires ECS_ENABLE_TASK_IAM_ROLE=true. Each microservice should have its own least-privilege task role.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 520
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
An application that is running on Amazon EC2 instances stores data in an Amazon
S3 bucket. All the data must be encrypted in transit.

How can a developer ensure that all traffic to the S3 bucket is encrypted?
Chose_A: Install certificates on the EC2 instances.
Chose_B: Create a private VPC endpoint.
Chose_C: Configure the S3 bucket with server-side encryption with AWS KMS managed encryption keys (SSE-KMS).
Chose_D: Create an S3 bucket policy that denies traffic when the value for the aws:SecureTransport condition key is false.
Explain: D enforces HTTPS-only access to the S3 bucket using the aws:SecureTransport condition key.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 524
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is launching a photo sharing application on AWS. Users use the
application to upload images to an Amazon S3 bucket. When users upload images,
an AWS Lambda function creates thumbnail versions of the images and stores the
thumbnail versions in another S3 bucket.

During development, a developer notices that the Lambda function takes more than
2 minutes to complete the thumbnail process. The company needs alll images to be
processed in less than 30 seconds.

What should the developer do to meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Increase the virtual CPUs (vCPUs) for the Lambda function to use 10 vCPUs.
Chose_B: Change Lambda function instance type to use m6a.4xlarge.
Chose_C: Configure the Lambda function to increase the amount of memory.
Chose_D: Configure burstable performance for the Lambda function.
Explain: Lambda CPU scales proportionally with the amount of memory allocated, making increasing memory the correct way to improve CPU performance.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 527
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is writing an application in AWS Lambda. To simplify testing and
deployments, the developer needs the database connection string to be easily
changed without modifying the Lambda code.

How can this requirement be met?
Chose_A: Store the connection string as a secret in AWS Secrets Manager.
Chose_B: Store the connection string in an IAM user account.
Chose_C: Store the connection string in AWS KMS.
Chose_D: Store the connection string as a Lambda layer.
Explain: Secrets Manager is the correct service for securely storing connection strings and rotating credentials.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 529
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an image-processing application that includes an AWS
Lambda function. The Lambda function moves images from one AWS service to
another AWS service for image processing. For images that are larger than 2 MB,
the Lambda function returns the following error: “Task timed out after 3.01
seconds.”

The developer needs to resolve the error without modifying the Lambda function
code.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Increase the Lambda function’s timeout value.
Chose_B: Configure the Lambda function to not move images that are larger than 2 MB.
Chose_C: Request a concurrency quota increase for the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Configure provisioned concurrency for the Lambda function.
Explain: Without the full question, the most reasonable assumption is that the issue relates to Lambda executions timing out, making an increased timeout value an appropriate fix.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 530
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has an application container, an AWS Lambda function, and an Amazon
Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. The Lambda function uses the SQS queue
as an event source. The Lambda function makes a call to a third-party machine
learning API when the function is invoked. The response from the third-party API
can take up to 60 seconds to return.

The Lambda function's timeout value is currently 65 seconds. The developer has
noticed that the Lambda function sometimes processes duplicate messages from the
SQS queue.

What should the developer do to ensure that the Lambda function does not process
duplicate messages?
Chose_A: Configure the Lambda function with a larger amount of memory.
Chose_B: Configure an increase in the Lambda function’s timeout value.
Chose_C: Configure the SQS queue’s delivery delay value to be greater than the maximum time it takes to call the third-party API.
Chose_D: Configure the SQS queue’s visibility timeout value to be greater than the maximum time it takes to call the third-party API.
Explain: The SQS visibility timeout must be longer than the Lambda processing time; otherwise the message becomes visible again and is retried.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 532
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A team deploys an AWS CloudFormation template to update a stack that already
included an Amazon DynamoDB table. However, before the deployment of the update,
the team changed the name of the DynamoDB table on the template by mistake. The
DeletionPolicy attribute for all resources has the default value.

What will be the result of this mistake?
Chose_A: CloudFormation will create a new table and will delete the existing table.
Chose_B: CloudFormation will create a new table and will keep the existing table.
Chose_C: CloudFormation will overwrite the existing table and will rename the existing table.
Chose_D: CloudFormation will keep the existing table and will not create a new table.
Explain: If a DynamoDB table with the same name already exists and is not managed by the CloudFormation stack, CloudFormation will not overwrite or recreate it. The stack creation will fail, and no new table will be created.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 533
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is deploying an application on an Amazon Elastic Container Service
(Amazon ECS) cluster that uses AWS Fargate. The developer is using a Docker
container with an Ubuntu image.

The developer needs to implement a solution to store application data that is
available from multiple ECS tasks. The application data must remain accessible
after the container is terminated.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Attach an Amazon FSx for Windows File Server volume to the container definition.
Chose_B: Specify the DockerVolumeConfiguration parameter in the ECS task definition to attach a Docker volume.
Chose_C: Create an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system. Specify the mountPoints attribute and the efsVolumeConfiguration attribute in the ECS task definition.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume. Specify the mount point configuration in the ECS task definition.
Explain: Amazon EFS is the correct option for providing persistent shared storage to ECS tasks, and ECS supports native EFS integration via efsVolumeConfiguration.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 534
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating an AWS Lambda function that needs network access to
private resources in a VPC.

Which solution will provide this access with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Attach the Lambda function to the VPC through private subnets. Create a security group that allows network access to the private resources. Associate the security group with the Lambda function.
Chose_B: Configure the Lambda function to route traffic through a VPN connection. Create a security group that allows network access to the private resources. Associate the security group with the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Configure a VPC endpoint connection for the Lambda function. Set up the VPC endpoint to route traffic through a NAT gateway.
Chose_D: Configure an AWS PrivateLink endpoint for the private resources. Configure the Lambda function to reference the PrivateLink endpoint.
Explain: To access private resources in a VPC, a Lambda function must be attached to private subnets and use a security group that allows access. This is exactly what option A describes.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 535
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer needs to automate deployments for a serverless, event-based
workload. The developer needs to create standardized templates to define the
infrastructure and to test the functionality of the workload locally before
deployment

The developer already uses a pipeline in AWS CodePipeline. The developer needs
to incorporate any other infrastructure changes into the existing pipeline.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Create an AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) template. Configure the pipeline stages in CodePipeline to run the necessary AWS SAM CLI commands to deploy the serverless workload.
Chose_B: Create an AWS Step Functions workflow template based on the infrastructure by using the Amazon States Language. Start the Step Functions state machine from the existing pipeline.
Chose_C: Create an AWS CloudFormation template. Use the existing pipeline workflow to build a pipeline for AWS CloudFormation stacks.
Chose_D: Create an AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) template. Use an automated script to deploy the serverless workload by using the AWS SAM CLI deploy command.
Explain: Using a SAM template with CodePipeline and running SAM CLI commands within the pipeline is the correct way to deploy a serverless workload through CI/CD.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 536
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is creating a stock trading application. The developer needs a
solution to send text messages to application users to confirmation when a trade
has been completed.

The solution must deliver messages in the order a user makes stock trades. The
solution must not send duplicate messages.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure the application to publish messages to an Amazon Data Firehose delivery stream. Configure the delivery stream to have a destination of each user’s mobile phone number that is passed in the trade confirmation message.
Chose_B: Create an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) FIFO queue. Use the SendMessageIn API call to send the trade confirmation messages to the queue. Use the SendMessageOut API to send the messages to users by using the information provided in the trade confirmation message.
Chose_C: Configure a pipe in Amazon EventBridge Pipes. Connect the application to the pipe as a source. Configure the pipe to use each user’s mobile phone number as a target. Configure the pipe to send incoming events to the users.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) FIFO topic. Configure the application to use the AWS SDK to publish notifications to the SNS topic to send SMS messages to the users.
Explain: SNS is the only listed service capable of sending SMS messages. Even though SNS FIFO topics do not support SMS directly, it is still the closest correct option among the provided choices.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 537
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is deploying a new Node.js AWS Lambda function that is not connected
to a VPC. The Lambda function needs to connect to and query an Amazon Aurora
database that is not publicly accessible. The developer is expecting
unpredictable surges in database traffic.

What should the developer do to give the Lambda function access to the database?
Chose_A: Configure the Lambda function to use an Amazon RDS proxy.
Chose_B: Configure a NAT gateway. Attach the NAT gateway to the Lambda function.
Chose_C: Enable public access on the Aurora database. Configure a security group on the database to allow outbound access for the database engine’s port.
Chose_D: Enable VPC access for the Lambda function. Attach the Lambda function to a new security group that does not have rules.
Explain: Using an RDS Proxy is the recommended solution to manage Lambda database connections efficiently and avoid connection exhaustion with Aurora.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 540
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is using AWS CodeDeploy to launch an application onto Amazon EC2
instances. The application deployment fails during testing. The developer
notices an IAM_ROLE_PERMISSIONS error code in Amazon CloudWatch logs.

What should the developer do to resolve the error?
Chose_A: Ensure that the deployment group is using the correct role name for the CodeDeploy service role.
Chose_B: Attach the AWSCodeDeployRoleECS policy to the CodeDeploy service role.
Chose_C: Attach the AWSCodeDeployRole policy to the CodeDeploy service role.
Chose_D: Ensure the CodeDeploy agent is installed and running on all instances in the deployment group.
Explain: The CodeDeploy service role must include the AWSCodeDeployRole policy for deployments to function correctly.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 542
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A cloud-based video surveillance company is developing an application that
analyzes video files. After the application analyzes the files, the company can
discard the files.

The company stores the files in an Amazon S3 bucket. The files are 1 GB in size
on average. No file is larger than 2 GB. An AWS Lambda function will run one
time for each video file that is processed. The processing is very I/O
intensive, and the application must read each file multiple times.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST performance-optimized
way?
Chose_A: Attach an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume that is larger than 1 GB to the Lambda function. Copy the files from the S3 bucket to the EBS volume.
Chose_B: Attach an Elastic Network Adapter (ENA) to the Lambda function. Use the ENA to read the video files from the S3 bucket.
Chose_C: Increase the ephemeral storage size to 2 GB. Copy the files from the S3 bucket to the /tmp directory of the Lambda function.
Chose_D: Configure the Lambda function code to read the video files directly from the S3 bucket.
Explain: Lambda’s ephemeral storage can be increased beyond the default 512 MB, allowing large temporary files to be copied into /tmp for processing.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 544
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company stores customer credit reports in an Amazon S3 bucket. An analytics
service uses standard Amazon S3 GET requests to access the reports.

A developer must implement a solution to redact personally identifiable
information (PII) from the reports before the reports reach the analytics
service.

Which solution will meet this requirement with the MOST operational efficiency?
Chose_A: Load the S3 objects into Amazon Redshift by using a COPY command. Implement dynamic data masking. Refactor the analytics service to read from Amazon Redshift.
Chose_B: Set up an S3 Object Lambda function. Attach the function to an S3 Object Lambda Access Point. Program the function to call a PII redaction API.
Chose_C: Use AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) to implement encryption in the S3 bucket. Re-upload all the existing S3 objects. Give the kms:Decrypt permission to the analytics service.
Chose_D: Create an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Implement message data protection. Refactor the analytics service to publish data access requests to the SNS topic.
Explain: S3 Object Lambda lets you dynamically redact or transform objects at retrieval time without modifying data at rest, making it the correct solution for PII redaction.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 545
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is using the AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) to develop a
social media application. A developer needs a quick way to test AWS Lambda
functions locally by using test event payloads. The developer needs the
structure of these test event payloads to match the actual events that AWS
services create.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST development effort?
Chose_A: Create shareable test Lambda events. Use these test Lambda events for local testing.
Chose_B: Store manually created test event payloads locally. Use the sam local invoke command with the file path to the payloads.
Chose_C: Store manually created test event payloads in an Amazon S3 bucket. Use the sam local invoke command with the S3 path to the payloads.
Chose_D: Use the sam local generate-event command to create test payloads for local testing.
Explain: The sam local generate-event command is the correct method to generate test event payloads for local Lambda testing.

A developer is writing an application that will run on Amazon EC2 instances in
an Auto Scaling group. The developer wants to externalize the session state to
support the application.

Which AWS services or resources can the developer use to meet these
requirements? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Amazon DynamoDB
Chose_B: Amazon Cognito
Chose_C: Amazon ElastiCache
Chose_D: Application Load Balancer
Chose_E: E. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 447
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is working on a project that requires regular updates to a web
application’s backend code. The code is stored in AWS CodeCommit. Company policy
states that all code must have complete unit testing and that the test results
must be available for access.

The developer needs to implement a solution that will take each change to the
code repository, build the code, and run unit tests. The solution also must
provide a detailed report of the test results.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure AWS CodeDeploy to deploy code from CodeCommit and to run unit tests. Send the test results to Amazon CloudWatch metrics to view reports.
Chose_B: Configure Amazon CodeWhisperer to create the code and to run unit tests. Save the test results in an Amazon S3 bucket to generate reports.
Chose_C: Configure AWS CodeBuild to build the code and to run unit tests. Use test reporting in CodeBuild to generate and view reports.
Chose_D: Create AWS Lambda functions that run when changes are made in CodeCommit. Program the Lambda functions to build the code, run unit tests, and save the test results to a Lambda layer.
Explain: AWS CodeBuild is the correct service for building code and running unit tests, and it natively supports test reporting.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 554
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer has an application that runs in AWS Account A. The application must
retrieve an AWS Secrets Manager secret that is encrypted by an AWS Key
Management Service (AWS KMS) key from AWS Account B. The application’s role has
permissions to access the secret in Account B.

The developer must add a statement to the KMS key’s key policy to allow the role
in Account A to use the KMS key in Account B. The permissions must grant least
privilege access to the role.

Which permissions will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: kms:Decrypt and kms:DescribeKey
Chose_B: secretsmanager:DescribeSecret and secretsmanager:GetSecretValue
Chose_C: kms:*
Chose_D: secretsmanager:*
Explain: To retrieve a secret from AWS Secrets Manager, the essential permissions are secretsmanager:GetSecretValue and secretsmanager:DescribeSecret.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 553
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company is creating a new feature for existing software. Before the company
fully releases a new version of the software, the company wants to test the
feature.

The company needs to gather feedback about the feature from a small group of
users while the current software version remains deployed. If the testing
validates the feature, the company needs to deploy the new software version to
all other users at the same time.

Which deployment strategy will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: All-at-once deployment
Chose_B: Canary deployment
Chose_C: In-place deployment
Chose_D: Linear deployment
Explain: Among common AWS deployment strategies, canary deployment is often the correct choice when questions involve gradually shifting traffic to a new version to reduce risk.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 552
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company stores data in an Amazon S3 bucket. The data is updated multiple times
every day from an application that runs on a server in the company’s on-premises
data center.

The company enables S3 Versioning on the S3 bucket. After some time, the company
observes multiple versions of the same objects in the S3 bucket.

The company needs the S3 bucket to keep the current version of each object and
the version immediately previous to the current version.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Configure an S3 bucket policy to retain one newer noncurrent version of the objects.
Chose_B: Configure an S3 Lifecycle rule to retain one newer noncurrent version of the objects.
Chose_C: Enable S3 Object Lock. Configure an S3 Object Lock policy to retain one newer noncurrent version of the objects.
Chose_D: Suspend S3 Versioning. Modify the application code to check the number of object versions before updating the objects.
Explain: S3 Lifecycle rules are the correct way to control how many noncurrent versions are retained. Bucket policies and Object Lock cannot manage noncurrent version count.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 517
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that processes audio files for different
departments. When audio files are saved to an Amazon S3 bucket, an AWS Lambda
function receives an event notification and processes the audio input.

A developer needs to update the solution so that the application can process the
audio files for each department independently. The application must publish the
audio file location for each department to each department's existing Amazon
Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue.

Which solution will meet these requirements with no changes to the Lambda
function code?
Chose_A: Configure the S3 bucket to send the event notifications to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Subscribe each department’s SQS queue to the SNS topic. Configure subscription filter policies.
Chose_B: Update the Lambda function to write the file location to a single shared SQS queue. Configure the shared SQS queue to send the file reference to each department’s SQS queue.
Chose_C: Update the Lambda function to send the file location to each department’s SQS queue.
Chose_D: Configure the S3 bucket to send the event notifications to each department’s SQS queue.
Explain: Using SNS as a fan-out mechanism allows a single S3 event to be distributed to multiple SQS queues with subscription filter policies.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 525
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A development team is designing a mobile app that requires multi-factor
authentication.

Which steps should be taken to achieve this? (Choose two.)
Chose_A: Use Amazon Cognito to create a user pool and create users in the user pool.
Chose_B: Send multi-factor authentication text codes to users with the Amazon SNS Publish API call in the app code.
Chose_C: Enable multi-factor authentication for the Amazon Cognito user pool.
Chose_D: Use AWS IAM to create IAM users.
Chose_E: E. Enable multifactor authentication for the users created in AWS IAM.
Explain: Application users should be managed in an Amazon Cognito user pool, and MFA should be enabled at the user pool level. IAM users and manual SNS code handling are not appropriate for app user authentication.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 549
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application that consists of many AWS Lambda
functions. The Lambda functions connect to a single Amazon RDS database.

The developer needs to implement a solution to store the database credentials
securely. When the credentials are updated, the Lambda functions must be able to
use the new credentials without requiring a code update or a configuration
update.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Store the credentials as a secret in AWS Secrets Manager. Access the secret at runtime from within the Lambda functions.
Chose_B: Store the credentials as a secret in AWS Secrets Manager. Access the credentials in environment variables by using the containerDefinitions and valueFrom elements in reference to the secret value.
Chose_C: Store the credentials as a SecureString parameter in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Add a trigger to pass the credentials to the Lambda functions when the Lambda functions run.
Chose_D: Store the credentials as a SecureString parameter in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Add a reference to the parameter in an environment variable in the Lambda functions.
Explain: Storing credentials in AWS Secrets Manager and retrieving them at runtime is the recommended and most secure approach for Lambda functions.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 531
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company has an application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances. The application
needs to use dynamic feature flags that will be shared with other applications.
The application must poll on an interval for new feature flag values. The values
must be cached when they are retrieved.

Which solution will meet these requirements in the MOST operationally efficient
way?
Chose_A: Store the feature flag values in AWS Secrets Manager. Configure an Amazon ElastiCache node to cache the values by using a lazy loading strategy in the application. Update the application to poll for the values on an interval from ElastiCache.
Chose_B: Store the feature flag values in an Amazon DynamoDB table. Configure DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) to cache the values by using a lazy loading strategy in the application. Update the application to poll for the values on an interval from DynamoDB.
Chose_C: Store the feature flag values in AWS AppConfig. Configure AWS AppConfig Agent on the EC2 instances to poll for the values on an interval. Update the application to retrieve the values from the AppConfig Agent localhost endpoint.
Chose_D: Store the feature flag values in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store. Configure the application to poll on an interval. Configure the application to use the AWS SDK to retrieve the values from Parameter Store and to store the values in memory.
Explain: AWS AppConfig is the AWS-managed service designed specifically for dynamic configuration and feature flags, and the AppConfig Agent provides efficient local polling and caching.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 539
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A company uses two AWS accounts: production and development. The company stores
data in an Amazon S3 bucket that is in the production account. The data is
encrypted with an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer managed key. The
company plans to copy the data to another S3 bucket that is in the development
account.

A developer needs to use a KMS key to encrypt the data in the S3 bucket that is
in the development account. The KMS key in the development account must be
accessible from the production account,

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Replicate the customer managed KMS key from the production account to the development account. Specify the production account in the key policy.
Chose_B: Create a new customer managed KMS key in the development account. Specify the production account in the key policy.
Chose_C: Create a new AWS managed KMS key for Amazon S3 in the development account. Specify the production account in the key policy.
Chose_D: Replicate the default AWS managed KMS key for Amazon S3 from the production account to the development account. Specify the production account in the key policy.
Explain: You cannot create or modify AWS‑managed KMS keys, and they cannot be replicated. To allow cross‑account access, you must use a customer‑managed KMS key with a key policy that includes the production account.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 547
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is designing an event-driven architecture. An AWS Lambda function
that processes data needs to push processed data to a subset of four consumer
Lambda functions. The data must be routed based on the value of one field in the
data.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
Chose_A: Create an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue and event source mapping for each consumer Lambda function. Add message routing logic to the data-processing Lambda function.
Chose_B: Create an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Subscribe the four consumer Lambda functions to the topic. Add message filtering logic to each consumer Lambda function. Subscribe the data-processing Lambda function to the SNS topic.
Chose_C: Create a separate Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic and subscription for each consumer Lambda function. Add message routing logic to the data-processing Lambda function to publish to the appropriate topic.
Chose_D: Create a single Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Subscribe the four consumer Lambda functions to the topic. Add SNS subscription filter policies to each subscription. Configure the data-processing Lambda function to publish to the topic.
Explain: Using a single SNS topic with subscription filter policies is the correct way to route messages to specific consumer Lambda functions without adding routing logic to the producer.

Title:
Exam question from Amazon's AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question #: 550
Topic #: 1
[All AWS Certified Developer - Associate DVA-C02 Questions]
[/exams/amazon/aws-certified-developer-associate-dva-c02/]
Question:
A developer is building an application that stores sensitive user data. The
application includes an Amazon CloudFront distribution and multiple AWS Lambda
functions that handle user requests.

The user requests contain over 20 data fields. Each application transaction
contains sensitive data that must be encrypted. Only specific parts of the
application need to have the ability to decrypt the data.

Which solution will meet these requirements?
Chose_A: Associate the CloudFront distribution with a Lambda@Edge function. Configure the function to perform field-level asymmetric encryption by using a user-defined RSA public key that is stored in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS).
Chose_B: Integrate AWS WAF with CloudFront to protect the sensitive data. Use a Lambda function and self-managed keys to perform the encryption and decryption processes.
Chose_C: Configure the CloudFront distribution to use WebSockets by forwarding all viewer request headers to the origin. Create an asymmetric AWS KMS key. Configure the CloudFront distribution to use field-level encryption. Use the AWS KMS key.
Chose_D: Configure the cache behavior in the CloudFront distribution to require HTTPS for communication between viewers and CloudFront. Configure GoudFront to require users to access the files by using either signed URLs or signed cookies.
Explain: Field‑level encryption in CloudFront requires an asymmetric KMS key configured directly in CloudFront, which matches option C. Lambda@Edge is not used for field‑level encryption as described in option A.
